text: Bottle. Pours hazy yellow to orange with medium head. Aroma is strongly of yeast and wheat, some banana, and malts. Taste is smooth, sweet with hints of banana, lemon zest, a bit bitter and tart. Nice stuff.

At Chappys social house. Pours murky yellow with no head. Aroma of earthy wheat. Creamy mouthfeel with a hint of bananas. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Shared a bottle. Murky brown-orange. Banana aroma and taste. Wheat, caramel, malt. Not a fan of the style, I guess.

50cl bottle shared at Duinzigt, Westenschouwen. Pale orange with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice sweet and subtle bitter tones. Caramel, banana, wheat and subtle malts. Nice.
On draft at Ayinger in Munich it is a cloudy apricot color with a thick ecru head.the Aroma is banana. And the taste strong banana flavor that lingers on the palate
On draft at Ayinger in Munich. Pours a cloudy copper with a thick ecru head. Aroma of banana. Flavors of caramel and fruity esters with a bit of tartness to the finish.
Bottle from Liquor Barn. Aroma of malt, apple, some banana, and spice on the finish.

Bottle from a trade with SinH4. Thanks so much for providing me with these great brews, Stefan! 
Pours a murky amber, more brown than golden. Huge off-white head. Spicy, fruity, intense aroma. Citrus fruit, lime, orange peel, ripe banana, cinnamon, allspice, dough, the slightest hint of roasty malt, a hint of fermentation, alcohol, dark honey. Loved the fruity, tense foam! Aroma is a little sweet, a little tart, with a hint of bitterness. Medium body, lively, almost fizzy carbonation. 
Spicy, quaffable, fruity. Hell of a good Weizen. Theres a lot going on, but its well balanced.

Color miel turbio con espuma blanca Sabores cereales algo tostados dulces plátanos más intensos. Muy ligeros herbaceos y cítricos al final. Mermeladas. Cuerpo ligero algo pastoso y espumoso. Buena y sabores marcados
Deep cloudy amber, huge off-white head. Aroma: big dried banana, toasted malts, esters & phenols. Similar taste. Delicious.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

50cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Dark amber colour with white foamy head.
Aroma is wheat, banana, bread, sweet.
Taste is wheat, banana, malt, spicesc slightly yeasty.
Medium body, average carbonation.

On tap, @BBF 2017, Barcelona 26/03/17
Color amarillo dorado, aromas a levadura banana principalmente, trigo, sabor a Malta cuerpo y sabor muy agradable
On tap at BBF. Hazy golden colour with white head. Wheat and fruity aroma. Sweet, wheat, banana taste. Medium body.
Tap at Aying Restaurant, 27th March 17. Pours hazy Amber, good big head. Aroma is spice, malt, not so much banana, but some. Quite clean, very drinkable, I think I preferred the Hefe

Big fluffy cream head over a cloudy orangey amber body. Bready, mild aroma, that echoes the house character with estery bubble gum and clove. Deeper tones of raisins and dried apricots add to the soft sweetness of the nose. The flavor is a wave of rye bread  soft, with an unexpected dry grainy quality that marries well the caramelly texture and aftertaste. Harmonious but somewhat monotone, lacking intricacies or a counterbalance. Some banana, dried pear provide interesting undertones. Fluffy, drinkable texture but lacks length on the aftertaste. Perfectly drinkable, yummy, this beer is like a slice of good bread just missing a topping.

Cloudy copper/amber copper with big and fluffy white head. Light to medium body, lively carbonation, no lacing. Hefeweizen aroma of wheat, banana, cloves, buttered bread, sauteed apple and pear, citrus peel, malts and other floral scents. Smooth and pleasant taste with similar aroma, but with semi-sweet caramel and fruity (figs) aroma upfront. Low bitterness, soapy texture, medium mouthfeel. This is the beer, which Id gladly drink while enjoying an apple pie or strudel.
50cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bière. Couleur ambrée, notes de bananes et de caramel.

Color anaranjado, muy turbio, con capa de espuma blanca de tres dedos de grosor (muy buena retención). Carbonatación media tirando a alta. Textura acuosa. Aroma a plátano, pan, levadura, malta, tabaco (seco, no ardiendo). Sabor frutal, a plátano, pan, malta, con presencia de especias (muy fresco y tirando más a dulce que ácido). Muy bien balanceada. Poco retrogusto. Rica.
Keg at the brewpub. Pours deep hazy orange, nose is banana, caramel, toffee, taste is sweet, banana, creamy.

Bottle from Savor Growl: copper-orange pour, off-white head. aroma of wheat, banana, yeasty, sweet malt. tastes are lightly sweet, floral, bready, caramel, yeasty, cereal, background mineral (but not in bad way), light banana. just a tad too sweet for my tastes, but a nice interesting brew overall.
I was quite surprised with this beer. I had never heard of it before. It is definitely on my beer list now.

Ar: Banana and peach, bright and fresh, a bit underripe; doughy bread, lemon notes, and hints of bubblegum and black pepper. Ap: Deep amber, clear; very large off-white head with excellent retention, leaving a thick cap of mousse, filled with fine, tightly woven bubbles. T: Deep banana notes, with fresh dough and clove; peppery and herbal, with some brown sugar; light sweetness, which dissipates on the finish, giving way to dryness; banana is dense and pronounced throughout, constantly mingling with peach and sugary bread; low bitterness with no hop flavor. P: Medium-full body with high carbonation, but crisp impression; finish is dry. O: This beer is a joy to drink; the dense banana flavor is balanced beautifully with a full array of esters, malt notes, and spices; the sugary, slightly molasses, quality brings this into dunkelweizen territory, though it is on the lighter, brighter side for the style--but, delicious nonetheless!
Yum yum for my tum tum... A pristine top notch beer.. You wont be disappointed

Flasche 0,5l: Kräftiges Braun, kräftige Trübung, wenig feinporiger Schaum; deutliche Süße in der Nase, Malz, Malzzucker, Getreide, Karamell, Brotkruste, kräftige Hefearomen, leichte Röstaromen, nussig, etwas Schokolade; frischer malziger Körper, etwas Malzzucker, leichte dunkle Fruchtigkeit, kräftige Hefearomen, sehr cremig, sehr kräftige Kohlensäure, Röstaromen, nussig, Schokolade; angenehmer süßlich-würziger Nachgang mit deutlichen Röstaromen

500 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 for the dumbass book. The pour is a darker golden brown with a thick white head that falls down to a thick collar and film with a built of chunky lace. The aroma is full of malts and caramel and a lot of banana. There is a hint of clove and other spices with a decent maltiness. Its pretty interesting. The flavor is interesting. There is a lot of banana and clove with malt and heavy spice and a little syrup. The sweetness is borderline cloying. Its really interesting. Thebmouth feel is light and a little softly carbonated with a hint of caramel malt and a lingering banana and clove. Ugh.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. For the book. Aroma is banana, fruity, roasted malt, slight smoke, maybe coffee, bready, sweet and decent. Appearance is amber brown, hazy, light tan head. Taste is clove, spice, banana, roasted malt, fruity. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, banana and spice aftertaste. Overall, its not my favorite but solid for the style.
Hazy amber liquid with white. Aroma of wheat, caramel and banana. Tastes same, medium sweet, light bitter, light sour. Light+ body, creamy feel, average carb

Appearance: cloudy, white foam, rocky head, lasts. Aroma: wheat, smoky, bread, light metal. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, nice balance. Palate: medium body, thin feel, creamy, average carbonation, bitter sourish slightly astringent aftertaste.

Pours golden with a thick white head. Nice sweet banana aroma. There is a breadiness to it, with cloves hiding most of the banana flavor. Ive never had this style of beer that being said I like this beer and think its worth trying.

1. 2. 2017, Ljubljana. Bottled. Nice, subtle fruity aroma and classical heffeweizen taste, medium body mouthfeel with medium lasting aftertaste. Pretty well balanced and rounded.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Just a wonderful wheat beer, the way they should be made. Noy overly citrusy, nice wheat styled yeast. Very good for the style. Ayinger pub in Munich.

Bottle from Beers of Europe [191216]
Amber, very hazy, frothy bubbly white head
Aroma of soft sweet fruits, hint of sweet banana, light perfume, orange, soft spicy
Taste of soft wheat, creamy smooth yeast, soft fruits, soft light sweet sponge cake, some orange, good flavour
Palate - Medium carb and body, creamy, quite sweet, smmoth. Finish as main flavour, wheat cereal, soft yeast, light fruits 
Overall - Very good weisse, soft, easy drinking

Farbe: orange-braun 
Schaum: fluffig aber hat sich bei mir relat schnell reduziert.
Nase: Hefe, Weizen, erdig, Banane, bisschen Karamel, getrocknete Aprikose.
Geschmack: feinperlig, erdig, eher ein bisschen wässrig hinten als süß bananig wie andere Weißbiere. Dazu dominiert der erdige Weizen dann. Wasser und Brot. Nach hinten kommt dann das Hopfenbittere - auch eher die erdige Art - stärker raus. Aber es dominiert der erdige Weizen mit einem Hauch Banane.
Ziemlich guter Typ der erdigen Art - die mag ich zwar weniger gern als die bananige, aber das ist schon auch eine gute Mischung, da für ein Erdweizen relativ mild.
Вкусное пиво, красивы& цвет, хороший аромат и вкус, приятно& послевк& Годен до 06.2017. (Bottle 0,5/ 5,8%)
Overall: Sweet banana, wheat bun.Note: Bottle 500 ml at De Klomp. Reviewed 2016-11-12.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Bottle from maruhn. Nose is earthy, citrus, banana. Palate is a nice round mixture of earthy, bitter, toffee, chocolate, dried fruit, banana. Finish is short and Fruity.  Great dunkelweizen.

Aroma - fruity - apple/bannana
Color cloudy dark orange.
flavor - sweet, bannana malt 
palate is nice and clean with a fruity finish

Aroma; leaves, caramel, malts, coriander, ginger, dough, lemon, banana, white bread. Look; unclear deep amber with off white dense head.Taste; sweet malts, dough, coriander, ginger, sweet bread, banana note, lemon note - leading to a leaf-banana malted fruity finish. Feel; good body, natural carbonation. Overall; quality, premium weisse. [50cl.btl 5.8% BB.11.2016 #L6061]
Amber. Banana and cloves aroma. Full fruity flavour, and a somewhat dry taste with moderate bitterness. Medium body. Overall, a decent hefeweizen. Not my favourite beer style.

Tap @Barley Mow, Bristol
Sparse head, dark gold colour, hazy, good lacing.
Aroma: bananas, clover
Lightly sour with sweet aftertaste.
Medium body, lively
Really nice.
Duft frisk sødme blød hvede duft svag krydret smag krydret læt hvede banan smag maltet sød
Hazy orange colour, one inch dense off-white head, aroma of banana, caramel, bread, hints of lemony notes and maybe peach, or apricot, too; taste is the same; brilliant weizen

Pours an orange-golden with a very large antique white head. Fruity and malty nose. Well balanced. Soft, full mouthfeel that becomes somewhat astringent and is finely carbonated. Impressive richness in the flavor. Nice balance in malty and fruity qualities.

0,5l bottle. Pours hazy orange with big off white head. Aroma is banana, bread, yeast, slightly fruity. Taste is bread, banana, some clove. Medium body with lively carbonation, quite spicy dry finish with some light bitterness.

Tap at Ayinger Bräustüberl. Dominant clover over banana and coriander. Medium body with a decent sweetness, chewy, almost like a chewing gum. Lively carbonation seducing the tongue. Long wheat palate. Very nice

[backlog] 26-08-15 / bottle at home. Malty and yeasty. Bread crumbs aroma with some fruity banana. More complex than the Bräu-Weisse. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 4/5
#844Tap. Hazy ochre body, high off-white head. Aroma of wheat, honey, touch of caramel. Taste is sweet and sour. Wheat, caramel, honey. Medium body and carbonation. Not bad.

Bottle. Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. Cloudy, light brown. Thick, fairly dense, lasting, off white head. Nose has yeasty granary bread. Soft banana and bubblegum notes. Hint of raisin and toffee. Taste is light sweet, with a little fruity tang. Foamy mouthfeel. Nice and massaging. Fruity tangy notes on the finish. Very nice.
Bottle @ Alte Pinakothek, MÜnchen. Brown colour, beige foam. Nose of banana, caramel, light roastiness, toast and bread. Smooth and drinkable. Very nice Dunkelweizen.
Draught at Ayingers, Munich. Hazy, ochre to light brown colored. AROMA- wheat, honey, caramel. FLAVOR- smooth, lightly sweet and sour, wheat, honey, caramel. Medium bodied. Not bad.
Shared bottle. Pours a hazy copperish-amber with a large off-white persistent head. Aroma of wheat, banana, and spice. Taste is wheat banana, spice, bread, hints of apple. Good.

On tap at Ayingers Speis und Trank . Pours a paler brown than other dunkelweizen Ive had; cloudy caramel rather than dark brown, though still a thick head. The aroma manages to penetrate the head, and theres malts and a little banana there. Taste up front is banana, with a little chocolate and bread. Finish is spiced dried fruit.

Aroma: malty and grassy; Appearance: hazy amber pour with white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: fairly rich and malty with banana undertones; Palate: medium-heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: better than a hefeweizen but still a tad banana-y. Would probably not seek out again.
$3.59 bottle, Wine Warehouse. Pours hazy amber with a gigando head. Aroma is banana, bread crumbs. Taste is ripe banana, light caramel malts, light metals. Tasty.

AROMA-Malt aroma is medium wheat, light caramel, toffee. Medium-light banana ester. Light spicy, clove.

APPEARANCE-Amber, cloudy, smooth head.

FLAVOR-Medium malt sweetness, caramel, toffee. Light spicy flavor, clove. Light ester, banana and light fruity sourness. Balance is phenol and malty. Low bitterness. Dry finish. Aftertaste is light dark malt sweetness and light fruity sour.

MOUTHFEEL-Medium body, powdery. Medium-high carbonation, refreshing.

OVERALL-Excellent dunkle, refreshing with good complexity.

500ml bottle. Medium-sized white head. Cloudy caramel-like colour. Sweet aroma with hints of peach, banana and licorice. Yeasty taste and a lasting palate with hints of roast, licorice and caramel. Excellent beer!

Bottle from Beerdock, Nantwich. Pours a cloudy amber colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of vanilla, bready malts, banana, clove, some caramel, slight spice and subtle orange. Taste of bready malts, vanilla, banana, spice, some caramel, slight clove, a little wheat and subtle orange zest. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dryish, bready, spicy bitterness in the finish. Not dark and roasty enough to be a dunkelweizen, but as a Weissbier its gorgeous. A lovely sweet, vanilla bread aroma followed by a rich, traditional Weissbier flavour with a hint of spice and citrus. Lovely.
Lovely amber colour, large head. Aromas of banana, bread and some fruit, the yeast dominates. Very smooth taste, refreshing and pleasant, dry finish. Overall an excellent beer.

bottle. Brown with one finger head. Medium body. Banana and dark fruit. Light cocoa. Very smooth and pleasant. Theres something very German about this, which isnt surprising -- just a dumb observation.

On tap at the Ayingers Wirtshaus in Munich. Color is dark orange with a creamy head. Aroma is yeasty, wheat malt, and a twist of something dank - in the direction of moldy basement. Taste is bread, banana, apple, and spice. Body is medium to full. Finish is crisp and a touch sweet. Good stuff.
Dark amber, murky and cloudy, but with a big clean white head. Wheaty body, frothy and well carbonated. Lots of bready malt, banana, apple and clove. Very good.
Bottle. Pours a dark orange colour with a fluffy white head, aroma is all wheat, the taste is medium bitterness with some sweetness coming through, with a dry bitter finish.
Aromas of banana, bread and caramel. Cloudy brown. Small head. Malty refreshing and fruity. A bit dry but overall excellent.

Yum-o, great dunkel! Appearance had a huge, thick, creamy head. Aroma is typical traditional Bavarian hefeweizen. Flavors where its really good - with qualities that go perfectly with the palate: fruit, yeast, rye bread, and a bit tart on the finish. Body is soft up front and a bit crisp from carbonation in the back. Super drinkable! Want to try it on draft.

Bottle from BevMo! in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is sweet floral, banana bread maybe. Very creamy, sweet floral with a vanilla bread pudding thing going on. One of the best floral, vanilla, cream beers Ive had.
How: tap Appearance: dark brown with a large off-white head,. Aroma: banana, bread, herbs and some spice. Palate: medium body, soft carbonation.
Trübes dunkles Berrnstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, reichlich Hefe, fruchtig, Banane, etwas Karamell, mild.
Sampled @ Ayinger am Platz, Starkbierzeit 2016. Túlságosan hideg, az íze az ízlik, bizsereg a szájban mint a zizi. Egy jó bajor búzasör de nem különleges. Élesztős, jó a színe és banános.

May 15. On tap at the brewery restaurant, Munich. It poured hazy orange body with medium sized head. Bold and really nice wheat aroma, rich fruits, cereals, pleasant amount of yeast. Flavor was, style wise, lightly sweet, less rich than aroma with nice balance of wheat flavors with that interesting soaked cereal note that was hinted in its nose. Lightly bitter and spicy too. Full bodied with moderately long finish following the flavor. Not really a Dunkelweizen, both by color and character but an excellent and tasty German wheat anyway!

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Cigarette City. Aroma is bread, cereal, fruit/banana with hint of cloves and yeasty dried leaves. Appearance is cloudy light brown/orange with tons of sparkle at the sides of the glass, three-finger width foamy off-white head with good retention and trace lacing. Taste is light banana, tart apple with a touch of clove. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with creamy/foamy texture and average to soft carbonation and yeasty dry finish. Overall, a good brew whose strengths are not in the power of aromas/flavors but in their breadth.

Bottle from Brewdog Online Shop, shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours murky brown with a think white head. Aromas of toffee, banana, spiced bread. Taste is more of the same. Nice creamy texture, clean finish. Solid.

Une vraie belle surprise ! Une bouche superbement fruitée puis légèrement sèche pour finir sur une magnifique amertume. Jadore cette bière que je trouve plus quinteressante au vu de son prix très raisonnable. Je recommande !

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl.
Appearance - cloudy dirty brown with a decent fluffy head. 
Nose - toffee and banana. Not much spice, but maybe the toffee is drowning it out. 
Taste - really creamy with a nice layer of toffee. But the creaminess comes back on the finish.
Palate - close to medium bodied with a nice creamy texture and a long and balanced tapering finish.
Overall - a very nice dunkelweizen.
Bottled. Nose is very yeasty. Pours a hazy brown beer. Aromas of malt and yeast. Medium texture and carbonation.
Pours muddy amber with medium white head. Nose is yeast and banana. Aromas are yeasty, bananas, spices, cereals, Average carbonation, medium body. Medium sweet and fruity finish.
Hazy , amber/orange color. Huge , white head. Aroma of bread , malt , yeasts and some fruits. Sweet , malty taste with domination of bread . Tasted close to kvas for me . Very good beer.
Bottle at home. Pours murky brown, big white pillowy head. Aroma of spices and banana. Some yeast in there too. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Really good.

Cor âmbar com tons amarelados, turva e com um bom perlage; espuma cremosa, de cor marfim com altas formação e persistência; pouco lacing.
Aroma intenso de banana em primeiro plano com toques de torrado, pão e maçã em segundo plano.
Sabor de início de banana evoluindo para um meio picante; final de picância intensa, um leve dulçor de maçã e um leve torrado finalizando com amargor comportado mas assertivo. 
Retrogosto amargo com leves torrado e banana.
Corpo leve e alta carbonatação.
Faz jus ao estilo UrWeiss, cerveja clara de trigo com complexidade mais elaborada.

Love this brewery. Pours light brown with lasting white half-finger head. Aroma is banana foremost with bread, bubblegum, and some spice. Flavor profile follows nose to a tee. Very smooth mouthfeel and slightly sweet yet clean finish. Great stuff.
Sensationell, großartiges Aroma von geröstetem Malz, dezenter Schokolade und hintergründigem Bananemaroma.

Bottle (from firma bier). Pours hazy amber-brown with whiteish head. The head stays for some moments. Aroma is fruits, banana, caramel, some citrus. Flavor is sweet, caramel, fruits, banana, wheat. Finish is caramel sweetness and wheat. Overall: good, bit sweet maybe.

Pours murky brown with big frothy off-white head. Aroma is soft banana, yeast, bread, dough. Not dry, light bitter, round and soft mouthfeel. Palate is oily, body is medium. Very enjoyable, not the freshest of fresh, but smooth and slick.

Originally rated on 8/31/08. Ur-weisse pours a deep, murky brown body, the yeast didnt break up well leaving lots of big sediment. It kinda of reminded me of pond or river water after torrential rains. Mid sized head that left no trace of lace. Aroma of banana, cloves and bubblegum were faint but present. Flavor was similar to the aroma. Mouthfeel was very nice, creamy and full. Although not my favorite style its a pretty good brew.

500 mL bottle poured to an Ayinger glass. Copper orange pour with a white foam head. Sweet, fruity, banana like aroma. Flavor is wheaty orange fruit, banana, and apple. Fruit dominates the malt bill. Lingering sweetness. Everything I expected this to be. Pretty good, but too sweet.

Pours hazy, non transparent, brownish orange color with big and creamy, slightly off-white head. Absolutely beautiful appearance. Smell is rich, herbal and fruity.

Full body with prickly carbonation. Nice and creamy texture. Taste balances between sour and sweet, with sweetness dominating mostly the aftertaste. Aroma of wheat, grass, herbs, fruits and spices. Lovely complexity and excellent balance.

This one is incredibly tasty. Pure class.
Flasche - Schlammfarben mit schöner Schaumkrone. Aromen von feuchtem Bananenbrot, Toffee, Malz. Nicht zu süß, im Abgang trocken. Perfekt ausbalanciert! Süffig.

Drinked from bottle, bought in BottleDog Kings Cross. Look: lovely gold colour, hazy, pretty big white head, but after moment reduced to a small layer. Aroma: strong banana flavour, bit of cloves, malt makes is smell bit sweet.
Taste: mix of all the basic flavours, really nice balance, easy drinking beer.
Palate: Med- full body, average carbonation, pretty long finish with lot of spicy stuff. Excellent beer!

Dark brown color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, bananas, clove, & brown sugar; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, clove, fruit (notably apples), some caramel, and spice; Nicely balanced & complex; Very good dunkelweizen.

500ml bottle. Pours hazy gold, good white head. Weiss esters wafting pleasantly out the glass. Smooth taste with good vibrant yeast. Beautifully balanced. This has to be one of the best weissbiers out there.
Aroma is deep fried banana, dried fruit, caramel. Taste is a tiny bit sweet, more sour (mostly by carbonation) not bitter. Full body, smooth texture. Very nice. Perfectly balanced everything.

500ml bottle into a Hofbrau Haus Munchner Kindl Weissebier glass at home on 25th Feb 2016 after an hours walking in the bright sunshine. Murky orange body with plenty of carbonation bubbles rising up to the large cream coloured foaming head. The nose has a yeasty, vanilla and ripe banana aroma, the taste follows along in the same way with the three aforementioned smells also being the main flavours in the taste. Most likely the best Weizen of any colour/style I have had so far in my drinking life.

(Ayinger Ur-Weisse) Bottle 500 ml at home, served into a weizen glass, ABV 5.8%
Dark orange colour on the body, hazy, with good activity in it. Tall and thick snow white head on top, with very good retention.
Aroma is heavy on wheat, banana, yeast. 
Taste follows, wheat of course, plenty of banana and pears, light clove, yeast.
Medium body, good carbonation, smooth on the palate.
Good.

L:
-pours an opaque golden-brown with a medium,creamy,white head
-high carbonation visible
S:
-banana,lemon,earthy,leather,clove,wh bread,passionfruit,pineapple,bubble gum
T:
-overripe banana,clove,lemon,white bread,passionfruit,bubble gum,honey,cream,toffee
F:
-medium carbonation
-medium,creamy body
O:
Fantastic Hefeweizen (not a Dunkelweizen).Sweet and full-bodied.

Pours a hazy sunny orange color, topped with a big foamy head, white nad quickly settling. Typical wheat nose - some banana with lots of spices. Not really sweet, just a tad, with a fairly spicy taste. Medium body. Nicely enjoyable. A good weizen.

Drunk straight from the bottle, wished I could have poured it but I had bigger and better things to do this holiday season. Fantastic beer, hint of sugar in the initial taste. The sugar becomes a stronger bite of fruitcakey malt. Excellent blend of sweetness without becoming cloying. Would buy and drink again soon.
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Ayinger Ur-Weiss pours a dense opaque brown that brings to mind a rich cider more than a beer. The aroma is bready, fruitcake and cloves. Med-full bodied the taste is wheat cakes, apples, cloves, honey. Tasty and easy to drink.

On tap at Munich brewpub. A very cloudy brownish dark orange with a thick, resilient white head. Aroma is wheat, orange, spice, herbs and coriander. Flavor is fruits (banana, orange, pineapple). Finish is lots of spice (pepper, clove, mint), roast and toast. Lingering pepper, herbs and residual sugars. Medium body, soft, velvety mouthfeel and average carbonation.
Brownish color with a solid foam head. The smell has banana and some yeast. The taste is calm and round a has banana notes as well and finishes in a calm aftertaste.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
One of better dunkelweizen I tried. Nice caramely and fruity taste, medium sweet and very drinkable!

E una weizen scura come stile dichiarato. Il suo colore è ocra, quasi marroncino, con ottimi riflessi dorati. Ha un bel cappello di schiuma fine bianca e persistente. Al naso note fruttate (banana e uva) predominano la bevuta, con note di cereale di sottofondo. Il sentore alcolico è presente. Al palato è ben carbonata, ma le bollicine finissime e il corpo esile ne esaltano la bevuta. In bocca ancora tanto fruttato, ma anche una spinta componente acidula. Amaro quasi impercettibile.

50 cl, bottled. BB 05.16. Pours hazy orange with a very nice white head. Aroma: Fruits, banana. Lots of yeasty notes, bakers yeast. Cellar tones. Taste: Medium sweet, yeasty flavours. Pleasant bitterness. Wheat. Some pleasant acidity. Hints of caramel and green apples. Nutty tones. Palate: Near medium body, notable, maybe slightly stingy carbonation. Pleasant mild spicy tones in the end. Very nice one.

Bottle. Ambery hazy. Ripe banana, wheat malty, slight herby nose. Med bodied, slight sweet, ripe estery flavour. Nice flaviurs, missing some of the good peppers from weihen to make it great tho. Solid weiss still.-- bb

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 10B). Bottle 50 cl - Batch L5139. AROMA: very nice aroma with a mix of notes of clove, banana and bubblegum that transforms into a slight caramel and bready-like malt background. APPEARANCE: ambar color and hazy. moderate moussy ivory head with average retention. TASTE: moderate caramelized-like banana flavour with bread crust notes and slight caramel. some clove is present. background of slightly sweet wheat malt. low bitterness with a semi-dry finish. PALATE: medium body with a slight fluffy sensation. moderate carbonation. OVERALL: an outstanding urweisse with all the bells and whistles.

Una weiss dal colore un pó particolare, che vira verso il dorato scarico, leggermente velata. La banana predomina sui sentori al naso, anche se un buon bouquet di cereali e fieno vengono fuori ad un esame più attento. Molto beverina, scivola via come lacqua. Lamaro ed il dolce sono equilibrati anche se una persistenza secca induce ad una bevuta semplice e rinfrescante. Buona hefe...

Bottle from BottleDog, Edinburgh. Hazy bronze body with a thin white head. Nice lacing. Aroma of dusty orange and white pepper. Flavour of wheat, straw and apricot. Medium body with a powdery texture. Lively fizz. A solid Dunkelweizen.

Brown cloudy beer, white nice head on top. Aroma has lots of wheat malts, some fruity notes, banana too. Taste is malty, some banana but mainly wheat with caramel sweetness. Medium body and quite high carbonation.

0.5 l bottle from biernavigatie, bottled in July 2015. Hazy, golden orange with a huge, creamy, almost stable, tan head. Faint, yeasty-spicy aroma of banana, nuts and vanilla. Sweetish, yeasty-spicy taste of banana, vanilla, honeydew and some clove, followed by a short, slightly sourish and yeasty-chalky finish. Medium to full body, rather creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very well-balanced, rather spicy and really creamy. Simple but delicious and convincing.

aroma: bread, toast, floral, dough, banana, bubblegum, raisin.
appearance: pale, golden, hazy, white foam, minimal head. 
taste: light sweetness, lightly sour. 
palate: light body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish. 
overall: a well balanced, drinkable beer

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 Hazy brown color with thick off-white head. Aroma has banana, yeast, slight spices. Taste is sweet bananas, wheat, some caramel. High carbonation. Overall very solid dunkelweizen.

Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival 2015. Clear golden beer with a rich and lasting offwhite head. Malty caramel aroma, bready, citrus, grapes, floral, some wheat and spices. Malty caramel flavor, wheat, hay, floral notes, caramel, herbal, some spices. Nice clean beer.

Aroma: banana, yeast, wheat and grain malt, some light bubblegum. Appearance: dark, hazy brown, massive, creamy, off-white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: light bitterness continue, malty sweets, caramel, wheat and banana, lively carbonation, full body. Overall: excellent Dunkelweizen, intense and complex. Bottle from beermerchants.com, Larkfield.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle.

A: Pours medium-dark orange-amber topped by a sizable, thick, off-white head . Good retention with streaks of lacing. 

Aroma: Earthy-herbal hops, banana bread, apples, clove and light toast.

Flavor: good complexity but featuring banana bread and other (mainly) yeast derivatives. Also has light clove and faint spices, caramel, dark fruits, sweet malts, and some faint earthy hops.

M: Medium body; prickly, moderate-high carbonation; smooth and crisp.

O: not a favored style but certainly an excellent version.
Dark golden with a fizzy head. Aroma is coffee, banana and slight spice. Bubblegum and banana, clove. Very good example of a style I dont ever really drink.

Light haze, orange colored, fizzy beige head. Sweet & spicy, bananas & cloves...phenols. Interesting with a slight tartness up front of the malty, fruity sweetness. Plenty of spice, allspice, cloves, nutmeg, sweet but not overly cloying. The tartness is......yeasty. A bit over carbonated for my palate.

Medium sweet to light roasted malty aroma and taste, wheaty, caramel, banana, some spices, sweet malty finish.

Color is half way between a Hefeweizen and a Dunkelweizen, dark amber color with medium white head. Aroma has intense notes of overriped banana, cloves, caramel and bubblegum. Taste follows the aroma, very sweet, with banana, spices, sweet sugar and yeast. Really nice.
500ml bottle from BeerHouse Tverskaya. Pours cloudy dark brown with a big beige head. Aroma is caramel, banana, bubblegum. Taste is yeast, banana, cloves. Great beer.
Aroma of wheat, malt, banana, yeast, clove, spicy notes. Flavour is moderate sweet with a light bitter finish. Potent and full body for a German Weizen. Pretty good, especially for the style.

50cl bottle, cloudy hazy dark orange colour with a white head on top. a fruity aroma of orange ripe banana, wheat, coriander, citrus, yeasty. Sweet banana in the taste with an average mouthfeel. pretty nice

Tap at GJBF Osaka 2015. Wow! Full, fresh, thick banana shake nose. Dirty light brown color, with a creamy, fluffy head. Thick, near candyish, sweet initial, with a punch of citrus entering soon after, wheaty sweet throughout. Heavy body for a hefe. Smooth and delicious.
Bottle at Beerville Bar, Belgrade. Darker, creamy brown gold. Small cream head. Malt, ripe banana, body is full, a bit of fresh herb and grain, grass but lots of banana. Nice, rich weiss.

Spina al brewpub.
Ambrata torbida con schiuma persistente.
Banana, corpo pienotto, buona

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2016 A typical bavarian beer and the taste of banana is present and a bit creamy. The colour is brown-copper-yellow. When the weather is hot is a nice kind of beer to drink. I drank it again on the mountains in the region of Valais. The taste is great and we could notice a touch of cloves and plum. This beer is perfect with meat or "boeuf bourguignon".

Turva.âmbar,espuma volumosa e cremosa como manda o estilo,boa carbonatação;no aroma malte,fermento,banana e cravo;sabor frutado,adocicado sem ser enjoativo,refrescante,alta drinkability,final seco com o dulçor do frutado ficando no retrogosto. Boa Weizen,uma das melhores que já provei,recomendo.
Bold roasty wheat taste. Perfect amount of spice (coriander?). Great balance of weight, not too heavy, not too light. Overall great beer. Prost Ayinger Urweisse!
Ottima dunkel weisse, con sapore non troppo dolce. Si presenta con un colore dorato scuro. Ha un gusto speziato, e lascia un piacevole retrogusto.

Caoba turbio y espuma color canela algo ligera. Aromas intensos de plátano, mermelada de fruta naranja y clavo. Cuerpo ligero de carbonatación lata, sabor dulce de mermelada y plátano, nuevamente, con toque especiado y tostado y final de amargor débil y ligeramente seco.

Translucent orange with a brown haze. Mid sized beige head. Mediocre fragrance containing notes of heavy yeast, malt, banana, and alcohol. Extremely smooth and creamy texture. Robust yeast, malt, caramel, banana, very mild chocolate, with a slightly bitter finish. Good.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A brown orange opaque beer ; bubbly ; big off-white creamy head ; good retention. Fruity aroma (banana), roast, cereal, herbs, light clove. Medium sweet, light dry bitter refreshing. Light to medium body ; medium nearly oily texture ; average carbonation ; dry fruity spicy finish. Overall, a pleasant refreshing "fruity" dunkelweizen ; light spicy.
Bottle pours out a nice golden topped with a sand head. Nose is banana bread clove yeast and a nice spice. Taste is more of the banana clove spice and a very nice end.
Very tasty beer, malty and boosie, nice color and head, a bit seething and perhaps a bit watery compared to the doppelbock, very good will buy again
Rated based on notes taken 19 May 2012 -- Despite a lot of anti-hef sentiments Ive read and seen from my friends lately, I love them. And this is a good example.
Cor âmbar, turva. Espuma boa, bege, cremosa e de média persistência. No aroma banana e malte torrado. Paladar frutado, maltado e vivaz. Corpo leve e retrogosto de amargor suave.

Lovely golden-blonde color. Thick head dissipates slowly. Complex, spicy aromatics distinguish this brew from most others. The taste rings all my bells--I love this beer. Thirst quenching and lively yet with surprising depth and presence. A favorite.

Pours a hazy orange/ brownish/ amber color with an off white bubbly medium head. Aroma is spice clove with some peppery notes. Flavor is same pepper with some banana notes and a slight malt sweetness, rather dry finish for the style, moreish. Medium to light palate, refreshing, quenching and tasty.

0.5l bottle. Hazy deep orange body, off-white head. Huge banana and caramel notes in the aroma with peach and some cloves. The taste is quite fruity. Mostly banana and ripe peach escorted by caramel, lemon zest and cloves. Awesome weizen.

Interesting thing: this beer is dunkelweizen, but its colour is not dark. It is muddy brown with creamy off-white head. Aroma is ob barley malts, wheat, bread, bananas and plums. Taste is similar complex, firstly sweet with fruity notes, in finish is little bitter with notes of bread and malts. But fruity notes predominate. Very good beer.

500mL bottle from Wegmans in Fayetteville. Pours a hazy dark amber color with a quickly disappearing off-white head. High carbonation in this one. Not alot of aroma but what I can detect is malty. Nice thick mouthfeel. Tastes of malt, a little caramel, bready notes, classic weizen spiciness. Finish is slightly bitter and malty. Very good beer, I would definitely buy again.

Poured from a 500 ML bottle into a pint glass
Aroma- Has an awesome yeast and fruit smell
Appearance-- Pours a murky dark amber color with a medium sized tan head
Taste- Fantastic yeast and wheat flavor mixed with spices.
Palate- A medium bodied beer with medium-high carbonation 
Overall- Incredible beer, if its not on your beer list add it!

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2016 Just wow. Not totally dunkel but not a golden yellow weisse either. So what the hell is it? Brilliant! Complex with some roasted malt flavor and a bit more booze. This little amber weisse is something special. Bottle from Hopfen and malz Berlin
Bottle, 0,5l. Hazy, dark orange colour with big, beige, frothy head.Average carbonation. Aroma of banana and yeast. Sweet fruity banana taste. Overall delicious and very refreshing beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark orange with a non-lasting off white bubbly head. Aroma is of banana, clove, caramel. Taste is of apple, pear, banana, clove. Smooth oily mouthfeel, light carbonation. Very nice.
Bottle. Free lounge beer at STR. Clear deep amber color, medium off white head. Aroma is mostly caramel. Taste is lightly spiced fruit.

Old german type, high quality Ur-Wisse. In good old type bottle of 0,5 l. Honey caramel colour. Very much cloudy, almost milky, so nice The top is in sophisticate beige white colour and is very big and stable. Dominant banana flavour, but also in some sophisticate way.
Bernsteinfarben, gleichmäßige Trübung. Frischhefiger Geruch, Karamell. Angenehme, nicht zu aufdringliche Süße. Vollmundig. Sehr schönes bernsteinfarbenes Hefeweissbier

Bottle 0.5l at Pivopija NBGD Belgrade Serbia.31.03.2015.Taste with ippopotamo36.Ciao Al!Pour it little bit dark orange color with medium white head but Im not sure beacuse of the sun.On the nose strong banana,chewing gum smell.Taste and aroma banana,cloves,wheat,finish with some sour peach.Very good balanced.I liked it very much.

Bottle at Pivopija beer shop in Novi Beograd- Serbia with markoijelena. Pours dark orange skin, cloudy with a frothy tick head. Nose: white bread, garlic, banana. Mouth: banana forward, garlic again, bread as well. Nothing to say, a style I don't go for but this one has character. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from beer club. Pours cloudy medium amber, nice white head. Not a bad beer but beside yeast, bread and some fruit to taste it also had cloves, not a fan of cloves.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a hazy dark golden color, off-white head, some lacing. Aroma is clove, banana, and spice. Flavor has some spicy notes with a strong malt backbone. Overall a delicious beer.
Espuma muito volumosa. A primeira impressão é que seria excepcional, mas nenhum elemento se destaca e é bem equilibrada. Se fosse mais barata, daria pra levar e tomar o dia inteiro no churrasco.
Cloudy, Brown pour with a white head. The aroma has wheat and some mild fruit. It has a light body with smooth texture and average carbonation. The taste sweet all the way through.
Bottled. A friend of mine introduced me to this beer and brought me 10 bottles. One word: a fantastic hefe weizen! A banana, clove and malt paradise! What do you want more? Another one of course!

Bottle at home. Pours dark copper color with thick white head. Aroma is spicy, slight yeast, pepper, bread and caramel. Taste is nicely balanced spices, faint yeast, sweet bread and cloves. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel, hight carbonation. Great beer.
Alaranjada, escura, turva e com boa formação de espuma. Notas frutadas, banana, cravo e cereais. Corpo de leve pra médio com final curto e adocicado
Dense long lasting head. Excellent aroma with a very good ester taste, maybe a little disappointing in the aftertaste but overall very satisfying

Good Dark Weiss specimen. Everything a Hefeweizen has but with the addition of roasted malt flavor, a bit of toasted nut, and some lighter fruit flavors (not citrus though). Slight tart with good carb following the relatively sweet flavor.
Bottle, 500 ml form Pivoljub, Ljubljana. Pours orange with off-white head. Malt, caramel, yeast, wheat, banana fruity. Sweet.
500ml bottle at Fool Heaven, Shenzhen. Didnt realise this was classified as a dunkel. Pours hazy golden brown with a white head. Aroma of banana and clove.
500ml bottle at Bierhof Athens. Hazy dark orange color with white head. Fruity aroma, banana, citrus, yeasty. Sweet bannaa taste, light orange. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

500 ml bottle. Pours slightly cloudy and light golden amber. Aroma of chestnut malts, banana, light clove and yeasty wheat. Mouthful is creamy light and effervescent. Delicious wheat, yeast, banana and malt dominate the flavor profile.
Karamellig, Hefe, Banane, Nelke, Gewürze. Süßlich, bananig, leicht herb, süffig, cremig.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 
Appearance: cloudy amber with firm oof-white head. 
Aroma: citric hops, some yeast and malt. 
Taste: light banana, sour bitter. 
Palate: refreshing, lasting sour bitter, medium carbonation. 
Overall: very nice.

Poured from a pint bottle into a weizen glass in late 2013.

A: Large, fluffy head. Beautiful caramel color.

S: Banana, wheat.

T: Banana, wheat, some caramel and banana bread crust sweetness. Delicious.

M: Creamy smooth.

O: I loved this one. The banana flavor was not overwhelming, but nicely balanced. It had a bit more malt flavor than a regular hef. This is my favorite dunkel.
This is a wonderful beer. It is one of my favorites and is my favorite Hefeweizen!

Ayinger Ur-Weisse (DE) - Dunkelweizen - 5.8% - 4.4/5
On tap at Ayinger Braustuberl, Aying, august 2014. (also bottled, right now)
Dark orange to hazelnut color, obviously cloudy, enormous white head, magnificent. Not dark as other dunklers. 
Quite perfumed, not excessively though.
Intense weizen aroma (wheat), sugary malts, fuity and spicy. Banana, peach, yellow fruits with hints of lemon. Doughy yeast, yet not too invading. Alcohol reminded me of whiteboard marker, thus bottled i didnt find this. Some grassy hops comes to say hello thru the finish.
Articulated fruity taste, sweetish, slightly sour, full bodied, long finish with an amaretto/almond thing, very tasty. Proper carbonation, dusty to creamy texture, very fluffy. Excellent. WOW, the finish is just superb, sticky, ultra-umami.
Also bottled after 5 months doesnt lose its freshness. Probably this is THE dunkelweizen, either not really dunkel, its a powered up weizen, simple, classic, elegant. A whoppy 4.4 for a classic non-experimental beer? Well, yes. Pick your bags, go to Aying on a nice summer day, sit at their stube and have one of this. You wont be in need for any Double IPA, Quadrupel or whathever. Just enjoy.

Off white creamy head. Cloudy dark amber colour. Aroma is malty, fruity with citrus, apple and pear notes, with very light roasty and caramel notes. Flavor is malty with fruity (pear and apricot) and biscuits tones, ending in a moderately fruity and slighty candy finish. Medium bodied.
Poured from bottle. Hazy dark yellow color with white head. Banana and cloves in aroma, also in flavor. Medium body, lively carbonation.
Bottle. Cloudy copper colour, stable head. Aroma banana, weizeny. Taste is banana, bubblegum, light solventy. Quite good all in all.
Bottle by Tomas. Pours hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is sweet, yeasty, spicy. Taste is lightly sour, lightly sweet, banana, clove.

Bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy amber body under a one finger foamy white head that had decent retention. The nose is slightly fruity and estery with a fair amount of yeastiness. A light hint of bubble gum, and a hint of light toasted malt. The flavor is pretty classic, some lightly roasted malt, nice yeastiness, some fruity esters, and seemingly a hint of alcohol on the late finish. Light to medium bodied with soft fizzy carbonation and a lingering finish. Pretty classic example of the style, enjoyable.
Tried the beer, botle is nothing special, taste is above average, aroma is not so strong

Super cloudy dark golden yellow color. Arguably the cloudiest beer Ive ever seen. Everything inside seems to just stand still.

The aroma is not like a typical hefe: yeast softness; dark, pungent fruits; an herbal spiciness, not unlike cloves. Orange zest with a prickly spice. Hint of green apple and red apple skins too.

The flavor is mashed plums, cinnamon on apple sauce. Bread dough. A definite basement funk to the flavor. Touch of apricot, but not the cloying, sugary kind I hate in beers.

Feels juicy and slick on the palate. This is a crowd-pleaser: lots of darkish flavors, but nothing burnt. Lots of sweetish flavors, but nothing saccharine. Beautifully balanced for a very cold autumn evening.

50cl, finally got time to review this. Pours an abundant off white dense head, amber to brown deep cloudy colour, golden reflex. Very nice bready, caramel, crystal malts, very light toasted,  fruity esters and yeasty multigrain smell; and wow, thats complex. Tastes malts at their best, nice fruit/dried fruits, caramel, apple, yeasty, sweet spiced finish; right medium sweetness never overdone, light tartness. (a strüdel in a glass...).Medium to full creamy body, almost lively carbonation but softer than most hefeweizen. Between the top wheat beers and one of my favs, probably the best Ayinger

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2015 Very hazy brown color with great wet foam. Ripe bananas, spices, maybe cinnamon. It has that little special something in the aroma, some bubblegum and honey. Taste is not as interesting, but very solid. The banana blends in perfectly with the yeasts. The kick which the Bräuweisse has in the finish is not there, but the finish is very pleasant, with a warming booziness that nearly blends into plum aromas. Refreshing and smooth. Super Dunkelweizen.

Opaque dark orange, off-white lasting lacing foam head. Citrus aroma, although not dominant, cold climate fruits tones also. Light citrus again in taste, fruits again, some bread, a warm taste. (Velp 201411)

This was an enjoyable beer. Pours an amber color with a thick white head. The nose is sweet and can smell the malt. On the palate it's just what is described, hints of fruit and spice. Overall a good beer with complex flavor.

Birra biondo ocra. Due dita di schiuma consistenza panna, duratura e splendida. Aromi di pesche e albicocche, oltre che di miele dacacia. Sapore di albicocche, fragole ed un po di burro mielato. Retrogusto allalbicocca, mentre il finale è secco e maltoso. Buona birra
"this is about as good as it gets. ive had this style where it tasted heavily spiced, and harsh. this one is far from that. nice aroma, great head, body, full flavored."
Very malty white beer. Sweet aroma and a small banana aftertaste. Very different lingering aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2014 Bottle. Almost clear copper to brownish color with a white frothy and lasting head. Sweet spicy, Malty, with pear, bananas, bread, wheat, cloves. Dry finish a quite metallic with some leather.

Pours hazy brown, with big biege head. Aroma of bananas, 
, cereal. Taste is similar. Medium carbonation.
Dark golden-brown, large creamy white head, spotty lacing. Warmed whole-grain bread, soft pear, and delicate clove. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and semi-sweet maltiness throughout.
Bottle 50cl. Pours hazy amber color with creamy off-white head. Aroma - banana and fruits.
(bottle - 500 ml) Hazy brownish pour with a thin head. Very light wheat and banana and spice aroma. Sweet spice and a lot of banana notes at the start with a lightly dry wheat middle.
Bottled from deciccos a few months ago. Slightly brownish golden pour, yeasty breadiness and sour apples. PRetty good stuff.

~Rich bready malt aroma, light chocolate, caramel, and melanoidins (malliard reactions)
~Pours a cloudy golden color with small lasting white head.
~Rich sweet bready malts, caramel, clove spice, and melanoidins (malliard reactions) in flavor.
~medium full bodied, medium CO2, sweet bready finish.
~Great dunkelweizen, well balanced and complex, very enjoyable

Slightly cloudy orange to copper pour with a tall, frothy beige head. Aroma is heavy on banana and clove, lots of breadiness, sweet wheat, sharp, over ripe tree fruit, toast, doughy yeast, spicy yeast and a hint of toffee. Flavor is sweet and fruity up front, with over ripe apples and bananas, then some softer doughy yeast notes than the aroma indicates, sweet wheat bread, a little clove and some light caramel apple pie filling. Medium body, creamy, slightly floury feel throughout and light to medium, soft and blanketing carbonation. Good stuff, definitely up there as far as Dunkelweizens go.

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy, dark orange-brown colour with a huge, creamy, beige head. Sweet aroma of fruity yeast, banana, pears, sweet malt, some roasted malt and rye bread. The flavour is also sweet and fruity with more banana, herbs and wheat. Slick mouth feel, and has a light bitterness. A fruity and nice weizen. I expected a richer body though.

Hazy amber color with off white foam. Aroma of herbs, citrus and grass I think. Great ballance between sweetness and fruityness and the bitterness in the taste with the bitterness lingering. The yeast seems dominant in the taste but in a good way.
As cervejas Weiss desta marca me surpreenderam pelo sabor e o aroma. Boa pedida!!!!!!!

Bottle; pours a caramel color with a thin off white head; aroma is wheat, banana, and some light spices; taste is sweet with caramel, yeast, and fruit; has a slight sourness to it before a dry finish; not much bitterness; very nice Dunkel

Very cloudy brown color, average sized creamy white head with good retentdion. Solid amount of lacing. Medium body, average to high carbonation. Aroma of wheat, yeast and banana. Medium sweet taste with spicy aftertaste. Very interesting.

Pours muddy amber with high of white head
Aromas of bananas, spices, wheat, bread
Taste nice fresh citrusy, bananas, yeast, wheat, hints of roasted malts
Foamy mouthfeel high carbonation. Nice one

Poured from bottle into a weizen glass
 Appearance  The beer pours a hazy deep amber color with a huge thick and creamy just off-white head. The head has an amazing level of retention, very slowly fading to leave a fantastic level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass. This is a beautiful weiss in my eyes.
 Smell  The aroma of the beer is huge of banana and wheat along with tons of spice of a coriander and clove smell. Other aromas of a white pepper and a decently strong aroma of a bubblegum as well as a bit of an orange and ginger smell are there as well. Overall the aroma is a big, robust, and enjoyable in this one.
 Taste  The taste begins moderately sweet and malty, with the malty flavors being a nice mix of a bready and doughty taste while the sweet upfront is largely of an orange and caramel flavor. As the taste advances the sweet caramel transitions to a nice bubblegum and candied sugar flavor with the doughty flavors getting a bit more potent in nature. All while this occurs the yeasty flavors and bring with them flavors of banana, coriander and clove. The yeasty and coriander flavors remain relatively constant from this time on, but the banana and clove really kicks it up more toward the end. With the increase in banana, also comes some other flavors of candied sugar as well as little bit of pepper, which when combined with all the other flavors of the brew, end up leaving a rather nice and somewhat moderately sweet Weiss flavor to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the slightly thinner side for a beer of 5.8 % of its style s with a carbonation level that is on the lower side for the style. A little thicker and chewier body and a bit more carbonation level may have been better for accentuating the fruity banana and spiced flavors as well as the more malty flavors of the brew, but even with that said, the combo did work to a degree and the feel was decent overall.
 Overall  This is a very tasty weizen. The aroma, look, and taste are quite fantastic, with the only thing keeping this from the supreme top being the feel in my opinion. This is one you certainly can count on to being rather pleasant.

16.9 oz bottle into my Aventinus glass. Aroma consists of banana, clove, chalky candy, lemon, dough. Pours cloudy burnt orange-brown with a large off-white fluffy head with excellent retention. Taste is sweet with all aroma descriptors present; finishes with a little dryness. Fairly mild. I was hoping for more clove in flavor. Mouthfeel is perfectly creamy, finely carbonated, a little watery maybe. Its good, but I was expecting more from the top rated dunkelweizen.

Bottle pours a dark amber color with a thick head that fades to bits of lacing aroma of fruit, citrus, yeast and bit of malt. Taste of fruit, mild malt sweetness, with yeast and bit of grain. Mild bitterness and a clean finish. Medium body, smooth And well balanced. Enjoyable beer.

Bottle. Thanks Excellent Little Brother for the delivery! Cloudy dark amber-to-light-brown with a frothy white head. Aromatic honey dew scent, caramel-toffee, a little clove and ripe banana. Tastes like very ripe cantaloupe, sweet, but not burdening. Full-bodied, very carbonated, a little spicy ending. Very pleasing.

Pours a gorgeous dark orange-like color with haze and a huge bubbly head. Aroma is malt, bread, yeast, maybe apple, and a slight clove spice finish. Taste is green apple and malt, wheat, banana, caramel, spice, bread, and clove. Overall a slightly heavier version of the brauweisse but not as dark/heavy as I expected, still a good drink.

500ml bottle bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen Long.
Cloudy hazy mud brown colour with lots of trunky, dirt-like yeast sediments; Explosive three finger head with crumpety off-white foam which lasted for 2 minutes; Moderate sticky lacing and quite fizzy carbonation; Very fragment aroma of wheat malt, with fresh banana, vanilla, caramel, toffee, light apple fresh, sugar, bubblegum, light cloves, malt, strong yeast and shades of grass; Close to light sweet taste of roasted malt, with light nuts, banana, fresh toast, caramel, toffee, light tart notes, light cloves, spices, strong yeast, lemon and light bitter hops and thin grass; Close to light body. Smooth and quite rich palate; Mouth feel is smooth and wholesome dark maltyness, roasty and slightly nutty, whereas wheaty tartness is much lighter than Bräu Weisse; Strong caramel with fresh toast, fleshy banana and apple ester is prominent, light cloves and spices, tasty indeed!... Hoppiness is light grass in nose, lemon and thin grass and taste. Bitterness is low but notable for a roasty, wheaty faint astringent finish; Quite dry after taste, very easy and quite wholesome to mouth.

Comments: Like the Bräu Weisse, this one impresses with fragrant fruity aroma, wholesome maltyness, and a smooth-as-ever pretty rich taste. A really close match with Neumarkter Lammsbräus Schwarze Dunkles Hefeweizen, but it lacks the smoky, nice chocolate and toffee palate of the latter. Still, it does not lessen its greatness a least bit. Way better than the Bräu Weisse and a convincing top dark wheat beer. Very nice!
Aroma is slightly sour but very pleasant. Pours dark brown with medium head. Tasye is tipical dunkelweizen. Very nice beer.
Pours amber with frothy white head. Aroma is banana,clove,sweet bread. Taste is sweet,bready,malty,bananas,clove. Tasty.

I poured this into a weizen glass.
The appearance was a fairly light glossy slightly golden bronzed amber of sorts with a fairly decently two finger white foamy head that dissipates within about less than a minute. Theres barely any lacing.
The smell makes up for the appearance since it just didnt seem just quite dark enough for a dunkelweizen, anyways, heres what I got, a nice banana estery clove-like goodness gently gracing itself into a fairly sweet German maltiness, very nice.
The taste takes the previously mentioned flavors to town and just makes a nice sweet sticky banana-like aftertaste to coat the finish and leave it somewhat dry.
On the palate, this one sits right at a medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability running about it.
Overall, other than the look, it smells, tastes and has a great mouthfeel, I say if you see this dont pass up on it even though it doesnt seem quite as dark as most dunkelweizens Ive had.

0,5l Flasche. Dunkelbraunes Weizen mit schöner heller Schaumkrone. Riecht fruchtig nach Getreide, Schmeckt erst fruchtig mit Aromen von Banane, gefolgt von einer leichten Malzigkeit die nach Caramel schmeckt.
Leckeres Bierchen!

Sehr hefetrüb und dunkel orange mit hellbeigem Schaum. Hefig-milder Geruch. Der Antrunk ist sehr mild-hefig mit einem ganz leicht süßlichen Malzton. Zum Hauptteil hin bleibt das Bier hefig-mild, es kommt ein leicht malzig-scharfer Geschmack hinzu. Auf der zunge bleibt eine süßlich-hefige Note mit einem ganz leichten Touch Malz.  → Süffiges Weißbier, aber nicht eindeutig als dunkle Weiße zu identifizieren. 8+11+8+8

My last of the d.weizens at wob cap hill. Pours a deep amber, aroma is sweet bakery bready and slightly hickory bacon and apple. Sips medium full with malt body and flavor up front. Carbonation is pronounced and tingly on the tongue. Middle leads to a slight spiciness that evens out the malt sweetness nicley. Finish is Big malt and toasty, bready, with slight hop flavor to round it out. Caramel and toast linger. Alcohol isnt noticeable, even at cold temp. And 5.8 is decent. Overall malt forward, nicely carbonated, easy drinking caramel/toasty wheat brew.

Bottle @ Die kleine Bierstube, Aarhus. Pours cloudy amber with small off-white head. Clear aroma of malt, yeast and banana. Sweetish taste of malt and banana, with sourish, grainy notes and bitter, hoppy touches. Rich body. Sour-sweetish aftertaste. Well-balanced and nice. A decent Dunkelweizen.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2014 Appearance: This beer poured a nice cloudy, golden almost amber color. The head was fairly large when first poured, about two fingers worth and it slowly came down to about a half a fingers worth. It was an eggshell white head that was very fluffy.

Aroma: Sweet banana and spice aroma that was very pleasant. I could pick up on some subtle malty aromas to it as well.

Taste: You can taste some banana bread like flavors as well as some underlying malty flavors. The flavor finishes off with a little clove and nutmeg.

Mouth feel: Great mouth feel. Has a perfect amount of carbonation, light body. It defiantly has a creamy feeling to it, and a nice crisp finish.

Awesome brew all around!

Beer pours the color of honey comb and tastes like honey as well. Light, barely noticeable palate that goes down smoothly. Taste isn't quite as good as Brauweiss but definitely worth drinking. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ayinger is the quintessential German Dunkel. The color is brownish-amber with a creamy-tan head. The rich wheat malt provides aromas and flavors of bread, banana, bubble gum, apple, and subtle cloves. Simple but delicous. Dont expect to keep glass of this around for very long.

Bottle.

A- Banana, spice, wheat.

A- Brown orange color, cloudy liquid, off white head.

T- Banana, bubblegum, cloves, spice, wheat, dough.

P- Medium-Light body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth finish.

O- Just a little heavier than the Brau-Weisse. Lots of banana and bubblegum tones and some spice. Easy to drink and quite refreshing.
16.9 oz bottle pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of cloves, yeast, bananas and malt. Taste is yeast, fruit and malts.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy amber color with a large fluffy off white head. The aroma and flavor have banana, cloves, citrus with some oranges and sour lemons, caramel malt, toasted bread. Pretty decent beer.
Draught in Munchen.Hazy muddy orange colour with large white head.Aroma of ripped bananas and wheat,nice fruity and fresh with bready taste and well balanced flavor of yeast and rosted malt.
Murky orange, big unstable head. Aroma has lots of yeast and banana. Flavour is yeasty, fruity. Soft mouthfeel, deliscous.

Poured from 500mL bottle. Clear, light muddy orange-brown with off-white head. Strong wheaty aroma with some banana. Same flavour with a subtle sourness hidden in the background that I didnt like at first, but drinking a bit more of the beer I enjoyed it more.

500 ml bottle. Pours a murky dark brown with a large long lasting off-white head. Very strong aroma of ripe bananas with some malt, wheat and yeast. Complex flavor with roasted malt, bread-like yeast and banana. Full body with oily texture. Very tasty, my favorite dunkelweizen!
One the fruits wheat beers. Lacks hops but still great. Apple and wheat flavors rock. Just good beer.
Bottle as pictured. Bought this on a whim as a friend had been talking about it. Pours a hazy dark brown. Nice beer, nice malt feel, some banana, apple, fruit. Kinda earthy.

Second bottle I've had of this. This one about 3 months after the first. I didn't like it last time apparently. It's now Jan and cold outside. 
Really enjoying this. A tasty interesting weizen. More malty and a bit fruitier than your average weizen. Not sure why I didn't like it before. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I like the extra body from this dark Weizen style. Typical Weizen too thin and light for my taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hmmmm, not sure how to rate this one cause Im not a big fan of Weisse beers. Hazy brown color with off white head. Fruity aroma: pears, bananas amd bread. Im disappointed with the flavor. Not much there.

Bottle, 0.50l. Courtesy of CanCrusher, thanks a lot! Pours hazy amber brown color with large creamy off-white head, poor lacing with small yeast particles floating. Aroma of wheat, vanilla, roasted malt, smoke, yeast and mild traces of rubber. Taste starts with moderate sweet and sour grainy malt, following with caramel and smokey notes, while finish is light bitter. Medium to full body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. Smooth and refreshing dunkelweizen...

9th March 2014Cloudy amber beer, decent white head. Palate is smooth and slightly crisp and semi dry. Smooth wheaty malt, mellow cloves and very mild banana. Smooth dry finish. Pretty standard stuff but quite drinkable.

Pours a cloudy light brown with a buoyant off-white head that leaves some soapy lace. Nose involves banana, apple skin, hearty sourdough, some candy, spice and herbal hops. Somewhat sweet, quite tart, hardly bitter. Light to medium bodied, fluffy and actively carbed, refreshing, with a long yeasty tart finish. Really nice brew, very tasty and enjoyable.
Hazy dark yellow. Aroma of banana and cloves. Thick creamy head. Full bodied, smooth taste. Hint of fruit. Smooth finish, drinkable. A new favorite!!!
Aroma of banana, bread and clove. Taste is sweet with a subtle smooth bitterness. Orange body is cloudy and head retains quite well.
(bottle) aroma starts with jam and fruit; then spices, banana (nice and complex); creamy palate; mild and balanced flavour; very nice

Draught at Ayingers Speis & Trank, Munich. Brownish-amber, cloudy body, with big, creamy, white head. Aroma of banana, orange, bread, bubblegum, honey, clove. Tastes of banana-cake, bubblegum, honey, citrus, bread, biscuit. Full mouthfeel, lively carbonation and it finishes fruity and slightly spicy. Wow, tasty! So smooth, perfectly balanced and surpisingly complex. The best Dunkelweizen Ive had so far!

Draft at Ayingers Speis und Trank - Munich. Pours clearish amber with a creamy, off-white head. Nose of toast and light, tangy berries. Light-medium sweet flavor with toasted caramel, hints of cocoa, mellow leafy bitterness, well rounded brown bread. Medium bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Moderately sweet to finish with well toasted brown bread, light toffee. Pretty delicious. A very well balanced beer.

Pours a cloudy amber / brown colour, with a huge, creamy, off-white head. On the nose there is complex fruitiness and almost gives off a tiny hint of smokiness. On the palate there is traces of bananas, cloves, apples, all rolled up together. Overall good brew!
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes braunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, röstmalzig, leicht fruchtig würzig. Geschmack hefig, leicht würzig, leicht fruchtig.
Nice wheat beer at solid Löwenbrau! Sweet, sour and yeasty at the same time with some lemon to it. Looks like swamp water.. Definitely a nice beer and a better than average weissbier..

At Ayingers Speis und Trank (Tap. 23/1/14. Dark caramel brown colourred pour with an off white frothy head. Aroma is honey , leather, caramel and some spritzy c02. Flavour is nice, wood, caramel bark. Medium body and lively carbonation. Tasty enough.

Bottle; old gold, cloudy, thick white head; aroma is wheat, banana; taste has more banana than your average wheat beer, along with pronounced yeast and some light citrus fruits, all over a solid base of wheat and malt; a wheat beer with a bit of extra depth.
Bottle from Tacoma boys. Ours a nice amber. Thin white head. Scent of banana and bread. Taste has some spice and finishes with a sting banana flavor. Tasty.

Bottle 0,50L. Hazy, dark orange colour with creamy off-white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, caramel and yeast. Taste is light sweet at the start, but quickly turns into moderate bitter with yeast and caramel mouthfeel. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and chalky finish. Way better than their Brauweisse.

500 ml. bottle. It pours a dark, cloudy orange color with a big, creamy off white head. The aroma is full and well balanced with notes of banana, clove, wheat and baked apples. The flavor is the same. Nice creamy body and good mouthfeel. Easy drinking.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy dark orange with massive white head. Aroma is phenolic; banana, cloves, bread, wheat, orange and faint caramel notes. Taste is fruity, wheat, yeast, cloves and banana. Very drinkable, excellent beer

Poured a dark amber color with a large off-white head. Aroma was some clove, bubblegum, bananas and sweet malts. Flavor was sweet caramel, lemon, bubblegum, with some banana. Pretty tasty, though nothing spectacular with this one.

500 ml bottle. German yeast aroma with banana esters. Murky dark amber with an off-white head. Starts with a big head but that settles rather quickly...and I served it in an Ayinger glass. Highly carbonated mouthfeel. Pretty much tastes as it smells: a really great example of the German weissbier style. I think it tastes more like a weissbier than a dunkelweiss. My only knock on this beer is the effervescence. Too carbonated which is keeping my rating lower by a couple of points. But the flavor is outstanding; just a really easy drinking brew.

Totally tasty from first splash to distant finish. Worth searching out for the fall-to-winter season in a northern climate (yes, snowing today but still technically autumn). Goes especially well with a Packers victory. Enjoyed from a half-liter bottle.

Bottle. Pours hazy deep copper. Nose is phenol clove and ester banana mixed with light chocolate. Flavour goes stronger into the bubblegums with a bit of bread. I dunno how I feel about this "chocolate banana bread" style and if Ill ever cross one that deserves a "4+" rating but this ones better than average.

Pours a light copper color, Aroma is distinct of fruit mixed with malt. Taste is of slight yeast and apple. A bit doughy and earthy, but refreshing. Im not a huge fan of the style, but its refreshing.
500 ml. bottle. Pours a golden orange with a nice off-white head. Aroma of caramel, fruit, grain, and yeast. Taste is caramel, banana, yeast, wheat, spice, and citrus. Superb!
Good cloudy golden(light amber color with soft white head, sweet wheat and yeast notes in aroma and taste, one quality weissbier...
Pours an amberish gold, with white head. Light aroma of wheat. Taste is richer, a bit sweet, with nice malty notes. You can taste the yeast and fruit in there too. Quite drinkable. Thumbs up.

Pours hazy-opaque brown tinted-orange amber - almost caramel color. Head is spacious, white and foamy. Settles to a thick coating and shows wet lacing. Aroma is banana, cloves, bread. Taste is oh so drinkable. Notes of darkness in roasted malt, balanced with the lightness of fruit, wheat, yeast, cloves. The finish includes a touch of warming apple-booze. Moderate carbonation. An excellent beer and the best dunkelweizen that I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at brewer tap munivh... Hazzy yellow amber.. Small white head... Soft zezty lemon banana none.... Soft very clean fruits... Light banana... Juivy fruits... Ober fizzy...

Bottle @ Corso ADB 2013. Colore giallo ambrato, riflessi aranciati. Schiuma bianco sporco, abbondante, abbastanza fine ed abbastanza persistente. Profumo intenso di frutta, banana in evidenza, ma anche lievito, una speziatura di chiodo di garofano poco evidente, alcolico deciso, un po pungente e frumento. Il profumo è abbastanza persistente ed intenso. Il gusto è armonico con aspetto e profumi. si ritrova la banana, la speziatura; è una birra abboccata ed abbastanza acida. lamaro non è quasi presente. di corpo medio /buono ha una carbonatazione non eccessiva per essere una weizen. il retrolfattivo è caldo alcolico e quasi pepato.

Light orange body with off white head and loads of head. A pretty amazing nose on this thing. Sweet rotten bananas, faint roast malts, vanilla, warm bread. Pretty active carbonation. Taste is sweet and malty, a bit more roast than a hefeweizen. Fabulous.
Bottle shared with northropfrye. Apricot colour with pretty head. I can hear it snap, crackling and popping. Peaches aroma. Sweet taste. I love it a lot. Viva la Deutschland.

Cor âmbar escuro. Boa formação de espuma, media persistência. Aroma de malte, frutado ao final. Sabia acompanha o aroma, com sabor de malte, com médio dulçor, depois um pouco frutado, acabando seco e com amargor bem balanceado. Muito Bia cerveja de trigo. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Absolutely delicious brew. Pour is medium amber with a super thick white head. flavor is sweet and a bit fruity. Would recommend to any weizen friends.
Blindprovad. Övermogen banan i doften. Härligt och bra hantverksöl. Uppenbart att det är ett kvalitetsöl i glaset.

Pours murky and turbid. Light brownish amber with gold hues around the edges and plenty of bubbles streaming up towards the mammoth creamy head of off white foam. That head sits atop this beer like its gonna last forever. Leaves wet lace, refreshes as it drinks, and never falls off completely. Nice layer on top throughout the drink. 

Nose is soft fruits. Light banana and a nice bit of clove. Some tart apple to perk it up and a good bread malt underneath it all. Taste follows the nose all the way. Soft and demure but with a little bit of moxy behind it too. Perky carbonation and a bread that is stronger in the drink than on the nose. Smooth banana and spicy clove combine with the tart apple for a heavenly, creamy drink with just the right amount of tartness. The finish lasts and is dry and has a bit of wheat to really accent all those flavors. Tiny bit peppery at the end but that too is soft and gentle. 

The flavors on this one arent sharp but the drink moves nicely over the palate with a gentle mouthfeel that highlights the tart apple so well. The malt in this just keeps bringing bread to the palate and I really like that. It is medium bodied, tasty and very refreshing.

Serving type: bottle

Appearance- Dark cloudy straw yellow with a large cream colored head and no lacing.

Aroma- Strong smell of bananas, clove and wheat, just what you would expect

T/P- Taste is not as strong as the smell would lead you to believe. The beer seem to have a lot of carbonation in it

Overall- This was a good beer not great but good. There are defiantly better examples of the style out there.

Bottle from Wegmans. Pours an unseemly dark orange with a small soapy head. Smells like banana pudding pops. Banana, wheat, pear, caramel, bread. Moderately sweet and bitter. Body is crisp, a bit sticky.
Bottle. Pours a murky amber with fluffy off-white head and decent lace. Nose of banana, clove, bread, wheat, caramel. Medium body. Quite sweet.
Tons of plums, raisons and a little peach and breadiness. Will buy again. Hides the alcohol so well.
Aroma is mostly banana, some wheat, not much yeast. Very pleasant mouthfeel, the beer has ideal carbonation. A real pleasure to drink. 50 cl bottle.
Cloudy orange brown color. Orange peel, candied fruit, ginger and wheat in th aroma. Full body with round palate. Also, notes of bubblegum. Delicious.

Pours a hazy amber with a huge white head that slowly dissipates to a very thin lace. Aromas are banana and clove, with a hint of butterscotch. Flavors are banana bread, spice, citrus and muted caramel with a bready, citrus finish. Rather high carbonation with a light and peppery mouthfeel. Overall, a very nice wheat beer. Delicious.

Amber in color. Lightest dunkel weisse yet. Aroma of chocolate covered bananas. wow! This is the 5th bar of the night, but man, this is good. faint bubble gum in nose. Flavor is nothing less than spectacular. Creamy, silky, ester-booM! faint clove as it warms.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden (kinda mustard colored), thin white head. Nose is clove, bubblegum, wet cardboard, whiff of banana. Mouth is medium-full bodied, creamy wheat, lots of banana, cloves, and (surprise)... bubblegum, light sweetness, finish with bread dough and hint of cinnamon. I like me some dunkelweizen... and even though Ayinger has better beers, this is still a tasty brau. Prost!

(Bottled) A pretty good Dunkle wheat ..There is heaps of toffee .Custard..Spice clove and a drinker is given a dirty bronze colour . I cant put the glass down .. that is all the endorsement you need for this flavoursome beer.

Poured from bottle into Eskimo Joe's cup in order to be clandestine around the kids. Not as good as their märzen, but a good Dunkel nonetheless. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle into weizen glass, no bottle dating. Pours hazy deep orange copper color with a 1-2 finger dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big caramel, toast, toffee, banana, clove, pear, apple, wheat, floral, pepper, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of malt and yeast ester notes with a fair amount of hop presence; and good strength. Taste of big caramel, toast, toffee, banana, pear, apple, clove, wheat, honey, pepper, floral, bread, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of caramel, toast, toffee, banana, pear, apple, clove, wheat, bread, floral, honey, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome balance and complexity of malt and yeast ester flavors; with nice robustness and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a fairly creamy and crisp mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent dunkelweizen style. All around great balance and complexity of malt and yeast ester flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

500 mL bottle poured into an Erdinger glass. Caramel brown, gassy with a good frothy head. Sour and slightly farmyard aroma. Smells wheaty with a hint of caramel. Smooth, caramel. Tastes alright although unspectacular.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 18.08.2013, 0,5l bottle @ The Oak Barrel, Helsinki Airport:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet and fruity, wheat, slightly burnt caramel, yeast, banana, dough, dried fruits. Taste is wheat, yeast, hay, caramel, dough, toast, very ripe banana, citrus. Nice balanced bitterness. Very nice!
500ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a thick foamy off white head. Aroma of clove, banana, with hints of bubblegum and wheat. Taste of clove & bananas up front, and wheat to balance it out.
Bottle. Deep, thick foamy head. Bananas, with a lovely toffee muffin warmth throughout and a slight citrus sparkle. Refreshing with a nice fine carbonation and a thick feel.

My first dunkleweizen (having lots of firsts in the Euro styles this week)! Pours a slightly murky dark orange color with creamy light cream colored head. Yeasty almost bretty aroma with some light citrus zest and bitter banana. Flavor is banana, yeast, apple, and pear balanced by a nice effervescent bitter presence. Prickly carbonation in the tongue with medium light mouthfeel overall. I like it.

Light Muddy Brown Color, Huge Head, Leaves No Lacing. Faint Yeast, maybe banana hidden waaaay underneath. Yeast, clove, once again faint banana, wheat. Sweet and slightly sour at the same time. Light body, real easy to drink. Definitely different from regular heffeweizens, not what i was expecting. Interesting. i Liked it. Good.

Bottle. Pours dark copper with a huge white head. Aroma and taste are quite similar. Typical banana and clove notes but backed by some sweet malt and apple. Palate is smooth but showcases a lively carb. Nice subtle departure from the hefeweizen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clove, banana aroma; with subtle lemon and raisin, and bready, caramel malt. Similar fruity and spice flavors (maybe a little stronger lemon). Sweetish, caramel/toffee, biscuit/doughy malt flavors. Mild bitterness.

Bottle from Appalachian vintner. Pours brown with a couple of inches of khaki foam. Has some estery notes on the nose. Nice esters on the tongue with a little bit fruitiness as well. Finishes clean. Solid for style.
