Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; cloudy amber pour with big white frothy head, distinctive clove and banana aroma, taste for me is overripe banana, cloves and a hint of sweet caramel.
Mellow yellow beer. Understated fruitiness that is well balanced with the wheat malts. Light to medium body and a thick white head.
Smell of clove and bananas, poured golden haze with slight head that evaporated quickly, tare of bananas, corriander, and clove.

Bottle from Bierzwerg

Pours dark amber colored with high creamy head. Smell is yeasty and sweet malts with some caramel. Starts yeasty sweet with some cereal and a bready note. Middle part has some bread and grains, paired with a deliciously sweetish creamy yeast flavor. Goes into a sweet bready finish with creamy yeast notes.
Bottle at bar. Thick yellow color, white head. Bittersweet taste with banana, citrus, wheat, fruits and malts. Sweet finish with banana and wheat. Excellent brew.
Bottle, beers of Europe. Pours a cloudy amber colour with a thick foamy white head. Soft banana, peach and apricot flavours, mellow palate, Herby hints and a long slightly nutty finish. Excellent

Bottle.  Choose this one to knock out a previously untried style.  Pours cloudy brown with fluffy off white head.  Smell is caramel, banana, clove spices.   Taste is wheat, caramel, lbanana, clove, bit of cocoa.  Lively mouth with a medium creamy palate.  Nice.

Bottle. Pours cloudy copper/orange, big off-white head, good retention/lace. Aroma of banana, clove, citrus, wheat malt, spice. Taste is big banana, citrus, citrus, light chocolate, wheat. Palate is soft, creamy, long finish. Outstanding.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange copper with eggshell head, settles rapidly. Aroma is sweet, fruity, banana, candy, apricot, cotton candy. Flavor is sweet, mildly wheaty, fruity, banana. Not particularly dark or roasted. Moderate carbonation, medium-light body, and crisp texture. Refreshing, drinkable, tasty, sweet wheat beer.
Light, cloudy caramel pour with a light but retentive white head. Aroma is apricot, apple and caramel. Tastes of pear, banana, and a bit of acid. Slightly watery, but very drinkable.

Cloudy apple cider brown orange with a fine white head.  Aroma of zesty yeast, caramel & bananas.  Tastes very sweet, bready, and yeasty.  Assertive moderate/light carbonation.  A bit too sweet to session.  Still delicious.

At Ayinger in Munich.  Good and full.  Lovely glass.  Cloudy brownish gold, lasting white head.  Good yeasty estery aroma.  Fuller better than the Schneider I had earlier.  This is sublime, takes to the wings.  Really good.  I love weizens and this is top notch.  Full and satisfying.  worth taking time to get to know.  Really good.
Poured from a bottle, the color is amber with a small white head. I smell wheat, banana and clove. I taste all of the same with some light roasting notes. Very nice:)

Cloudy, dirty yellow with a giant beige head.
Aroma is wheat, bread, cloves.
Taste is banana, bread, spice.
Tingly carbonation and thick feel.
Really nice.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2014 Body is dark orange and cloudy with a quickly dissipating white head. Nose is bold with notes of ripe bananas, fruits, yeast and malts. Taste is pleasantly sweet and a bit thin. Carbonation is quite strong for a weizen, which is nice as many wheats seem a bit flat.
Apricot color, very cloudy, with a nice head and some sediment. Nose of cooked banana and spice. Mildly-carbonated with an overripe banana, apple, pepper, and vanilla flavor.
Pours amber with a large white head. Aroma is wheat, roasted notes, banana and clove. Flavour is wheat, sweet ripe banana, roasted notes and clove.

From bottle to weizen glass. Cloudy light chocolate brown with fluffy white head. Wheaty aroma hint of chocolate and light floral notes. Wheat yeast and chocolate notes. Good carbonation and mouth feel. very drinkable.

The aroma of this beer is reminiscent of sweet bread yeast, fig, sour fruit, and toasted malts, and the appearance is a hazy golden brown with a small white head with good retention. The taste is mildly sour and mildly sweet, and the palate combines a medium body, thin and slick texture, average carbonation, and an abrupt finish.
bottle into glass hazy orange pour with off white head,  fruity spicy aroma,  taste is similar with some peach notes,   extremely well put together beer,  love it
Tap at St Michael, Oulu. Originally rated 2011. Colour is brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Wheat, sweetness and malts.
Bottle. Murky brown with a  large but rather short head. Aroma is malt and yeast. Flavour is a spiced caramel, yeast on a very dry finish. Would like to try this on tap.
nice light fruit aroma,amber, cloudy, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, nice very harmonic light soft fruit finish.
Amber and hazy. Has a white, soft head, lasting. Sweet spicy aroma, notes of lactic acid, faint caramel. Heavy sweet flavor, more spicy notes, dried fruits, yeasty too. Creamy, soft carbonation.

Colore gialla dorato carico, molto velata, torbida, schiuma bianca fine e persistente. Aroma di malto, cereale, frutta gialla ben matura. Aromi intensi. Al palato ritroviamo il cereale e la frutta gialla con una nota di dolcezza quasi eccessiva. Carbonazione discreta, corpo medio.

Light amber with a foamy tan head. Crisp, punchy. Distinct German wheat with a roasty lean, then some crisp fruit and spice flavors. Very full with a nice finish. I would definitely try this one again.

Makes me want to break out into "Das Lied der Deutschen". (you know...the one that Hayden composed that we are not to sing the first two stanzas). Simply delicious, with more malt than their brau-weisse (thus extra points).
Tap at ayingers, munchen. Brown orange color, white head. Roasty and yeasty sweet balanced taste.
Bottle, 5.8%. Hazy dark amber/brown with giant off-white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, yeast and banana. FLavour is malt, wheat, yeast, caramel, banana, hop, little bitter, medium sweet and spices.

Cor âmbar escuro. Boa formação de espuma, media persistência. Aroma de malte, frutado ao final. Sabia acompanha o aroma, com sabor de malte, com médio dulçor, depois um pouco frutado, acabando seco e com amargor bem balanceado. Muito Bia cerveja de trigo. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle - quite fizzy when poured.  Nose of bread, fruit, and clove.  Full of carbonation.  Taste of fruit, spices, and light malt with dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From bottle. Pours super fizzy. Aroma of apple juice, yeast, and bubble gum. Taste is bubble gum, malt, banana. Slightly fizzy mouthfeel.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange-amber color with a moderate off-white head. Nose is nice with some citrus and fruity elements. Taste is just a tad sweet, and ends up being slightly heavy. OK.

Room temp bottle.  Nice bottle top.  A deep orange colour, sparkling with a very quickly dissipating head.  Smells like a lager with some esters.  Flavour is citrus with a little sharpness and very light and subtle tropical esters.  A little watery and it doesnt have that deep, warming, estery sweetness of the best wheat beers.  Still very pleasant and quaffable.

I was surprised I hadnt rated this one yet.  Pours hazy dull bronze / brown with a fluffy head.  The aroma has rich wheat, candied bananas, cream, spicy pepper, pudding and vanilla.  It has a medium / light body thats a bit rough with frothy carbonation.  The taste is drier than the aroma with caramelized bananas, pepper and brown sugar.  The finish has a bit of wood and more of dry what and huskiness.  Good hefe.
Pours a dark yellow with a brownish tinge. Aromas of vinegar and sour apples, banana. Banana and wheat flavours. Some citrus too. Interesting.

Dobre i smaczne, ciemne i wyraznei zaznaczony aromat gozdzika i pieczonego banana. Piana spora wielka i trwala. Kolor ciemno-brazowy. piwo lekko kwaskowate ale sadzilem ze bedzie bardziej kwaskowate, bylo takze ciut za malo drozdzowe, choc osadu bylo sporo

Bottled. Pours hazy deep golden with a large white head. Aroma of caramel, banana, fruit, spicy notes and yeast. Sweet flavor that ends up quite malty. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft CO2. A very tasty weisse.  ★★★★
Bottle @ Salling. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, bread, banana. Flavor is wheat, yeast, fruity, banana, little citrus. Medium body, lively carbonation. Nice one. 220313
Bottle (from backlog).  Golden color with huge, champagne-like head.  Lots of banana and cloves.  Banana, bread and malt flavors.  Crisp.

The aroma is very authentic German wheat beer with it’s banana and cloves signature. But it also has incense and a smoked malt meatiness to it that makes it seem almost liked cured meat. The appearance is hazy copper gold with a frothy head. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is thin but smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours amber with off white head, aroma is fruity and light malt. Flavor is very estery and some phenols, kind of sweet.

Sample @ Salling Ølfestival. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is amber/golden. Aroma and taste are rich with yeast and banana. Very powerful aroma. But also some wheat malt and hops. Nice and smooth. Excellent weisse.

March 20, 2013 - bottle from Randalls.  Golden orange pour with nice head.  Aroma was fruity, banana, bready, spice and clove.  Taste was consistent with aroma, but had some sweet malt as well.  Light to medium body with plenty of carbonation.
great beer from pepole who know how to brew great beer,,,,,,,,, good head , poured well ,, great nose,,, light c02 ,,, golden goodness,,,,light body - creamy,,, its good [ weizen ]

50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 07/2013
Aroma is sweetish with toffee, caramel, some banana esthers and yeasty notes. Flavour has ripe banana, citrus, some toffee and hints of spices. Quite tickling CO2 on palate. Nice, one od the best dunkelweizens Ive had. This is not stale in any way like they usually are.

Sampled 12/2012 as 1 in 9 Bierzwerg des Monats Dez. 2012. - This might be doing their flagship a disservice, but rating this Ur-Weisse from memory as a Weisse that was gone before I noticed, given it is not my preferred style, only confirms Ayingers top-notch quality. This perfectly executed Weisse, dry and full of fruit flavours, draws optimally from their quality Hefe strain and almond-dry malts: this sampler overall has made an impression and the Ur-Weisse was among the most memorable offering (besides the Celebrator).
Brownish orange amber. Big, frothy, mostly lasting white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana. Medium body, creamy, sweet, soft carbonation. Flavor of banana, wheat, citrus. Enjoyable.
golden amber color, nice head.  smells like cherrios and slight citrus, maybe orange. banana.   smooth. Tastes just how it smells.  A little banana, a little malty, a little citrusy tasting.
0.5 l bottle as present... Nice dark golden color, good head... nice aroma of cereals and some sweet caramels...medium sweetness... Full body and some kind of creamy texture...

Grabbed at Kroger...poured into traditional tall heff. Glass....3 finger large bubble head which dissipates with very little lacing etc....good slight yeast haze and dark yeast residue swirled out from bottom of bottle...Smell is BANANAS !!!!!!!All Bananas....sweet perfect smell....Taste well balanced...easy to quaf....would pair well with many foods....bingo w Chili Dog.....carbonation is bright but not too much....seemed perfect for the style....Excellent Amber Heff
Delicious stuff. Caramel hints on the palate. Very smooth and goes down easy. Terrific.
Another quality beer from Ayinger brewery. Very tasty - caramel and fruits. On the orher hand quite light. The entity very balanced.
Great caramel and banana heavy lager.  Tons of yeast ester and balanced sweetness make for a really easy drinker. Some bread and more nanner on the finish.. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2013 Murky brown. Nice caramel and banana mixed with some spices. Yeast finishes off the end. Nice flavors and very good but falls a little flat. Would enjoy a little more of a finish and aftertaste. Good nonetheless.

500ml bottle. Pours cloudy light amber, lighter than most dunkleweizens, with a foamy white head. Aromas of bananas, citrus and apples. Taste is a balance of bready yeast and malt with fruit notes. I really love this style and this does not disappoint. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.5 L from Whole Foods. Much more carbonated than I expected. Almost painful. Beer is also paler than what I would have expected from a dunkelweizen. Typical bananas and slight tinny flavor expected from a bottle thats been sitting around for who knows how long.

Appena stappata sembrava che tra un pò una banana uscisse dalla bottiglia e ti avrebbe preso a schiaffi. Il colore, versata nel bicchiere, è di un biondo ambrato con un consistente e bel cappello di schiuma. Aroma (come anticipato) di banana con una leggera "infezione" di pane e di caramello. In bocca si rinnovano le stesse impressioni, bene o male; ma si colgono anche note varie di frutta. Corposa, complessa e ricca ma anche dannatamente facile da bere. Capolavoro.

The aroma is very authentic German wheat beer with its banana and cloves signature. But it also has incense and a smoked malt meatiness to it that makes it seem almost liked cured meat. The appearance is hazy copper gold with a frothy head. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is thin but smooth. Overall a good example of a German beer but not the best Dunkel that I have had.

500ml bottle from Jonathan Ron Brielle. Poured a muddy/murky amber/orange body with a smaller off white foamy head. Aroma was solid, notes of over ripe banana, wet hay, dark toast that basically acted liked a sponge soaking up everything on the counter from chopped banana bits to spilled OJ and wet raisin bran flakes and some raisins as well. The body is just way to fizzy, the carbonation basically takes away from the otherwise medium body and nice aftertaste, just so carbonated. Flavor is similar to the aroma with notes of banana, clove, hay, wet old grass, toast dunked in a cup of tea and even slight tropical fruits. Not bad stuff here, another surprise from Germany.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2014 Darker and a bit more alcoholic than normal weiss.
A hazy dark orange beer with a huge white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of banana and wheat. The flavor is very sweet, with notes of banana, wheat, and maybe citrus. 
But I wouldnt call it Dunkelweizen.

No bottling information.
Appearance: The body is an ugly caramel color with a similar looking texture but the head is a dense and creamy white color with great retention.
Aroma: Ripe banana peel is the first thing that comes to mind with a very slight hint of green apples. The aroma is strong and a bit thick.
Taste: Ripe banana and caramel come to mind with banana being the strongest flavor here and rather assertive. Light apple notes break through in the mid-taste helping to balance the sweetness out.
Palate: Light to medium bodied with a bready texture and fizzy carbonation.
Overall: This is a good beer though a bit too much banana for me. The price this is available at is an excellent price though and its hard to pass up.

Pours hazy dark amber with a thick white head that lasts long - looks great. Aroma of banana, wheat malts, some citrus and spiciness. Taste is light sweet and light sour, well balanced. Flavours of fruits, banana, spices, some maltiness. Palate is medium bodied, carbonation medium - very drinkable. One of the best dunkelweizens.

Cloudy amber colour, firm white head. Aroma af malts, yeast, caramel, banana, light bubblegum, bread. Quite sweet malty flavour, light weizen sour touch, caramel, toffee. Medium body, sweet finish, banana, light yeast tones, hint of cloves and nutmeg.
(From 0.5L bottle @ home)
A lovely looking dunkel with all the expected weizen aromas and flavors and as promised a bit heavier on the roasted malt.

Happy New Year one and all. Except you. Bananarama. Clove? I dont know what cloves are. Actually, I think I do. But I couldnt tell you what one tastes like. Though I now think I know what some things taste like because Ive tasted them in beer but Ive never tasted them. Does that make sense? This is a journey. Journey. Thats a good word. Like passenger. Thats a good word too. Noodles.

0,5 l bottle.   BB 08/13
banana, clove, caramel, dough, citrus, vanilla, orange, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,
Bottle shared with McTapps. Average and too sweet weizen with some aroma of yeast, sweets, cake and peach. Quite dull and strange low carbo.

50cl bottle. Color is in between dark orange-golden and copper, medium sized off-white to beige head. Smell wheat, some banana, slightly butter and yeast. Taste wheat, yeast, slightly some caramel, a hint of butter and yeast. Low to medium body and soft carbonation.

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Milky brown-orange in colour with low head. Nose of baking soda. Taste of sparkling yeast, dough, mild hops and champagne. Very fizzy and light. Thin texture, easy to drink. There are better German Hefeweizen.

Bottle from bierzwerg.de. Hazy, surprisingly dark orange color with medium long lasting off-white head. Aroma of caramel, banana, yeast, wheat.  Banana,  wheat,  yeast, caramel, malt, hints of citrus, bread in taste.  Tasty.
Bottle @ NK Saluhall. Cloudy light brown colour with a medium white head. Spicy yeast aroma. Light fruit, bread flavour.

Wonderful bready fruity aroma apple , pear, slight banana fill the nose. Creamy off white full head and dark golden color. Enters fruity frizzy and refreshing, then finishes bready yeasty and spicy. Mouthfeel is not as creamy as I would like for this style, medium body feels sort of fizzzy/thin. A bit of banana and cloves , not too  much and just right. Get a touch of peppr spice at the end which balances the long smooth slightly sweet finish.

Bottle - Hazy copper pour with a thin foamy off-white head. Nose is pear, bubblegum, sweet wheat, and canned peaches. Taste is roughly the same, with lots of pear coming through, some sticky sweetness, and a hint of clove on the finish. Mineral notes and some stale herbal hops on the finish as well. Slick and medium-bodied with ample carbonation.

500ml bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy copper with a medium head.  Aroma is raisin, clove and bubblegum.  Taste has strong clove to start with a wheaty, clove and bubblegum finish.  A little milky in the aftertaste.
Yeasty fruit aroma.  Pours a dark yellow/gold with thick white head that fades quickly.  Flavors of bread and fruit (pears?).  Slight bitter finish.  Not bad.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Didnt clock this as a Dweizen, cos it pours a light ambery/ginger. No matter, this is a delicious beer. Much subtler than so many weizens - no smack in the face from clove, banana or bubblegum, rather a gently blended, super smooth tickle of all three, with added brown toast. Caresses the tongue as it descends. Excellent brewmanship here.

50cl Bottle from bierkoning, thanks Edo! Murky amber colour, thick off-white head. Aroma of grain, wheat, banana, just light spicy, light fruity esters. Flavour is soft wheat, green banana, light yeast, nutty, white bread, esters in the light bitter finish. Medium-bodied, soft mouthfeel despite the high carbonation. Good Weizen.

Bottle at minuuttibar. Great tasty hefe. Yesty thick one with nice balance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Orange, wheat malt, earthy yeast aroma. Cloudy amber with a moderate, quickly dissipating off-white head. Lightly toasted wheat malt, spice/clove, and orange flavor. Light body, moderate carbonation. Good, but banana and toast I expect from a dunkelweizen just wasnt there. More like an orange-y hef.

Another great bier coming from Deutschland. A tall blonde fräulein that you just can't pass if you have the chance. Very rich and powerful flavor!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours cloudy very light brown, almost grey with a nice off-white head, some retention and lacing. toasted wheat, floral-fruitiness, hint of acidity, bananas, cloves, spiciness - peppery, very hint of sweetness, balanced by herbal hops. lively and soft carbonation, medium body - oily, very nice spicy-citrusy finish.
Det här var en trevlig öl med bra balans men med en lite för tunn kropp. Smaken präglades främst av jäst men med inslag av maltighet och lite syra.
UPDATED: FEB 6, 2014 Not a full aroma but it is nice, the pour makes up for it with a nice foamy head.  Really nice hefe wheat flavor with a balance of breadiness and fruit.  Ayinger always delivers.

Nice aroma with a consistent visual for a dunkelweiss. Smell of clove and malt that resembled brioche bread. 

Taste...sweet with light caramel notes, yeast with some similarity to a saison, and great hearty taste of wheat. 

Mouthfeel was full with reasonable carbonation and a bit dry.

16.9oz bottle. Clear orange color, good thick foamy white head, leaves good thick lace. Good banana aroma. Nutty, little toasty. Nice mild sweet taste, little spice. Soft, smooth carbonation. Very smooth, enjoyable brew, in an unusual style Im always excited to further explore. A classic for sure.
Love this brewery. Everything Ive had from them is good. This poured on the dark side but still had a very light palate.  Very enjoyable.

On tap at Ayingers Speis und Trank in Munich.Pours hazy dark Amber with an off-white head.Aroma of clove,yeast and fruit with notes of ripe banana,spice,stone fruit,citrus,wheat,yeast,sweet malt and bubblegum..

500ml bottle. Pours somewhere between a hefe and dunkel. Aroma is yeast and some malt. Flavor is also somewhere between a hefe and dunkel. Banana, cloves, yeast. Decent carbonation turns into creamy mouthfeel. A good compromise between the two styles.

This beer poured with very little head-- not sure if something is wrong with the bottle, since I expected more head and there is a little something wrong with the beer right at the end... Still good though.
I prefer the lighter side of wheat beers, but this isnt too far off the other end. Solid.

This good looking beer has a sweet almost banana like taste. It actually is almost a banana bread taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

For a dunkelweizen, its not very dark, and hence the flavor doesnt reflect the roast grain. A little richer than a hefe weizen, the banana flavors come through, unusual for a dunkel. The hazy appearance does hint at a heftier body though, and it comes thorugh in the mouthfeel. This sits somewhere between a dunkelweizen and normal hefe, which isnt necessarily a bad place to be...
caramel, cereal, toast, floral, perfume, dough, brown, hazy, frothy, light sweetness, salty, light body, thin feel, fizzy

Ambrato carico opalescente con schiuma bianca fine e persistente.
Aroma dominato dalla banana matura arricchita da sentori di chiodi di garofano e malti tostati.
Quasi dolce, con un buon corpo e un bel finale equilibrato....
Buona.....

Very pleasant. It had a pleasant malty aroma with sweetness and spice. The color was a murky yellow with a coppery tint. The head was a creamy off-white. The taste had slight citrus sweetness I fInd in most Weizen beers and some sweet elements. Malt was ever present. Some spiciness that provided a comforting aftertaste.

Strong aroma of banana, wheaty malt and spice. Swampy orange, extremely effervescent, large foamy head. Fruity  banana bread flavor with lots of zesty spicing. Foamy, soapy body. Perfectly refreshing yet satisfyingly filling. Wheat does amazing things in beer, and this one doubles down on this wheat ethic.

Pours a hazy dull honey color with a lasting white cap. Big banana, yeast, bubblegum and clove. Flavor follows the nose with addition of  some earthiness and pepper on the aftertaste. Body is medium and creamy with medium carbonation. This is a very good weizen.

500ml bottle. Hazy dark golden colour with huge, lasting, frothy to creamy, white head. Intense yeasty and wheaty aroma, spicy. Taste is initially wheaty, slightly sweet fruity with a touch of apple, gains some dry hoppy notes, also a citrus touch, spicy background. Very creamy palate.
Pours a dark amber body with a spare off-white head. Aroma of cookie, caramel, and chocolate. Flavor of toasted malt and a bit of caramel.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090212.
Pours murky amber color with large head. Aroma of wheat, spices and caramel. Flavor of toffee, wheat, banana notes and some sugar.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours hazy/murky pale brown/amber with very high creamy beige head. Minimal lacing. Aroma is of bananas, fruits, yeast. Taste is of bananas, fruits, yeast, malt. Overall: Good body. Incredible balance. Refreshing. Clearly outstanding (for the style).
Sample at From the Vine on 7/27/12. Pours hazy amber with a medium white head. Aroma of banana, pepper and caramel. Malty and caramelly flavor with pepper, banana and clove through to the finish.

Big time cloves in the nose and the taste as well.  High on the carbonation and refreshing as all get out.  I would recommend this to someone who really favors the clove like qualities of a Hefe but perhaps not the banana that can often follow along.  The malt also hints at the sweetness of a dopplebock.

#1282
Bräunlich-orange in der Farbe mit viel Schwebeteilchen und reichlich Hefe als Bodensatz. Ein Fruchtaroma nach Apfel unterlegt mit deftigen Malztönen. Toller, vollmundiger Antrunk! Brotig, malziger Getreidekern, Blockmalzaroma, gute Hefigkeit, wird zunehmend herber und schreit nach dem nächsten Schluck. Insgesamt alles was ein tolles Weizen braucht. Ich sag mal: GEIL!

Pours a hazy deep orange amber with a large fluffy white head. The aroma has a  wheat - bread quality. The taste is malty (sweet) initially with a bready middle and a wheaty finish. The mouthfeel is smooth almost creamy, however just the right amount of effervescence appears at the finish. A very pleasing brew.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50 cl bottle at the Helsinki airport, consumed on 2 July, 2012Cloudy amber color, fluffy white head. Sweet, roasted, banana scent. Malty, mineral, banana taste. Banana estery aftertaste. Spritzy mouthfeel, low bitterness.

500 ml. bottle. Pours a medium, poorly retained off white head, over a cloudy, orange amber (SRM 15) body...nose is banana, bubblegum, clove....taste is banana, bubblegum, heavy clove, slight caramel, light malt cereal sweetness....mouth feel thick creamy, carbonation adds a nice spritz. This falls well within the style with all of the usual characteristics. A quite typical Dunkelweizen. BJCP 7/3/14/4/7

I poured a 500ml bottle into a wheat beer glass.

Appearance: Lighter than most dunkelweizens - a dirty/rusty orange/light brown hue. Not completely opaque because I can see a lot of fine carbonation racing towards the top. Forms a huge, off white, foamy head which mostly dissipates and leaves some lacing on the glass.

Smell: Definite banana scent from the yeast and a hint of apple cider (not sure if thats a good thing or bad).

Taste: I often wonder how Germany has more than one brewery since the staple styles from the staple breweries all taste more or less the same to me. Ayinger Ur-Weisse tastes very similar to other authentic wheat beers from Germany. Thats not a compliment or a slight - just an observation. Sweet banana flavor up front, but mild - even borderline watery. A hint of bitterness through the middle followed by some more subtle spice notes. Reminiscent of apple cider (the kind kids drink, not the hard stuff), maybe even banana bread. Clove? Sure, but thats also mild. I even get a hint of sourness or tartness, although it actually works well with the cider-like qualities of this palate. 

Since theres no discernible freshness date on the bottle, Im going to have to assume my bottle of was slightly old. Usually, beers of this style are much more complex and bold, but this seems more mild than it should be. But it still remains a satisfying, delectable beer regardless.

Drinkability: Ive yet to find a wheat beer thats difficult to drink, so calling this beer highly drinkable is stating the obvious. The mouthfeel is akin to finely carbonated water and the aftertaste is clean. Its absolutely refreshing on a hot day (or night). Im actually surprised its 5.8% ABV, which isnt all that big, but seems rather high for such an otherwise mild palate. No one will have any trouble getting through a bottle of this.

Tasty. Not as complex as Schneider or some other dunkels. Very drinkable and would live another. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours murky brown with an off-white head. Aroma is powerful banana. Flavour is also banana but with clove and some bubblegum sweetness. Very sweet. Pretty delicious.

Bottle at homebrew club. Surprised that this is higher rated than the Weihenstephaner. Pours a paler bronze, offwhite head. Nose is more muted. Some fruity esters and bready malt but subdued. Faint clove spicy notes. On tasting, its thinner bodied and lacks the creamy qualities. Faint cocoa and malt, again, just subdued overall. Okay.

16.9 bottle.  Pours a cloudy copper with plenty of head, tons of lacing.  Aroma is like freshly baked bread.. almost a rye / pumpernickel.  Taste is bready as well with some yeasty flavors coming through in the finish.  The palate is very nice.  Another great brew from Ayinger.

half liter bottle - pours murky orange/amber with creamy off-white head.  Nose is banana, cloves, and apple/pear. Flavor adds apricot.  Taste is sweet and a little tart.  Medium body.  This style is quickly becoming one of my favorites and this beer makes me want to try others like it.  A great ambassador for the style and very tasty.  Burp (spaghetti and marinara).

Good. The nose is cloves and a light citrus note. The beer is amber with a fluffy white head. The taste is bready with significant maltiness in the caramel range. There are complements in the clove and banana range. Full bodied and a little sweet with a clean smooth finish.

Pours amber with a thick white head that slowly fades.  Aroma is slightly fruity with some Belgian yeast in the mix.  Taste is medium bodied and well balanced.  Its complex to the extent that nothing really stands out but its certainly flavorful and tasty.  I primarily get some fruity notes.  Very smooth and drinkable!
Yeast, spice, banana, clove, and a little bubble gum in the aroma.  Taste starts sweet with fruit and spice.  Heavy carbonation in the finish gives a creamy mouthfeel.  Good beer for a warm day.

From notes: Pours a cloudy yellowish amber with nice off-white head. Aroma has cereal, and dried fruits. Flavour is yeasty with notes of wheat, banana, apples, and slightly herbal.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad
Poured from the bottle it has a golden amber color in the glass. The aroma has some spice and banana. Flavor has more citrus with a richness to it.  Unique beer.

Ayinger Ur-Weisse has an extremely thick, pillowy, off-white head and cloudy, orange appearance with thin bubble streams. After swishing the bottom third of the bottle, there are numerous gray blobs, which settle at the bottom and a thick, gray, descending cloud. The aroma is of white wheat bread, some banana, and cloves. Taste is similar and one also gets a little bit of bitterness, but thats minimal. Mouthfeel is medium, and Ayinger Ur-Weisse finishes fairly dry and quite refreshing. This is a good beer. RJT

Cloudy gold color.  Big head.  Huge aroma of bananas.  Mouth is nice and creamy.  Taste is full of wheat & bananas.  Reminds me of a sandwich a bit.  Overall this is a very good beer, Im just not crazy about this style.
having tried 2other brews of Ayinger,I had high expectations for this one. Found it at a roadside gas station in WA in a neat 4pack. Super happy solid beer.Mmmmhm.
UPDATED: MAY 17, 2012 Aroma is a sweet banana with some spice. Taste is lots of citrus and wheat. Overall pretty solid.

Bottle at Eulogy. Cloudy tan pour with a big pillowy head that lasted quite a while. Lightly toasted whole wheat flavors. Like liquid bread dough. Some yeasty esters. Nice full body feel. Good carbonation. Quite nice.
Delicious! Cloudy golden brown with strong banana and brioche nose. Highly carbonated and fresh in the mouth. Grainy flavors with just a hint of sweetness. Long, complex finish.

500ml bottle. Aroma is banana and fruits in general. Appearance is wonderful. A deep amber color with a hughe white head. Taste is fruity, specially banana. Full body and a soft mouthfeel with a soft carbonation. Overall one of the best Weizen I know.
I love the taste of the banana, its perfect. I also enjoy the color: slight orange with a tent of red. I enjoyed the active carbonation on the palate. Great summertime treat!

Bottle. Clove, banana, hay on the nose. Poured a clear oxidized gold. Tastes great; tropical, citrus, dough, and bread. Overall a easy to drink brew, great for a nice summer day by the pool or on the lake

Pours amber with a great big white head. Smell of wheat, yeast, bread, and hint of banana. Taste is in line with aroma. Great light mouth eel the wheat fights the sweetness. Great benchmark for the style.
Bottle from Bierzwerg. Hazy brown orange colour with big head. Aroma is roasted malt, yeast. Flavour is wheat, yeast. Tasty stuff.
Bottle.Banana and clove with bubblegum aroma, Very thick head, cloudy brown body.  Light  bodied sweet but not too sweet.  Light hoppiness in the finish.  Wheat keeps it from getting too sweet.  Sip
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: Bottle. Hazy light copper color with a thin white head. Aroma is wheat and banana. Balanced taste. Its a good hefe Weizen.

Poured into a yardstick glass.

A: Due to the way I poured it into the said glass (read: as aggressively as possible), it came out with one of the biggest damn heads Ive ever seen. Forget measuring it in fingers, this thing would have had to been measured in FEET. And it was beautiful to boot. Frustratingly, the head retention is excellent. The body itself is a very cloudy, murky dark copper color that looks vibrant.

S: Apple, banana, cloves, and that trademark "bubblegum" smell dominate the nose. Smells a bit tangy, as well. Nice!

T: Very refreshing stuff. The typical wheat beer esters are there in full force (bubblegum, banana, cloves), but it also has a tangy apple quality that mixes beautifully with the other flavors. I have to say that I slightly prefer the flavor profile of a hefeweizen, but I can really taste the top-notch quality in this.

M: Nice smoothness, with refreshing carbonation. The feel of the beer doesnt stand out, but holy shit, is it easy drinking.

O: Like I said, if given a choice between a hefe and a dunkel, Ill probably take a hefe. But this is nonetheless an excellent beer. If youve never had the style before, this is a great place to start.
Pours a golden brown.  Has a sweet, banana start and a bit of spice on the finish.
Pours a cloudy pale orangish yellow with thick white head, minimal lacing.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, and mild toasted malt.  Flavor matches well and is enjoyable, but nothing I need to go back to.

Cloudy burnt orange with a frothy and rocky head.  Looks like meringue.  Wheat and light bananas in the nose.  A medium body with low bitterness through the middle.  Malty, slightly sweet finish.  This went great with a  Thai coconut soup with noodles and mushrooms.
Ayinger always is a pleasure to the tongue and soul.  Crisp champagne bubbles that offer crisp pops of bright notes.

02-03-12 Bouteille 500ml: Belle couleur orangée, entre limpide et trouble, très vive effervescence et belle mousse blanche, brillante abondante, épaisse et persistante. Moyens arômes de bananes, de gommes ballounes et dépices, avec des notes maltée de pain et de craquelins. Petite touche de sucrée, à peine damertume. Légèrement fruitée, bonne base maltée, manque un peu de saveur, mais se boit très bien et descend facilement.  Corps plutôt léger avec une texture mince et une forte carbonisation. Finale légèrement astrigente  et courte.

Bottle. Poured a lighter brown color with a tan head. Left some lacing on the glass as it went. Aroma was caramel, molasses and malts. Flavor was very malty. Sweeter up front with lots of nuts,  caramel and malts. Good beer.
500ml bottle. A great aroma of fruit and dough. Some hints of spices. The flavor its similar with a slight tartness that makers this beer refreshing. Very enjoyable.

50cl [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Trilussa. Dark orange with a foamy white lasting head. Aroma of banana (of course!), yeast and bread. Taste is more complex than expected, for I found it fruity, spicy, pleasant but cannot say more. You only have to enjoy it.

Tasted from tall bottle into tulip glass. Sampled side-by-side with Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier Dunkel to compare two classic Dunkelweizens. The Ayinger is vastly superior. Poured a cloudy, deep orange-amber color (not as dark as expected) with long-lasting white foam and good Belgian lace. Aromas of rising dough and freshly baked whole-wheat bread, caramel, clove, banana, slight citrus, some refined German hops. Flavors of pale malt, mellow wheat, tart citrus, tangy hops bitterness, fruity and spicy fermentation. Lasting sweet & sour finish. Overall impression is that of a high-quality hefeweizen, except with the added complexity that always comes from a darker, caramelized grainbill. Really tasty, much more sophisticated than average mass-market dark lagers.

Pours a decidedly lighter color than the standard dunkel weisse;  the color is a deep hazy orange and the head is of course enormous, tight, white, and reminiscent to the top of a meringue pie.  

The aroma is yeasty from the get go, with a lot of raw malt, and general "brewery tour" aromas. Some spiciness and banana show up in the aroma but its mostly just a lot of grain and yeast, but not in a negative way/

The flavor is more complex, certainly there is some defined maltiness to the beer but its got a well rounded fruitiness with about as much ripe red apple as banana, a fairly restrained spiciness (to style), and a nice bitter zing throughout. The beer is sweet but not overbearing. 

The beer is full bodied yet lively with a prickly carbonation on the front of the tongue and a nice long finish.
Very effervescent.  Not as dark as I was expecting.  Banana and clove tasting.  Pretty solid brew.

500ml Bottle. Appearance is hazy, copper brownish color with medium, foamy, beige head. Aroma is heavy with strong floral notes and banana. Taste is typical Weizen with fruits, particularly banana, cloves, spice, but with a nice roasted grains element. Palate is medium-bodied, smooth texture, soft carbonation that sits well on the palate, and a semi-dry finish. Just a top-notch Dunkelweizen from one of the best brewers in Germany.
Good one, if you want to look for a little disadvantage, not really good after drinking, although the taste is remarkable.

500ml bottle from the state store 
Appearance: Cloudy golden with a big white head and spotty lacing 
Aroma: Banana, yeasty 
Taste: Banana, yeast, herbal and spices 
Full mouthfeel, nice and smooth
It pours long white head that disapears quick with a very nice cloudy and a bit dirty body.smells,of pineapples and hay.Taste barley, yeast and wheat.light and watery

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2016 Beautiful shimmering orange, hazy, bright white fluffy head.  Nose is sour, with a bit of banana.  Palate is subdued with bananas, its got a nice mouthfeel, ends dry.  A bit of cloves.  A nice beer.

Rerate - I underrated this, it rocks.  Nose and taste have graham crackers and ginger bread.  Spicy all around. This is a masterpiece.

Bottle form 99. Cloudy brown-gold pour with a tall, rocky, off-white head that gradually fades to a short head and leaves moderate lace. Nose is wheat, bananas and spice. Medium-light body and light, fine carbonation. Ripe fruit, yeast, apples and cloves. Finish is long, lightly sweet and spicy. Ive only had a few Dunkelweizens, but this one strikes me as very nice
Bottle. Amber color, cloudy. Yeasty aroma with clove and banana. Wheaty sweet, yeasty flavor with lots of banana and pisang ambon. Slightly disappointing considering its high average rating.

Hazed dark orange, foamy white head fades. Aroma of bright yeast and citrus, plum. Taste of dark fruit, yeast-spice, gum. Medium body, medium high carbonation. Been a while since I had a spectacular wheat beer and this is one here.

500ml bottle in a weizen glass.  Pours deep golden with a fluffy, off-white head.  Aroma of wheat, toasted and cereal malts, and floral hops.  Flavor about the same, with a little light fruit.  Average texture.  A decent beer.
Muy buena!! una Dunkelweisse con un agradable olor fresco a fruta,al paladar medio corposa, refrescante, aromatica  buena sensacion y tremendo after taste. Muy recomendada
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: Pours almost the same as an Orval - which is a good thing.  Huge white, pillowy head, cloudy amber.  But thats where the similarities stop:  this has banana, clove, wheat in the nose.  Make no mistake, this is a German beer.    Some fruit notes hit the palate, perhaps banana and apple, but here the wheat dominates.  This is a nice beer, and Im glad to have tried it.
500mL bottle.  Pours cloudy with lots of visible carbonation.  Head is loud and dynamic.  Aroma is clove, yeast.  Slightly spicy, bready yeast, banana is there somewhere.  Boring.

Bottle 50cl, a cloudy brown beer with good head. Nose is very fruity on banana and yeast like. Aroma is sweet, well malty, cereal like, fresh bread, wheat like, toasted but not much for a dunkelweizen, creamy, body is malty too, a great weissbier. Finish is on sweet malt and wheta and very fruity.

Bottle.  Pours an opaque light brown.  Looks like unfiltered apple cider.  Aroma of banana, cloves, and apple.  Most noticeable flavor is green apple.  Also notes of clove and banana.  Biting carbonation.  Medium body.  A very tasty beer.

My goodness this was one flavorful brew! This excellent brew is chock full of ripe apple flavors and Im already wishing I had me a hot apple pie to pair this up with! But this brew seemed like an apple pie in disguise! Loads of apples, cloves and other spices fill this brew from start to finish and long afterward!  When ya find some of this brew, get a few bottles and enjoy!
Bottle. Seemed to be more of a dark German Hefeweizen than a true Dunkelweizen. A balanced beer that was very drinkable. Another good offering from Ayinger.
Bottle.  Very mild toasty yeast and clove aroma.  Cloudy amber color, foamy head.  Overall very good hefe, not dark... A light dunkel. Refreshing, not as sweet as a straight hefe.  Very good.
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2012 Nice Weizen with a toasted banana and cloves character thats perceivable both on the nose and palate. Smooth, clean, and very drinkable.

500ml bottle - $3.29 at Total Wine & More in Alpharetta, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a clouded, dirtied tan body with a near-white, expansive head.

Smell: Fruity, malty nose with some traces of honey on morningtime wheat toast, a dusty yeastiness, and popped clove buds.

Taste: Faintly tangy wheat malt at the start, a moderately sweet inclusion of both wildflower honey and light-colored caramel before some fruity tastes of Gala apples, bananas, and pears. Very low, fairly brief tartness present. Light clove accent (certainly less than was present in the aroma). Very subdued bitterness. Soft but also a bit of carbonated crispness on the sweetish, lightly fruity finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-plus carbonation. Fairly smooth on the tongue.

Overall: Quite pleasant and quaffable, one of those moreish beers where you clear through the entire bottle pretty quickly. This just might beat out Weihenstephaners dunkelweizen for me.

500ml bottle.

Pours a murky brownish amber with a big creamy beige head that recedes very slowly to a thick cap of foam, leaving some nice lacing.

Aroma is sweet with lots of wheat presence but with plenty of dark malts as well.  There are other sweet fruit notes with apples and pears and a healthy dose of cloves and even some citrus.

Taste is honey-coated bananas with dark roasted malts.  It still tastes mostly like an amped up hefe with the yeast dominating though the malts add a nice layer underneath.  The finish has a nice mellow spiciness.

The mouthfeel is highly carbonated, very active on the palate, almost too active but its OK since the body is pretty meaty for the style.

Another fantastic beer from Aying, who really know their way around a wheat beer.  I could drink this all night.
Murky light amber,small white head.Spicy yeast nose.Sweet wheat malt and spicy yeast palate, lightly astringent, fruity overtones

Bottle (500ml), purchased & brought home from Germany. 
Cloves, banana and wheat along with a little spiciness & some bubble gum. Faint coriander in the background too.

A caramel brown colour, cloudy & forms a 2-finger sized foamy head with good retention.

Lots of banana quickly followed up by mild citrus flavours, a hard to detect toffee flavour and a nice spicy clove taste.

Medium bodied with a refreshing feel to it & a smooth texture overall. Goes down great & even though the carbonation is high the beer isnt gassy.

Excellent tasting & well balanced that goes down a treat. The colour isnt as dark as I remember from previous dunkelweizens I have tried but that isnt necessarily a bad thing as this one still looks (and tastes) fantastic.

1 of 1001 Beers to Try Before You Die:

Pours a cloudy orange-amber, with a giant off-white head. Smells like a tripel! Banana and clove augment honey wheat. Very mild flavor, with an effervescent but weak mouthfeel, brings out bubble gum and intensifies the banana with some apple. Good sunny day brew, but I definitely wouldnt pick it above most other things...
Bevuta accompagnando una cena in un pub, mi è sembrata un ottima dunkelweizen, non troppo carbonata va giù e non stufa...

on tap (I think) at the Ayingers Spies & Trank, Munich
Creamy white head.  Cloudy amber pour.  Very nice.  If you know your German beer types here, go for the German menu.  The English version descriptions are misleading

Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass. Appearance is a murky copper with a huge off-white head of foam that leaves thick, splotchy lacing. Aroma is bananas, bubblegum, and some butterscotch. Taste is light, musty, pumpernickel? Yes, definitely pumpernickel bread. Mouthfeel is a light tingle on the tongue and a medium body.

From the 500 ml. bottle.  The pour is medium to deep amber, with a bit of a haze, and a tremendous, frothy head.   The aroma is bountiful with wheat, spicey clove, and a banana-like fruitiness.  Little to no hop character. The body is rich and creamy with a a small cane sugar sweetness balancing out the taste. Perfect for summer.

Pours a burnt amber with plenty of weiss haze. Nose is Light fruit esters, bready malt, and sourdough. Flavor is orange zest, strong wheat character with a lingering malty breadlike quality. Fruity and complex. This is a perfect example of the style. Nothing less than what I have come to expect from Ayinger.

Bottled.  Poured fiery orange with a dense, well-retained beige head.. looked great in the glass!  The aroma picked up sweet banana, other light fruit skins (oranges, apricot, and passion fruit), and sourdough bread.. came together very nicely.  The flavor opened with some tart fruit skins, but more grainy, wheaty sugars.. almost cereal-like malts and banana meat at the core.. vanilla and cloves laced throughout.. finished on the sweeter side with lots of grainy sugars.  Medium-bodied and well-carbonated on the palate.. again there were a lot of sugars.. I like the way lighter fruits played in there.. overall very good stuff.

Pours a caramel/tea color with a white head...terrible retention and lacing.  Aroma has notable wheat with some subtle clove, bubblegum, dough.  Flavor is malty and wheaty...hints of clove and maybe even a bit of caramel but not too sweet...hint of rye?...yeasty.  mouthfeel is a bit lively...almost too much for the style...finish is mildly spicy and dry.  Fairly disappointing...maybe because my experience is somewhat limited to bolder, craft versions of the style?
Bottle from Healthy Spirits. Pours cloudy copper with a nice white head and a toffee aroma. Thre is a bready flavor with apple and some spices and a large yeast presence. This is a hearty brew.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2011 Cloudy orange with redish hints in the look. Frothy white and light tan head. Grass, spices, herbs and the hint of something sweet too in the aroma wich is subtle overall. Herbal taste, lightly bitter and lightly sour. Medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation . The herbal hints together with the light bitternes and sourness are present in the after taste. Good for summer days like today!
UPDATED: JUL 3, 2012 Smell of yeast and banana. Brown, muddy colour with beige high head. Very much aroma of banana and yeast. Sweet. Not much else.
Köpt på Far i Hatten i Malmö. Något lite mörkare än en vanlig hefe-weisse. Doft av deg och hö. Smaken kryddig med antydan av skumbanan

Bottle at Chappys Tap Room.  This just happened to be the beer that I finally finished the Chappys Beer Club with.  I didnt really plan it that way, but definitely a deserving beer.  This beer has amazing color and an insanely beautiful bright white fluffy head that never went away.  The best looking weizen that I can recall.  The flavor was light, but still full of bread, banana, spices, and was moderately sweet.  The palate was incredible as well.  Super soft, not overly thin, and very smooth.  This is a special beer from an excellent German brewery.

Bottle. Pours a hazy pale orange amber color small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy wheat malty aroma with hints of banana. Sweetish wheat malty spicy banana flavor. Has a smooth wheat malty spicy yeasty banana finish.

500ml bottle NO DATE CODE. Apparently they give a freshness date on German sold bottles but for us in the US. Anyway, a dark golden with a thick white head which doesnt last very long. Citrus, white pepper and yeast in the aroma with some faint spicy notes. Medium bodied with a low carbonation and slightly slick finish. Flavor is on the sweet side, with some fruit and light bitterness. Not sure how fresh this one is but Im guessing its not. Really would like to see some decipherable date coding on these bottles.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Beauty of a pour as expected from the Bavarian masters. Hazy copper-gold beer adorned with a super creamy, thick, white head. (This went into a Guinness glass out of necessity; wish I had a weizen glass.) Aroma is so delicate and delicious: a perfect blend of banana, bubblegum, and yeast. Outstanding refreshment factor: palate is dead-on balanced. Bubblegum flavor comes through delectably. A bit of lingering spice on the finish. This is one of the beers that got me super fired up for my trip to Germany last year; finally getting to the official review and Im remembering why. I love Ayinger: probably my favorite German beer. Must visit the brewery next trip.
Hazy amber with a quite lively tan head.  Strong smells of apple cider, yeasty.  Tastes is moderate fruit-yeast, soft but rich.  Balanced flavor.

Bottle thanks to weihenweizen, pours a cloudy golden with a decent white head and nice lacing through out the glass, aroma is full of spices mixed in with clove and banana with a little bit of funk mixed in, the flavor has great fruit notes with the sweet malt and other spices, delicious.
Pours murky dark golden with a thick off white head. Aroma is sweet malt, yeast, clove and grass. Flavor is moderately malty and sweet, clove, banana, bready yeast, and light citrus.

500ml bottle. Best before 12/11.

It pours a darker hefeweizen color, not quite as dark as a typical dunkelweizen, it is a ur-weisse (traditional/pre-modern weisse) after all. It is cloudy with a foamy, creamy-looking off-white head.

The smell is dominated by bananas with just a hint of clove and wheat.

The flavor continues the banana theme. This is just a banana bomb and then some. There is some clove , some apple, and some lemon, yes but the dominant yeast flavor here is banana. There isnt much in the way of roasted malt in the taste. There is a slight bit of hops that round it out.

This one is delicous x 10, it is a hot day in Munich today and you would be hard-pressed to find a better thirst-quencher. Screw the strawberry-lime-derpaderp, just let the yeast do its thing and youll get this.

World-class.
Perfectly balanced flavor that is pleasant to feel (in taste) for banana, no unpleasant odor, excellent beer in summer days

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2015 Very murky slight goldish/brown in appearance, similar to an English ale.  The aroma is up front wheat grain, then dominated by banana and malts.  The flavor is similar to the aroma, dominated by bananas and has a good maltiness.   Normally Im not a dunkelweizen fan but this is incredibly good, par for the course for this brewery.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2013 500 ml hazy soft dark gold burnt orange definitely unfiltered. Modestly sweet up front with a musty wheat finish. Very yeasty too, adding some of that musty spice.  subtle cloves and some sweet green apple but not much. A bit dry on the back end making it a bit hoppier than some other dark wheat?s but i really like it for the style. The finish is amazing, pepper and clove, nutmeg and dried banana. Like comfort food, it is a step back in time with an old school traditional German flavor. Stands out on its own and i like it?s simple goodness.

Pours murky copper amber with a huge beige creamy head leaving plenty of lace. Great carbonation. Aroma is very yeasty, bready, cereals, bananas, pears, smoke and grassy hoppy, mmm love it. Crispy fruity and yeasty mouthfeel. Flavor is very fruity, perry, bananas, yeasty, spicy, grassy and slightly smokey. Medium bitter fruity palate. Finishes very nice with a nicely balanced fruity, yeasty and bitter aftertaste.
Cloudy dark orange with a big white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet and light acidic finish. Smooth. 050611

500mL into weizen glass. The pour is a clear (?) gold with a fizzy head. No retention or lace. Nose is sugar and medium yeasty esters. Taste is burnt apple and soap water. So far from Weihenstephaner Dunkel it is hysterical.

On tap at Brauereigasthof Ayinger. Poured dark orange in colour with fluffy whitish head. Very fruity aroma mixed with some light spicy notes. Medium carbonated. Very smooth feeling. Pleasant fruity banana aftertaste.

500ml bottle @ Cantina, Espoo

Pours light brown with a medium head. Aroma has hints of malts and banana. Taste is quite smooth with notes of fruits and banana. Smooth finish. Nice dunkelweizen.

Angenehm fruchtiger Geruch. Gleichzeitig kräftig anmutend mit Spuren von Fichtenharz. 
Im Mundraum fruchtig-frisch (Fruchtkaugummi), bananig. Im weiteren Ablauf wird das Bier wieder kräftiger, kräuterbeeinflußt und läutet mit coolen Bitterstoffen den Abgang ein. 
Sehr gut, was hier aus der Flasche kommt. Ein tolles dunkles HW mit breit gefächerter Aromapalette, die auch noch die Nase verwöhnt. Muß man getrunken haben!

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2011 NO bananas in this. Dont know what everyone is tasting.  I taste nutty, bitter sweetness. More bitter and perhaps walnut with a creamy pallet.  The nose is rasin and mild citrus. There is a full wealth of wheat here and bread flavors. The oak aftertaste is also coupled with more walnut but no banana.  Average yet good somehow session beer.
Sampled at Hopapalooza II. Pours a hazy dark orange with off white head. Aroma is sweet, fruity and spicy. Taste has some citrus, banana, honey and spice. Nice bitterness in aftertaste.

Fruchtiger Antrunk, etwas hefig. Erst später merkt man, dass es ein dunkles Weizen ist, das Bier wird malziger, die Fruchtigkeit bleibt. Gleichzeitig wird das Bier etwas süßer, ein hintergründiger Herbeton ist passend. Der Hopfen kommt erst spät zum Einsatz, dafür aber kräftig und ausdauernd bis in den Nachgeschmack. Hier kommt die Fruchtigkeit erneut zur Geltung, auch der Malz erlebt ein Revival, es wird stärker und passt sich dem stärkerewordenen Hopfen an. Angenehm, sehr angenehm! 	 
Test vom 14.11.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,12,12,12,12,12
Yet another bottle from the Santa Claus of Bavarian Beer (Bierkrug) - many thanks! Nice bananas, smooth flavor and balance. A nice weisse!

Picked up a bottle at Chevy Chase in DC. Served in a weizen glass.

Pours a moderately-dark golden-bronze color with a thin white head that recedes somewhat quickly and doesnt leave behind much other than a bit of spotty lacing. Almost no haze. The nose is pretty weak with a bit of sweetened malt and clove. A touch of banana there as well. Taste is quite plain as well. Theres just not much coming from the malt or the yeast. Mouthfeel is a bit light and undercarbonated, though its smooth. Drinkability is decent enough, though theres really nothing all that special about this beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-20-2011

Bottle 0.5 L.
Dark, golden, cloudy body, with large, creamy, white head, mostly lasting with a good lacing; high density of tiny bubbles.
Very intense banana aroma with some spicy and malty character; some hoppy notes (lemon) are also present.
Intense sweet flavour with moderate acidic notes, particularly in the finish.
Medium body with a creamy texture; lively carbonation; some astringency in the finish.
Very good beer.

One of my favorite wheat beers!  Pours an amber yellow with a big white head that smells of bready bananas, cloves and malt.  A malty sweet flavor greets the tongue before spreading its wings and flying into hints of banana, clove and possibly apple.  Medium creamed body and good to the last drop.  Ayinger never lets me down.
Bottle looks really good, beer in the glass dark organge, nice head. Starts strong, very yeasty, fruity like banana and plum. Modest sweet. Well balanced finish, a bit moldy. Still a great beer!

Aroma: Lots of banana and bubblegum with hints of clove.
Appearance: Dark gold, cloudy, with a minimal head.
Taste: Medium sweetness with slightly sour finish.
Palate: Full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation with a long, but dry, finish.
Overall: I really like this beer, and its almost a go to wheat for me, but Im slowly becoming disenchanted, making this an above average brew, but not the mind blowing experience that it once was. Too much of a good thing, I guess.
bananas all over this one, light roasted malts with light malts meld well, cloves are in there too, very tastylager

Bottle. Medium amber with a thick head. Aroma of banana, caramel, clove, some biscuits. Crackery malt flavor with banana, clove, a touch of honey and caramel. Not quite dunkel, but the character is there. Great balance. Great stuff.
Love ayinger they have never let me down. Another great choice. Nice smooth beer with medium head. Has ur typical Bavarian hef taste with a dark body. Greatbeer

Tap at their Munich beerhall. Pillowy white head with great retention; muddy dark brown and some rusty orange for the color. Loads of bananas that dominate the aroma. Bananas continue strong into the flavor but still tart and a little sour.  Finishes with residual banana sweetness and bubblegum hints. Pretty good stuff.
Apples and cloves inside a full bodied dark haze. Yummy! The head stays with the beer. Great drink. Bakery bread smell.

Moving on from the straight up Hefe I went a little dunkel this friday afternoon.  Pours a dirty swamp water yellow with huge milk shake thick head.  tastes of cloves, wheat, some fruit, and roasted malts.  Nice transition beer from the light of day towards sunset.
One of the best Hefes out there. It is rich and darker than your average Hefe. I like the cloves in it.

Pours a nice, hazy copper with a full white head blanketing the beer. Nice aroma of spice and banana, with sweet malt. The wheat leads to a medium mouthfeel which covers the outside of the tongue. Chewy biscuit. Taste of sweet malt finishes quickly as the spices are also present.
Pours deep amber with thick off-white head and foamy lacing.  Notes of wheat and citrus.  Well balanced taste that is crisp and sessionable.

Bottle from BBM. This beer is really carbonated with active bubbles. A bubbly white head erupts then slowly fades away to nothing. Its a very cloudy beer and deep orange in color. Lots of predictable esters are in the aroma, seems well balanced. There are notes of clove, banana, grain and flowers. It transitions into the flavor well. Soft floral notes along with lots of banana and a clove finish are hinted at. It is fair to say there is more caramel character than their standard hefeweizen, but its not near as roasty as some other dunkelweizens that Ive had. I like it.
Hazy copper/light brown in the glass with an off-white head.  Aroma of dried fruits and nutty malt.  Very smooth mouthfeel.  Nice wheaty flavors with a hint of roasted malt.

500 ml bottle. Pours hazy-amber with a huge, long lasting, foamy white head.  Aroma is of yeast, spices with hints of banana. Medium, slightly crisp body.  Taste is yeast, wheat, brown sugar, spices with hints of banana.  Very delicious heffe.

Orange-tinted opaque amber beer with bubbly white head, low retention.  Aromas of bread, hay, light bubble gum.  Flavors were of a cool, humid place, like a cool water from a basement faucet.  Grassy, doughy, sticky, with very light banana flavors.  Light carbonation.  An easy drinking beer for less adventurous palates.

50 cl bottle @ Villevalla pub. Cloudy, dark amber appearence with with small, off-white head. Banana/clove aroma with much sweetness. Malty, sweet taste with some bitterness. Nice, smooth, balanced flavour. Medium to full bodied with high carbonation. Vety good hefe.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2014 Bottle @ home. Pours a hazy dark orange appeaance with a small cream head that is gone quickly. Medium to dark wheat malts with the nose with some banana. Medium bodied wheat beer with yeast. Lighter than other Dunkelweizen and darker than a German Hefeweizen in a category of its own.

16.9 oz. bottle from Johns Grocery Iowa City

Ar: Classic hefe aroma.  Nice spicy clove notes along with touches of cinnamon, ginger, and banana.
Ap: Pours an extremely hazy medium copper with a massive pillowy weizen head that sits atop my weizen.  The head lasts quite a while.  Pretty beer.
T:  Big burnt sugar note is quite a surprise.  The flavor is like a spicy version of bananas flambe.  Theres a bit of tartness on the finish to balance this beer, which is somewhat sweet.  Edit: I just realized why this doesnt taste like a Hefe:  It isnt one.  Beer rating fail.
P:  Fizzy, chewy hefe body.

O: Man, this is a very good dark wheat.  Its not particularly dark for a dunkles hefe-weizen.  Upon pouring, I thought this was a standard weizen, and I was a bit confused by the burnt sugar flavor.

Pours a hazy cloudy golden hue with a fast vanishing frothy light head. Aroma slight hints of apple. Taste on the light side but solid. Nice malty rush with somewhat of a fruit like finish. Cant beat the price for this beer for the quality you get. I almost forgot why I once called Ayinger my favorite beer.

bottle - pours a cloudy copper color with huge fluffy pure white head. Aroma has definite clove notes, as well as honey, bananna, pear, lychee fruit, touch of vanilla. Flavor has cloves and bananna as well, with a touch of caramel and stone fruit, hint of lemon, orange zest, ginger, yeast. Finish is a touch sweet. A bit thin on the palate, but a very nice brew overall.

A: The pour is a little light for what Im used to seeing out of a Dunkelweizen. A light copper color with a massive, soapy, off-white head.

S: Starts off with the usual suspects such as banana, bubblegum, and clove. An almost sourdough breadiness which is a bit different as well. Some hints of floral hops are present as well.

T: A big blast of banana and clove flavors to begin. Fairly sweet with a surprisingly prominent level of floral hoppiness. A subtle to moderate bitterness and some light citrus. Not quite as bready and hearty as I had hoped for.

M: The body is medium with a pretty high level of carbonation that gives a slightly creamy feel.

D: Dunkelweizens continue to be a bit of a weird style to me. This one was one of the better examples Ive had, but still not quite as enjoyable as a traditional hefeweizen or weizenbock.

Appearance: bready orange with a tinge of amber here and there. Fluffy white head, slightly off-color, fades slowly into a thick blanket. Haze throughout her whole body thanks in all parts to her unfiltered darker wheat delights. Swirls with small bits of lace.

Nose: honey whole grains; touch of weight much like honey whole grain bagels and loaves. Almond nuttiness. Hint of greenness with banana peels before giving way to fresh moist banana bran muffins.

Palate: full, chewy, and bready with a medium weight. Sweetness of ripe bananas and honey underneath while her top is bright with green banana peels. Dry roasted whole almonds for a subtle pervasive nuttiness. Honey kisses whole grains while bran muffins enjoy a generous drizzle of that sweet sticky nectar of the bees for a continual chewy and moist mouthfeel and body. Almost non-existent presence of cloves; faint and flickering. Green bananas linger in the finish with more ripe bananas settling in the back of each swallow.

Final Thoughts: Ive had many a dunkel Weisse of heavier darker designs, and yet there is something about the Ayinger Ur-Weisse which oozes class and timeless sophistication. Certainly not new to the German beer scene, Ayinger has a quintessential classic in their Ur-Weisse which I would gladly enjoy on a very regular basis.

pours a cloudy apple cider with a generous head that dissipates to 1/8".  Taste is of banana pudding and vanilla wafers, finishing with a tart bitter carbonation.  The finish lingers, moving back toward the bananas.  A tasty brew, but a bit heavy for session drinking.
Bottle at ÖBWF 2010. It poured a hazy golden liquid with an orange tint, small white head. Flavour of yeast, foam banana and wheat. Fresh and easy to drink.

500 ml bottle. pored into a weizen glass. Hazy amber with an off white head. Left lacing in the glass. Nice tart wheat, brown sugar, banana clove aromas. Smooth medium body. Malty sweet glazed banana flavor with mild clove and tart wheat to balance. Maybe a hint of apple. Very good dunkel.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2011 0.50l bottle @bir&fud beershop (Rome). Im not a fan of this kind of beer, but its definitely an excellent weisse. The aroma is quite strong and nauseating (malt, cereals and banana) but the taste is pleasantly good.

Pours a dark, cloudy, yellow with a full three finger fluffy head and nice lacing.  Fruity and light smell, very much like a hefeweizen, less like a Dunkel. Clove and Banana dominate the nose.  Very smooth taste. Apples and bananas predominantly, rounded out by some spiciness. Dry finish.  Smack of carbonation as you drink, medium bodied.

Bottle. Murky brownish-amber with off-white head. Smells wheaty with a little citrus. Tastes like a hefe - a little bit of yeast, fruit and maltiness to it, but the flavor isnt quite full. Just seems a bit watery. Still, a nice and refreshing beer, especially during warm weather.

500 ml bottle at The Royale; they brought in a few Ayinger things for their Tuesday night Oktoberfest extravaganza.  Pours a bright, cloudy amber color with a huge, frothy, rocky off-white head; absolutely gorgeous-looking beer.  Notes of banana, whea, clove, orange citrus, sour lemon citrus (more in the nose), cereal, caramel and Munich malts, straw, and nuts.  Medium-bodied, with a wheaty, malty mouthfeel and soft carbonation.  This greatly exceeded expectations, and is just a great German beer.
Bottle. High creamy and long lasting white head. Hazy muddy orange body. Banana peach pear aroma. Mild and somewhat thin bodied sweet fruity flavor. Low carbonat. Long sweet fruity aftertaste.

500 ml bottle @ home. Rated @ 21.5.2010.
Pours a hazy orange brown colour with a foamy white head which settles fast. Aroma of banana, citrus, wheat, spices and yeast. The taste is very straightforward just like a Dunkelweizen should be. Wheat, banana and spices. Medium bodied, a bit watery texture and lively carbonation. Enjoyable.

bottle.  Pours a dark amber, downright mud color with a big, white head.  Nose is of banane, wheat and yeast.  Taste is of banana and yeast.  Mouthfeel is medium.  Very nice, especially for a wheat beer.
Great beer. Full flavored yet not overwhelming. Nice foamy head. Flavor starts just a little sharp and then smooths out. Very satisfying beer.

0,5 l bottle.
Murky-hazy amber colored beer with a stable foamy white-off white head. Caramel, malt,  fruits like fig and citrusses in the aroma with the classic phenolic banan weizen character. Smooth mouthfeel, caramel(less toasted than expected) and malt base, fruity taste with spicies, citrusses. Well done, fine..
Bottle. Unclear amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, wheat, banana and citrus.
Amber / brown.  Toasted bubblegum aroma with a slightly tart, cirusy taste.  Finish is toast and dark fruit.  Good.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 I quite like Ayinger and this was no exception. Yeast and rich. fruits and clove. Serving: Bottle

This was very, very different from other beers Ive had.  I am going to try a few different versions of this style and then re rate this.  It had a flavor of Bubblegum and Black Licorice followed by a banana aftertaste.  It was very good, the taste was very different and very good.  Ayinger knows what they are doing, I am going to try a few more of their beers.  Thumbs up!
Excellent dunkelweizen. Pours beauty cloudt dark orange withcreamy head; aroma very earthly; tastes refreshing but with some subtle wheat grass and even banana notes.  Very nice

16.9 oz. bottle- Pours muddy orange with a nice white head, aroma is yeast and has a earthyness, just a very clean smelling beer. The flavor is a more malty weisse beer that still has the hefe chacacteristics, it is basically a German hefe with added caramel malts, very tasty. The aftertaste is very sweet like brown sugar, full bodied, creamy, carbonation is high, but not for the style. Good beer.

Poured a pale amber with an off-white coloured, creamy and fine pored head, which collapses slowly.
Sour fruity smell.
The tasteing begins light sharp, moutfeels becomes after that slick, textures medium to moderate thin, flavours of banana.
The malt-charactered and rather mild aroma is of caramell, cereals, citrus and cloves.
The light tart finish is spicy, citric, nutty and dry with a spicy aftertaste at last.
Rather a mild one, in spite of that overall vice.

Poured a hazy amber color with a large white bubbly head.  Aroma of esters, wheat, and banana.  Some orange as well.  Taste has lots of orange and lemon with some banana in the finish.  Flavors of pale malts.  Not so much caramel malts, as I expected.  Very carbonated with a good amount of spices.  Seems more like a hefeweizen than a dunkelweizen.

Ayinger makes solid wheat beers in the true german style. Unfortunately, I dont remember much else about this beer.  Adding notes from last few months, have not been able to comment perfectly on each beer. I blame the beer.

Bottle: Pours a medium amber with your typical ayinger fluffy head. Smells and flavors are hefweizen - Clove, Spice, Yeast, combined with malt and darker fruits. While I enjoyed the beer for what it is, I think I prefer the hefeweizen more than this.

Színe átmenetet képez a narancssárga szűretlen búza és az egészen sötét barna dunkel között. A tetejét birtokló hab is igen koszos, öreg pergamenszerűen sárgás színezetű. Egyébként kemény ,nagy  és kitartó, mint Gibraltár sziklái. Illata élesztős, citrus gyümölcsös, enyhén pörkölt malátás. Íze inkább a hagyományos szűretlen búza sörökéhez hasonlít, mint a sötét fajtákéhoz. Van benne egy kevés pörköltes és karamellás felhang, de nem túlzott. Jelentkezik a komló is az ízek között, de ez inkább az utóízére jellemző. Sűrű, elég testes de nem túl szénsavas. Az utóízében ott a már említett komló és egy kis keserű narancsos zamat, közepesen tart ki a szánkban. Finom, de valahogy többet vártam tőle. Semmiben sem túl kirívó, de nem is túl lapos. Kicsit talán faragatlan.

cloudy dark yellow/brown, smooth large head.
mild wheaty faint peachy aroma.
flavor is wheaty, yeast, peach, vanilla. Very mild, alc. well hidden.
Pours medium amber with a solid head, which also subdues the aroma. Otherwise a very nice Weizen with a sweet but not oppressive flavour and well-balanced bitterness.

Bottled. Dark golden coloured. Hazy. Dense off white head. Aroma of yeast, banana, cloves and vague caramel. Flavour of light smoke, yeast, banana, light cloves. Medium to full bodied. Dry yeasty and bubblegum dense end. Not your ordinary dunkelweisse in my book. Is more like an ordinary hefe. And a dammed good one.

500mL bottle from Hi Time Wines.  Pours cloudy, hazy yellow/orange with nice head and some lacing.  Aroma is slight wheat, spices, and malts, all blended together nicely.  Taste is refreshing, light, malty, nice balance of wheat and cloves.  Slight bitterness at the finish, but a very nice finish and easy drinkability.

500 mL into Weissen glass

Color was a hazy straw brown. Light tan head. Left medium level of lacing.

Aroma was of clove and bananas (similar to a hefewissen). Taste was similar. Roasted fruits and nuts were present also.

Mouthfeel is smooth at first and then goes down creamy. It has a sticky aftertaste.

Overall, I really enjoyed this beer. $4 for a half liter is kinda steep, but I think it was worth it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-14-2008 08:12:51
Bottle. Cloudy amber with a big white head. The aroma is clove, caramel, banana and citrus. The flavour is sweet caramel, banana, citrus, candy and clove. Long spicy finish.
500mL bottle, pours murky dark orange. Aroma of banana upfront, with wheat, clove and spices. Flavour of banana, clove, spices, and roasted malt. Excellent.

Bottle. Aroma is bananas, yeast and green apples. Appearance is a cloudy orange brown color with an inch of pillowy head. Taste begins with doughy yeast and lemon citrus flavors followed by honey, caramel and a hint of cloves. Mouthfeel is slightly creamy and medium bodied with strong carbonation and a crisp finish. Overall flavor is a combination of yeast, malt sweetness and ripe fruit. Its not quite as tasty as their Hefeweizen but its still a refreshing brew in its own right.
Strong aroma of bananas and a large white head. The taste is sweet and various,  with banana, apple, straw, and a hint of chocolate malt. More palatable than many wheat beers.
50 cl bottle. Pours an orange amber color with a foamy, fluffy white head. Aroma of caramel, wheat and cloves. Fairly complex taste including apples, bananas, clove and yeast. Rather weak mouthfeel.

50 cl bottle. Pours a murky darlk orange color with lots yeasts in suspension. Big bubbly white head. Quite fast dissipating foam. Aroma is mostly sweet with cloves and apples. Nice sweet  yeasty taste. Medium bodied with high carbonation. Overall a good weizen, maybe a bit too sweet imo.

Nice fruity nose, lots of peach and a touch of banana, some fresh herbal hops and just a touch of honey malts. Taste is light to moderately sweet, lightly bitter; light banana, pear and peach, touch of apple, herbal-minty hops. Very solid.

500mL bottle.  Pours a cloudy yellowish amber with a bunch of white head.  Aroma has a lot of cereal, some fruits, and touch of roast.  Taste is cereal, lots of yeast, wheat, banana, apples, and a bit of herbal character.  Finish is smooth, with malts and a bit of fruit.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Speis und Trank. Color brown with medium lasting head. Aroma roasted malt, fruit, bread. Taste caramel, dark fruits, banana.

16.9 Oz.  Pours a pretty amber with good head that hangs around.  Aroma is fruity esters, yeasty, banana, clove with some bready notes in the back.  Taste follows with the aroma quite fluently very dry with a medium tartness maybe some slight alcohol . Finish is dry and clean.  Very tasty brew!
500ml bottle. Pours cloudy deep orange with white head that leaves no lace at all. Aromas of spiceand citrus. Very tingly on the tongue with flavours of light spice and a long sweetish finish.
Cloudy deep golden amber with a huge off-white head, lasting well. Fruity yeasty wheat banana pleasant aroma, caramel. Good mouthfeel. Fruity wheat caramel yeasty, pleasant.

Pours cloudy brownish amber, with a thick off-white head that held well but left little lacing. Aromas of bananas, granny smith apples and clove supported by a strong maltiness. Sweet caramel malt dominate the taste, with plenty of light fruit in the background. Medium body, healthy amounts of carbonation, and a surprisingly light finish with a touch of hops to set off the malt sweetness.

Bottle at home.
Hazy amber coloured with a medium sized creamy off-white head.
Fruity aroma of spices, yeast, bananas and caramel.
Sweet and fruity flavour of spices, caramel and bananas.
Sweet finish.

Pours very dark amber, like maple syrup.  Thick white head and some lacing.  Banana, citrus and yeasty aroma.  Complex flavor of oranges, clove, banana and yeast.  som dark roasted malt as it developes.  warming finish.  Great!
Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Cloudy red/brown - white head. Banana, roasted, fruity, light flowery, light buttery, caramel, light roasted, ryebread. Plain.

50 cL bottle. Pours dark brown with a huge and long living white head. Aroma is initially is rather dominated by fruity estery and dry phenolic yeast notes. Flavour starts the same way to a dominant bubblegum impression, yet the dark and rich level of malt provides a nice base for the otherwise yeast dominant flavours. Goes more dry and smooth breadish from back of the tongue/nose. Mild acidic/bitter and nice dry roasted malt impression into the far finish.

The Ayinger Ur-Weisse pours as a dark yellow color (not quite gold). The aroma has doughy yeast, light but noticeable hops, and something of a fruity essence.
