As I sip the beer, it has a pleasant sourness, and I catch more of the strong aroma as well. This is a somewhat harsh beer, but it has a good body.  As a whole, Im quite pleased with this beer from Ayinger!

500ml bottle 

Aroma - classic aroma...cloves, bubblegum, bread..light hay

Appearance - burnt orange color (clay), huge pillowy white head, cloudy

Taste - banana, cloves, apple juice (red delicious) and bread

Overall - just a simple, delicious, fantastic summertime beer.  My local BevMo had carried this, then stopped and is now carrying it again.  Thank you!
Apricot nectar color. Minimal white head. Huge banana nose, with clove, bread and light cinnamon. Banana, clove, walnut for flavor. Flavor is hugely pronounced.

Damn Germans. They can make some fine beer. This one pours a slightly darker amber with a big lasting head. Aroma is typical of the style with some nice yeast and malt notes added. Flavor is also typical with a nice bit of carbonation to dry the mouth and ask for more.
Damn Ayinger makes it right. Huge flavor, huge aroma, yeasty yet smooth. Give me more.

16 oz bottle from Goodie Goodie - very nice malty aroma of wheat fields. The appearance is dead on for a Hefe - amber gold haze with white tiny bubbly head.  This beer has great head retention for a slow drinker like myself.  Wonderful banana and clove flavoring. Great on the palate and leaves that banana and wheat flavors on the back of the palate.  Overall and final score is currently my highest rating!!!  The way a real German wheat beer should be.

Enjoyed from a 16.9oz bottle in a tumbler.  The beer pours a darkish amber color, perhaps a touch on the light side, for the style.  The nose brings moderate notes of banana esters, and a lighter touch of clove and some other spices, along with an underlying hint of Munich malt.  The palate begins estery, but in a manner that is far more refined than other examples of the style.  Again, banana is the main flavor, followed by a nice malt character, and some spice.  Hops are not apparent in any aspect.  The carbonation is a little bit lighter than I anticipated, but pairs nicely with the beers other characteristics.  The finish is moderately estery and moderately sweet.  Overall, a great example of an oft-flawed style.

Pours a deep burnt orange.  Somewhat offwhite head that dissipates quickly but leaves a trace throughout.  Lively carbonation  keeps the film hanginf around.  Aroma is banana, bubblegum, cloves and yeast.  Smells terrific.  Taste is sweet with a very light and crisp mouthfeel.  Overall this is a solid brew.

$3.50 500ML bottle - Random pickup at Krogers of all places.  Depending where you live, Kroger Marketplaces can have a surprisingly decent selection.  This is my first bottle from Ayinger and it is not bad.  Terrible astringent smell, but things got better from there.  Complex, fruity, and yeasty.  Wheat beers are not my favorite, but this one gets more than a passing grade from me.  Glad to try a new brewery.
Pours hazy brown with a pretty light head. Aroma is wheaty with some sweet banana. Flavor is surprisingly light with the sweet banana dominating a bit too much.

Pours hazy orange with big white head; complex fruit bready aroma with hints of toasted banana and spiciness; medium to full body, high carbonation (though it smoothens very quickly in the glass); flavor is quite sweet, a bit caramelish at first, and fruity with actually quite strong notes of pear and only hints of banana; finish is dryish with quite a spicy feeling.

500 ml. bottle.  Pours a cloudy rust color, with fizzy off white head which vanishes quickly.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, plantain, bubblegum.  Lightly spiced (clove) wheat flavor with lots of bread on the finish.  There is a mild fruitiness but it is mostly overpowered by the bread for me.  However, still crisp and refreshing, medium-bodied.  Youll like this if you dont mind bready beer, its pretty good.

Pours a murky yellow/brown color, and leaves a nice white pillow of foam on top.  Has a yeasty aroma with a hint of spice.  Has a nice spice hit at the front of the tongue which yields to flavors of clove and banana.  Finishes with the flavor of oranges.
bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  cloudy yellow with a white head.  big clove notes with banana and wheat.  nice thickness, smooth banana flavor tagged with light clove and a sticky finish.

Lightly cloudy dark amber with a light froth. Aroma like a banana Hoegaarden! Flavour and mouthfeel start out zesty. Banana and light clove notes. Yeasty finish and then back to the banana and clove for the finish. Blends together nicely.

(500ml bottle) pours clear orange, nice light tan head and lace. Nose of Very ripe banana, yeast, cinnamon and spices, light citrus. Taste of ripe banana, spices, light lemon and orange, great sweetness and near perfect body and carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a murky brown body topped by a crown of white foam which lingers on the sides of the glass. Nose is delicious: banana, a touch of clove and notes of yeast. These flavors are also evident in the taste; Ayinger Ur-Weisse is very well blended and with a fresh, almost tap-like palate and fruity feeling, in spite of the clear and present malty notes. Yummy. Sweet and well-rounded at the same time, this is really a dunkel weizen I could drink a lot of.

One of the most delicious things I have ever tasted.  Quite complex and still refreshing as some lighter wheat beers.  Wonderful banana clove and fruity ester aromas, super complex but not overwhelming.  Would go great with many foods.

Bottle and served in my Ayinger Weizen glass: Pours a light chestnut brown with a lovely beige creamy head which left excellent lace upon the glass. The aroma has notes of bubblegum, clove, banana, lemon and wheaty weizen vapours along with a roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, walnut and bready dunkel notes. The taste is a very balanced sweet and nutty malt profile with noticeable spicy and fruity undertones. A bit of a mineral and metallic note about the finish but not too distracting. The mouth feel is above average for the genre, a bit oily and chewy with a fair amount of lively carbonation as well. Overall among the better example of the style, shocked I had not rated this before.
Bottle.  Pours a cloudy amber chestnut color with a dense foamy beige head.  Tons of banana in the aroma and flavor with other notes of yeast, clove, and other spices.  Very drinkable.
Amber in color with a very frothy, white head. Banana dominates the nose with a bit of spiciness. So easy to drink! Banana and malts make up the flavor with a hint of apple in the finish.

The surprise hit of the evening!  Pours a cloudy brassy color from bottle.  Thin head.  Aroma:  Sweet / "winey" but muted.  Sweet / sour grape-like flavor w/ some malty smokiness.  Unexpectedly light mouthfeel w/ clean finish and some alcohol heat.  Quite good.

500ml bottle.  Hazy, raw umber pour with a large, fluffy off-white head that recedes to nothing.  Aroma is of bananas, malt, spices and some fruityness.  Flavor follows the nose with bready yeast, cloves, hints of bananas, bubblegum and light malt sweetness.  Balanced light carbonation and a medium body.  Yeasty, spicy and malt lingering finish.

Bottle BBE dec/2009. Alcoholic and yeasty aroma is quite strong.  Hazy orange colour and tall white head makes this beer good looking. Taste is very fruity, lovely stuff. Smooth mouthfeel, medium+ body. Again a very nice beer from Ayinger!

Ayinger Brewery
UR-Weisse Dunkel Weizen
Maybe out on limb here as we are not the biggest fan of weizens but what the hell.
Pours hazy honey colored with a tinge of green. Medium white head that dissipates quickly. Sweet aroma of yeast, bread and dried bananas, but mostly yeast. Effervescing mouthfeel. Tastes like a lot of wheat beers with more yeast and a slightly sour metallic finish. Not my style, but I wont pour it out.

Pours out a dark gold/orange, lighter than other dunkels Ive had but certainly darker than a hefeweizen.  Smells of bananas with a hint of caramel sweetness.  Has a nice caramel flavor to go with the typical banana of a wheat beer, sort of like a Bananas Foster in a glass, best dunkelweizen Ive had

Recognizably a wheat beer, but with a dark, almost primitive undertone to it. I really liked this beer; it drank easy, despite the complexity, and was a very rich take on the traditional wheat beer -- which sometimes comes off shallow. Id drink this one again.

Pours an orangish-amber color with a large white head. Aroma is predominantly apples, with a little malt in there as well. The taste is heavy on the bananas, but you also get some apple. No real hops or malt are present in the aroma. A very flavorful beer that is heavy on the fruit. Good beer.

500 mL bottle pours amber with a good bit of off white head into a weizen.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, spice, banana, clove.  Holds true to the style: hefe wheat, yeast, clove complimented by sweet malts and raisins.  Medium bodied and pretty straightforward.  Surprisingly mid range carbonation with a fuzzy mouthfeel.  Enjoyable but not really my thing.

Beautiful German wheat beer. Great to have it available here in Puerto Rico! Aroma somewhat yeasty. Finely bubbled foam that did not last until end of glass. Was expecting a dunkel weizen as promised on label but color is - eher mittel dunkel oder dunkel Gold. Nonetheless, the flavor is typical hefeweizen with slight banana and pineapple flavors dominating. A good solid and refreshing Hefeweizen.
bottle - pours a medium amber color, smallish head. The aroma is of spicy orange biscuit. The taste is somewhat bitter and spicy, lacking a bit of caramel to be truly good, still a great beer.

50cl bottle.  Large off-white head atop murky dark amber body.  Aroma is medium sweet, banana, clove, light bubblegum, caramel, light lemon.  Taste is medium sweet, banana, clove, some bubblegum, lemon, caramel.  Light-medium body, some effervescence, very drinkable.

Hazy orange pour, white head.  The aroma is spicy, clove, some banana.  The flavor follows almsot exactly, maybe a tad sweeter.  The finish is a spicy, burning feeling.  Medium mouthfeel.  Decent, nothing especially great.
Bottle (small sample). Light gold pour, banana and clove on the nose. Clove taste, medium mouthfeel, and a little tang to the taste. Pretty good.
From a bottle poured a cloudy amber color with a good amount of head.  Nice sweet malty cirus flavor with a lasting finish.

Pours a medium dark golden that is very murky with decent carbonation and a light frothy white head. Aromas of banana, clove, light spice, ginger, bubblegum, and some yeasts. Flavors of light to medium yeasts, banana, clove, ginger, spice, and slight apricot. Slightly sweet with and end that begs for the next.

From bottle at Haket. 
Cloudy pale orange with medium-sized creamy head. Fruity aroma with elegant banana touch along with peat and clove. Big-ish body with light acidity, nice fruitiness and light phenolic, as in tin. Rounded smooth mouthfeel. Great hefe yet again!

(br-btl cm-lbl, "Authentc Bavarian Dunkel Weizen", "unfiltered dark wheat beer", "Hefe-Weizenbier", 5.8%)

cpr-opq, too^co2, med-head, med-body.

fruity aroma, co2 §sour §malty T1, fruity cider T2, §wheat-tart T3, same thru.

Pours a dark cloudy amber/light brown.  Sizeable off-white head, mostly diminishing.  Very similar to Hoegarden to me.  Spices of banana, vanilla - very smooth and balanced.  Great taste with little lacing staying through pour.  Another great beer from Ayinger - SALUDE!

UPDATED: APR 6, 2013 Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours light brown with nice medium off-white head, and some lacing.  Taste is banana, bready dark malt, and some clove. Great Dunkleweizen.

Great color.  Looks like liquid caramel.  Has a tangy aroma that is also very fruity and fizzy smelling.  Sweet taste with some odd oily lingerings.  , sort of like bananas that are overripe.  Not bad, but was expecting it to be better.
Pours light amber brown with a big off white head.  Aroma is banana and spice with hints of caramel.  Flavor is spicy, yeasty with a lot of banana/phenols coming through. Pretty good.

(Bottle) Pours hazy orange with a creamy head. The aroma is fruity with tones of oranges, apricots and bananas. Phenols bring notes of incense and clove. Undertones of mint, vanilla and flowers. The flavour is light sweet, light bitter and tiny acidic. Tones of oranges, banana clove and flowers. The mouthfeel is round and robust. Near medium carbonation. Some wheat and banana in the finish. Medium bodied.

16.9 oz bottle Market of Choice. Pours out a hazy amber with a big white head and minimal lacing. Aroma of banana, clove, apples. Flavor is wheat with banana, clove, apples thrown in. Theres a crisp snap to this beer, very effervescent. Definitely enjoyed this one quite a bit.

Hazy and dark peach-coloured beer with a medium head. The scent is filled with wheat and delicious fruit. The tastes really wheaty too, with some banana in there. The mouthfeel is a bit too carbonated.

High carbonated beer. Cloudy darker golden body with a huge cream head. Smell and taste is very yeasty and citrusy. I got some wheat and banana but mostly citrus. Not sure if this beer is as good as its been rated. I will have to rerate eventually.
UPDATED: DEC 13, 2009 Bottle; orangey brown pour. Great aroma. Taste of mild fruit and banana notes, with spice The body is good but thought it would be a little fuller bodied. A good dark wheat beer

sample from the bottle at The 2009 Great Decatur Beer Festival on 10/17/09... pours a cloudy golden with a white head... some sweet yeast and light citrus notes on the nose... banana and light spice over the body... nice clean finish - one of the better wheat beers Ive had...

banana and citrus on the nose with a hint of alcohol. white foamy head barely hangs on. Cloudy amber pour. Absolutely delicious. bread, banana and spice notes. No alcohol taste to speak of. (It is only 5.8). Smooth mouth feel. great fruity notes linger on the palate.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2010 A delicious banana, clove wheat beer.  The beer is a shade of burnt orange with a lot of haze and a creamy head.  Aroma is mostly banana with good wheat spice.  Flavor is same with citric note.  Feel is properly well-carbonated.  This is a very good wheat beer and one of the few that I would put up with Weihenstephans lineup.  Edit 10/1/2010: Not quite as good as their hefe in any category but very drinkable and a great beer to pair with a hearty meal.  Good looking beer with an orange-brown body and a big, creamy, ecru head.  Its entirely hazy.  The aroma is banana bread with some fairly mild spice.  It definitely tends toward slightly toastier/breadier flavors than the hefe, though I might not have noticed that if I hadnt had the hefe so recently.  The taste is sweet and fairly full.  Carbonation is appropriate for the style, though, perhaps, on the softer side.  Sweet wheat flavor is plentiful, but its a bit toned down.  Good beer, but I havent had enough dunkelweizen to assess it competently.

poured hazy orange with a moderate foamy white head.  Lots of visible bubbles in the beer.  Aroma is banana, clove, lemon, and yeast.  Flavor is a bit sour and fruity, with bready malts and spice on the finish.  Very spritzy light mouthfeel.   Tasty.

Bottle. A sweet smell, strong aroma of bananas and some yeast and champagne. The white creamy head is medium large and has a long duration. The body is dark orange, lively and cloudy. The taste is a mixture of light bitter and sour, rather short. The body is light, creamy and with a lively carbonation. A good solid Weizen.
Orangish color, off white head.  Yeasty and fruity aroma.  Flavor is a bit spicy, with yeast and bananas.  Good and smooth.
50cl bottle. Large yellowish head that lasted for quite long. sweet aroma, with taste of fruit, bananas and citrus. Very nice weizenbier.

500 ml bottle - muddy orange with thin white head; cloves, bananas, yeasty, lemony goodness; full bodied with soft texture and flavors of creamy, wheat and cloves; definitely heavy on the cloves mixed with lemony sweetness; quite tasty overall

Bottle in trade with Bonster.  Full pour in wheat beer glass yeilds a darker toned center column with a hazy honey tan encompassing it.  It slowly blends together for a caramel haze with a tight white head.  Nose of creals and wheat malt.  Soft rounded body has tones of pear and scaramel apples.  wheat /yeast tang offset the subtle sweetness.  Clove and citrussy finish spark the tastebuds for more.
Nice subtle wheat aroma, a little spicy taste, but very good, aftertaste just kinda fades out.

Bottle poured into a Weizen glass.  Sweet and acidic nose.  Banana, cantaloupe, and faint clove.  Hazy, light caramel color.  Bright white head and that quickly fades from three fingers to a quarter of an inch.  No lacing.  Fruit-yeast and wheat malt flavor.  Finishes dry but leaves a sweat clove flavor on the palate.
Pours cloudy copper color with a booming off white head that lasts. Banana, apple, cloves and bread/yeast aroma. Flavor is banana bread, very enjoyable beer for the fall.

bottle: pint glass: Pours a cloudy, dark green/ brown... very thin head ring. The nose has lots of clove and banana, backed up with strong yeasts... very bright.  The taste reveals again the cloves and banana but also some darker qualities, some roasted notes.  Some grassy, earthy feel, also lots of yeasts.  Medium to high carbonation nicely washes the mouth clean.  Easily drinkable, I could put a few of these back no problem.  Great brew.

Bottle.  Pours a deep caramel color with a fluffy off-white head.  Aroma is roasted malt with bread notes, yeast, clove, banana, and some light fruit detectable.  Flavor is light fruit up front, with roasted malt, bread, and clove on the back end.  Im a big fan of this style, and a big fan of this beer.

Pours into weizen glass with a thick, fluffy off-white crown. Hazy and caramel apple in hue. Smell is rich, roasty bread with yeast  and sour subacid fruits. On first sip I note the palate - a tongue-tickling bubbly brew with medium-starched body. Flavor is stewed apples and pears with cloves, light sourdough, banana and a touch of honey. The cloves linger pleasantly and round out the alcohol found  in the late palate and finish. This beer is warming and succulent, perfect for late summer and early autumn me thinks.
Bottle. Pours a light maple syrup color with big fluffy off-white head. Aromas of banana bread and cake. Flavors of banana, cake, and honey. Soft mouthfeel and delicate finish.

bottle poured a brown amber color with a thick foamy two finger white head. aroma has banana yeast, clover, banana bread, wheat, and light spice. the best banana aroma I have found yet. mouth feel is light with plenty of carbonation. flavor has a bit more malt, wheat, banana, yeast, picks up in sweetness, wheat and some light fruit. the carbonation level keeps this from getting too watery.

Pours a murky, dark orange-straw into the glass, with an initial lavish head that reduces to a thin cap.  The nose has huge banana aromas... quite dominant.  Some pear flavors upfront, maybe hints at Granny Smith apples.  Yeast follows in the mid-palate (very fruit-bready), with a crisp, brisk finish that culminates spices and reinstates banana.  The body is light, and the mouthfeel is soda-esque, with lively carbonation.  A nice dunkelweisse!

Bottle. Pours cloudy brownish copper with big off-white head. The aroma is full of soft fruity esters, peach, tangerine, banana; there is also some muffin, faint alcohol, and some spice. The flavor is bran muffins with some lemon and peach and general acidic bite. Then some hints of clove, faint nuts, and some allspice. The finish has an acidic kick with yeast and allspice and a soft, confectionery aftertaste. Pretty good stuff.

Cloudy nut brown with a fluffy white head. Noticed some rather large chunks of sediment sinking to the bottom. The aroma is mostly wheat bread, some clove, light banana, and some yeast. The flavor is slightly tart with some wheat and yeast. Crisp finish, and a little sweet.
Pours a cloudy amber color, white head.  Malt, banana bread, spice, a bit of citrus, and wheat.  Good dunkel, but I dont get very excited about this style.
Pours light cloudy brown color. Big velvety head. Banana and spices in the aroma. Mild hops in the taste. Banana and a panoply of other fruit flavors. Lots of spiciness. Velvety mouthfeel.

Pours a hazy brown with a swelling head that diminshes immediately leaving behind some nice lacine.  Smells of banana  and sweet dark malts are most accessible.  Other aromas of sweet fruits, some clove, maybe a touch of coriander and maybe even some orange.  The clove really comes through and is very easy to taste.  Other flavors of sweet banana, apple, sweet malts and a fresh bread like quality comes through.  Very lively carbonation on the mouthfeel.  The finish is a bit sweet, clean, yet a bit spicy.  Very nice.
Hazy amber with an off white head. Nice tart wheat, brown sugar banana clove aromas. Smooth medium body. Malty sweet glazed banana flavor with mild clove and tart wheat to balance. Very good dunkel.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
500 ml bottle. Finland.
Hazy brown colour with fluffy off-white head. Aroma is fruits (banana/citrus), wheat, bread and some sweet caramel. Not so sweet flavour with wheat, malt and bread. Quite fizzy.
Pours a cloudy brown with a nice frothy head. Aroma of banana & bread. Taste is slightly bready, light banana, & some cloves. Nice refreshing beer.It seems like it would go good with sausages.
Bottle, 5.8%. Mild banana aroma. Cloudy dark amber colour. Big semi-stable tan head. The flavour is quite fruity,some banana, plum and pear. Slightly sweet, but OK balanced. High carbonation.
Pours a cloudy, straw colored body with a white, rimming head.  Smells of banana, yeast, and malt.  Flavor is banana, yeast, zest, and barnyard.  Finish is decent but fades a bit quickly.
Tap @ Aying. Pours hazy amber with a creamy white head and lacings. Banana, caramel, bread and fruitcake. A bit sweet but overall well balanced. Smooth and full bodied. Nice

Bottled at The Oak Barrel, Vantaa Airport, Finland.  Cloudy pale amber, creamy head. Banana aroma with toasty edges. Mid sweet and very spritzy. Doughy and lightly burnt with subdued banana esters. Drier finish with careful notes of cookies and salt.

500ml Bottle  Leavenworth, WA
Aroma: Good malt aroma with some light fruit aromas lingering.  
Appearance: Amber in color, Hazy with a thin head.  
Flavor: Malty beer with some spices lingering this was a good representation of the style.   
Palate: Dry Wheat Finish, with a Good Mouthfeel.  
Overall: Had to have one here in Leavenworth WA it was over 99 degrees and I needed a cold beer.
Aroma is fairly sweet, with notes of banana, yeast, clove and allspice. Flavor is predominately sweet, with some hints of banana and clove. Overall, a bit too sweet and unbalanced.
Sweet, notes of clove and banana.  yeasty, a bit overpowering and sickeningly sweet.  Unbalanced, but good flavors.
Pours a cloudy dark amber with creamy head. aroma has hints of cloves, bread. Taste has a sweet carmel malty taste  with hints of bannana and toffee

This is a great tasting beer, with the banana flavor that you would expect from a good hefeweizen mixed with malt and caramel.  Pours dark brown with some white head.  Medium body with very fruity banana aroma. Nice beer, definitely worth a try.

Poured out a thick and creamy light tan crown with nice retention and splotchy lacing. The aroma is strong but not overpowering with banana bread, cloves and pink bubblegum. The flavour is really well put together with more banana bread and cloves, weak but rich malts and an underlying shortlived bitterness. Medium bodied with lots and lots of carbonation (not annoying), not really all that smooth for mouthfeel but there is obvious tartness throughout. Finishes fairly dry. Just picked up a caramel note? Well done although Ill still take a non-banana bomb Hefe over it.

Caramel red orange with a smooth off white foam.  Big banana, bubblegum aroma, hidden cloves, sweet caramels, butterscotch.  Taste is lots of caramel, bananas, fruit, light finishing grassy, spicy note.

(Bottle on 2009-06-19) Dark orange and cloudy. Quite large, white and long lasting head. Fruitiness, malts and lightly banana in aroma. Medium bodied palate with high carbonation. Malts, fruitiness, banana, grass and bitterness in taste. Fruity and lightly bitter aftertaste.
citrus aroma,golden, amber, hazy, rocky head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, lively, slick feel,
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: Body appears to be a brown to a dirty straw in color with lots of haziness throughout, no matter how hard I tried I couldnt get a cap to produce I must of done something wrong when I read all the other reviews and they all had huge head. Tons of bubbles are making their way to the top of my glass it looks nice just too bad none are sticking around to produce any head. Aroma is mild but tasty; banana chips, muffins, and vanilla are about the only thing I detect but this simple smell is nice. Mouth feel is medium bodied and heavily carbonated. Very sweet flavor thats malty and rich, banana is at the very front of the flavor followed by fresh baking, a mild sourness shows when the beer warms but is still acceptable. Very simple clean drinking beer that is highly enjoyable.

Golden copper pour into thick, pillowy white head that quicly dissipates into a pool of bubbly foam on top of the glass. Carbonated bubbles rise into a ring of melting lacing. Aroma of malt, yeasty bread and hint of apples. Initial flavor of sweet malt with brief hints of apple pie and spice in the finish.
Bottle. Enjoyed this beer thoroughly.  Had this in the beginning of introduction to craft beer. Tasted like a hefeweizen with more to it.

Bottle - pours  brownish yellow and very hazy. Solid beige head. Flavors of toasted grains, banana, bread, and a slight hint of cloves and coriander. Felt and tasted like a complex wheat, which isnt very common. Very good beer with a solid mouthfeel.

Pours hazy peach with billowing beige head and lively carbonation. Aroma is of grapefruit, lemon, clove, and a touch of nutmeg. Very pronounced and complex. Flavor strikes a most excellent balance of malty sweetness, a welcomed hop backbone, and a throughly complex and pronounced spice aspect. Caramel, brown sugar and toffee give way to a subtle and caressing citrus character, and finally a delicious addition of clove and coriander. Palate is thick, smooth and full, allowing for a sugary coating followed by a slight dryness. Delicious.

Bread, caramel and pit fruit in the nose to the nth power. Golden amber hue with a creamy carbonated head that was gone far too soon. Caramel, molasses, ripe banana and apple with a light touch of cloves in the finish. Creamy and gently lively finished. A well crafted beer, hard to beat for the price.

Amazing rocky meringue-like head on this dark amber, hazy colored dunkelweizen.  Extraordinarily aromatic too with traditional banana-clove, together with some soft caramel-toffee notes.  Fresh bread & yeast is apparent also.  Palate is smooth, creamy texture with sufficient carbonation, a soft malt component, and gently spiced in there as well.
Great Dunkel.  Pours amber/burnt orange.  Aromas of citrus and spice.  Tastes of grilled grapefruit.  Finishes with coriander and spice.
Pours hazy amber color with off white head. Aromas of bread, caramel, citrus and cloves. Toasted wheat with some citrus and mild clove flavors. Medium body with average carbonation.
Bottle. Hazy orange cloudy beer with a long lasting head. Aroma of clove, citrus, bananas bread and yeast. Flavor was similar, with light alcohol. Fizzy mouth.

Bottle. Pours with a large, creamy barely off-white head with a hazed brown body. Good lace and retention. Aroma is full of banana esters, clove phenols with the yeast, a bit of chocolate, caramel and dark fruits. Taste is watery with chocolate, caramel and clove. Lively to fizzy mouthfeel.

Bottle as shown. Pours a hazy copper golden with a large frothy white head that diminshes quickly. A lot of carbonation and good sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is banana wheat and yeast. Easy to drink with a fruity taste with banana and light clove. A good dunkel from Ayinger.

Location: 500 ml bottle from Gillys, 4/6/09


Aroma: Bread-like yeast, fruit - banana, some citrus

Appearance: Very hazy dark gold color, frothy white head

Flavor: Lots of yeasty bread malts, spice, cloves

Palate: Nice mouthfeel, this one is very complex for a wheat

Overall Impression: 
A really nice wheat beer.  The complexity and richness are really nice for the style.  Its an excellent example of a style, and a quality warm weather beer.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2009 Bottled. Pours really hazy and brownishly orange with a beautiful, thick head. Nice aroma is yeasty, wheaty, fruity (mainly banana) and slightly spicy. When cold this is really carbonated and therefore appears to be quite acidic, but as it warms up the beer gets softer and turns very sweet. Flavor is aromatic, fruity (banana), yeasty and wheaty. This was the first, though probably not the last wheat beer that I liked.

500 ml bottle from Country Club Liquors. Nose of pumpernickel bread, light caramel, light cloves, and a little light fruit. hazy amber with a big beige head. Flavor is caramel, banana, some pepperiness, and cloves. Pretty nice!

Tried with lemon. Hazy orange pour. Aroma is typical of wheat. Taste without lemon was a mix of wheat grains with a soft bland finish. The addition of lemon provided the citrus kick that was missing and made for an excellent wheat.

Very quality product. A good example of this German beer style. Poured to a hazy deep grey with lots of foam and a strong, lingering thick white head. There was a minimal aroma of malt and coffee. Tasted primarily of yeast, dark bread and  fruit with a slightly sour aftertaste. Some cocoa and banana, better and more spicy when it was a bit warmer.

Cloudy light brown pour with a nice off-white head. Aroma of banana, citrus, malt, and yeast. Taste is of roasted malt, slight banana and some sweetness. Really smooth drinking beer. Leaves a nice mouthfeel.
Bomber thanks to KAggie97.  Pours a cloudy dark orange with a medium sized head.  Aromas of banana, some spice (clove) wheat and yeast.  Flavors are fruity and spicey.  Thanks again Kevin.

bottle, thank you pivnizub! Cloudy amber-brown colour, large beige head. Malty-chocolatey nose. Full-bodied, malty with lovely caramel and chocolate flavours. Well-balanced with a pleasant and smooth mouthfeel.
The first thing i got was the taste of Bubble-Gum. Wheat, banana and a almost malty hit.

Bottle from BevMo.  A nice dunkelweizen.  Refreshing as hell.  Hazy orangish brown color with a substantial head.  Aroma of wheat, banana, and yeast.  Flavor is more of the same, along with orange peel and other dried fruits.  Smooth palate with medium carbonation.
Bottle. Cloudy, ruddy brown with a dense, thick offwhite head. Good rich, spicy banana aroma and flavours. Hints of apples as well. A very solid and complex dunkelweizen.

Bottle at Novare Res.
Pours a golden yellow with a huge frothy head.  The aroma is biscuity and very orange-like, smells like someone peeled an orange and banana in this beer.  The flavor isnt fruity at all, sweet malt, bready, and pretty nice, but simple.  This was pretty neat.
Bottle:  Golden colored pour with large head.  Fruity, yeasty, bready aroma.  Banana, bready, not too sweet finish.  This was pretty good.

Bottle. Look: Hazy dark orange (almost brown). Smell: Sweet, fruity and spicy in a way that reminds me of a sahti. Orange, apple, banana etc, with honey and some stinky cheese. Taste: Very fruity! Also some christmas spices and vanilla. Nice bitterness in aftertaste. Overall: A little too sweet for me, but its definitely a good brew. Keep up the good work Ayinger!

Banana and malt aroma with some florals.
Cloudy butterscotch almost caramel color with an apple hue. Minimal white almost biege head with lots of action.
Banana,  toasted malt, and wheat grain taste with a hint of caramel in the background and some florals throughout.
Medium bodied, some buttery and resiny feel, with a crisp comfortable carbonation.
This is a craft beer and when consumed swirl in the sediment in an appropriate glass and enjoy.

Pours golden orange/amber. Lots of carbonation, a large head results. Malty, yeasty aroma. Some fruits as well. Flavor is rich with yeasty, fruity, malt sweetness, spicy notes, subtle sourness, and an ever so slight roasty finish. Tasty brew.

1/21/09 From the bottle. Aroma is sour banana forward with a spicy phenol background. Appearance is clear gold with a well maintained white head. Flavor is sour forward that fades to sweet and highly fruity with a very light peppering. Mouthfeel is medium bodied, creamy, with a low carb texture. Overall, quite good, but seems more like a standard German hef than a Dunkel.
Bottle. Cloudy orange brown body with nice head. Aroma of wheat, cloves. Flavor is the same as aroma with an interesting sweet malt flavor working in towards the end.

500 Ml Bottle-Trade w/after4ever-pours a cloudy golden color w/a slight white head. Sweet, banana aroma. Sweet flavor of wheat, banana, green apple, orange peel, bread dough, colander, vanilla, & pepper. Had a lot of carbonation to it. Very easy to drink, very enjoyable. Long yeasty finish, a real winner. Thanks Tom!

Bottle. Hazy dark orange colour with a large off-white head. Sweet, yeast, banana and malt in the nose. The flavour is sweet, banana, malt, yeast and kinda fruity. Mouthfeel is quite smooth and medium-bodied. A very good weizen.

Opaque golden-brown, nice foamy white head lasting. Banana, pepper, and wheat rule the sweet nose. Similar flavor, not quite as potent. Palate is a little thin and very short. Too sweet and simple, but this is still somewhat enjoyable.

A- Pours a cloudy and hazy brown/orange hue with a small creamy head that is mostly sustaining, lacing falls down the glass and back into the beer
S- Nose is characterized by strong banana and yeasts, some spices and wheat lurking in the background, balanced out by slight bread and caramel malts
T- Initial taste dominated by subtle banana and citrus followed by breads, wheats, and yeasts, hints of vanilla and bubblegum, the finish is slightly bready (the malts are underwhelming for this style)
M- Medium-bodied beer, lively carbonation, creamy texturing
D- Well-balanced and easy-drinking Dunkelweizen that tastes like a slightly maltier version of Ayingers banana-forward hefeweizen, this is a flavorful beer that is somewhat lacking in the traditional Munich malts of this style, a good beer overall but I wish it had a bit more malty richness
bread, yeast, smoke, apple some hops. very fresh and enjoyable. banana and eukalyptus freshness in the end. hazy amber with a good foamy head.

Bottle.  Deep copper in color with the usual cloudiness of a wheat beer. Aroma is fruity (specially banana).  Flavor is fresh with the same bananas coming through and finishes with a slight wheat taste at the back of the throat.

Bottle into Weiss glass. Pours a very hazy copper-brown, with a nice fluffy head that settles down into a creamy off-white cap. Nose is  dry and yeasty, banana and cloves come through. taste is quite nice - yeasty up front, a bit dry, banana, moves to a sweet graham cracker and vanilla pudding note that hints at cocoa, while still maintaining the signature crisp, light, airy palate of a wheat beer. Finish is light and clean. Mouthfeel is light, crisp. Very nice beer.
Pours a dark orange with a large off white head.  Aroma of sweet malts and citrus.  Flavor of malts, yeast, and orange.  Medium body.  Great beer.

500. Pours a very hazy dark brown with a towering, almost out of control off-white head. Takes a while to pour. Nutty, husky, brown bread nose. Creamy medium body with soft woolly carb. Sweet brown bread mid-palate, with caramel and soft roasty notes. Delicious and easy drinking.

Pour is a cloudy orange brown with a nice one finger head that has fair retention.  The aroma of fruit jumps from the glass.  It is a nice mix of apricot, peach, and prune.  The flavor is also fruit dominated with yeast, malt.  Cloves appear late.  Smooth, tasty, and aromatic.  Delightful!

500 ml bottle. Dark hazy amber color, nice foamy head that dissipates relatively quickly. Aroma of bananas, caramel and cloves, flavor much the same plus some yeast and a hint of citrus. A very nice dunkelweizen, one of my favorites.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2011 500 ml bottle in Germany picked up at Wasanas. Dark golden color with an off white head.Taste is very spicy. Aroma was top banana even for a Hefe. A superior Hefe, one of my top favorites.

500 mL bottle, poured into a weizen glass.  Orangish amber color, nice haze, thick beige head.  Aroma is standard banana and clove, with a hint of lemon and caramel.  Flavor is bananas, vanilla, egg nog, and clove.  Similar notes to most other dunkelweizens but it is not fitting together quite right for me compared to the elite versions of the style.  Good creamy mouthfeel and good drinkability.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2009 Crushed with Jakebra.  Gotta re-rate this one, since the old bottle was definitely old and tasted like shit.  Way too light to be a dunkelweizen, but aight.  Wheaty all the way through.  Much better than the last taste.  Actually quite nice.
(Bottle).  Slightly sweet banana aroma.  Cloudy orange-amber body, very large head.   Flavor is sweet, but not cloying, mostly banana and vanilla.  Smooth and refreshing.  An excellent Weisse.

(bottle) pours a murky orange-brown colour with a frothy, lightly off-white head. aroma of wheat, clove and a light peachy fruitiness. flavour has strong notes of wheat, with more clove, caramel and peaches. medium body, very strong carbonation, dry finish.

Bottle. A hazy, orange beer with an off-white head. Banana and caramel on the nose, having company by some cloves. Mostly banana in the mouth, with caramel, yeast and citrus in the background. Quite sweet. The finish has a fine bitterness as well as the initial flavors. Effervescent, dry and full-bodied. A really pleasant dunkelweizen, it doesn’t get much better than this. (080829)
Bottle. Golden- orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is ripe banana, orange, citrus. Flavour is sweet, ripe banana, coriander, citrus, hint of hop. Nice beer.

fair example of a wheat beer, numerous flavors but few standing out above the others. Tastes better as it warms. Do not drink until beer is allowed to breath. I tend to expect just a bit more flavor from Ayinger products.

Pours a hazy root beer brown with a large, frothy, beige head that laces well. Huge banana and clove on the nose with a sweet wheaty backing. Light to medium-bodied and slick with a clean mildly dry finish. Sweet wheat malt, banana, apple and cloves with a clean finish. A very nice dunkelweizen.
Bottle. Pours unclear orange with a white head. Fruity and yeasty aroma with banana, caramel, and clove. The flavor is lightly sweet and well balanced, again with banana and clove. Very nice.

Looks like an old penny with a dense white head that diminishes into a tiny ringlet...minimal carbonation.  Yeast, banana, clove...both in the flavor and aroma.  Nothing overpowering.  Semi-sweet.  Not bad.
Bottle @ Coles, Buffalo NY. Nice beer. Pours a slightly murky cloudy burnt orange. Bready, clovy banana aroma. Malty hefe with caramel sweetness balanced nicely with yeastiness oif a hefe. Good beer

UPDATED: APR 23, 2013 500ml bottle at my departmental picnic - thanks to whoever brought this along. Id not had this brew in a while and it went down very nicely on a dank evening. Cloudy orange pour with the nice, lively carbonation one wants from a solid German hefe. Banana and mild yeast in the aroma, some chewy malts in the taste along with a touch of hops to complement the spicy finish. Fine stuff.

Aroma is spicy with scents of coriander, clove, banana and roasted malt.  Color is a deep hazy gold with light carbonation and a thin head.  Taste creamy and fruity.  Starting with a medium body that leans a little on the light side, it goes down with a creamy feel.  Finish come in with sweet roasted malt then some mellow Hefe like flavors (coriander and banana ).  After taste is fruity with the banana lingering on.  This is a great example of a Dunkelweizen, very Hefe like with nice roasted tones.

Bottle. Hazy orange in color, aroma of bready yeast. Taste is the same. A little fruity, yeast, bread. Average texture and carbonation. Dunkels are not favorite but this one was enjoyable. I just wouldnt buy it again for some odd reason.
A nice amber body with a noticeably large white head, this wheat has complex flavor that rewards deliverate tasting--citrus, cloves, malt.  A treat.

500 mL bottle from Wine Warehouse. Cloudy amber pour with a large head. Decent retention and moderate lacing. Very yeasty aroma has notes of banana, pineapple, bread, spice. Similar taste, yeast, wheat, banana, peach. Nicely carbonated, full bodied.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrel in McKinney, TX. Pours a dark cloudy gold. Aroma has light notes of bannana. Flavor has some bannana notes and a nice wheat malt backbone, lightly sweet, seems to have a very light pepper spice as well. Mouthfeel is light and soft with high carbonation. Over all this is a nice and balanced beer.

500 mL bottle. Pours dark gold. Huge white billowy head, probably 3+ inches. Lots of big sediment, almost too much. Very cloudy. Smell is yeasty and a bit funky. Wow, esters slam into your tongue on tasting. Banana and bubblegum, getting sweeter and sweeter as they head to the back of the throat. Mouthfeel is light-medium. Very nice refreshing brew. This one has a little funk in the aftertaste but it hardly diminished the quality.

Hazy orange-brown pour with a very thick silky head.  Wheaty aroma with lots of spice and some funky yeast.  Dry cloves and spices.  Lots of wheat flavor with a bit of yeast.  Slightly tart with citrus and lemon notes as well as apple and banana.  Very fruity and delicious.  Crisp, refreshing, easy to drink beer.

500mL bottle purchased for $3.30 - I think it was from Wine Emporium in Boston.  Freshness unknown.  An interesting pour into a weisse glass.  Started off light, getting much darker as the bottom of the bottle was poured in.  Although I swished the end of the bottle lots to shake up the sediment, there were still numerous chunks in the glass... so I stirred it with a spoon!  My first time ever doing that.  The end product is a cloudy grey-gold.  Medium aroma of a typical weisse - yeast, banana and bubblegum.  Taste is solid.  Quite yeasty, which gives it a bit more of a spicy character perhaps than some other weisses.

Bottle. A muddy orange brown beer with a huge off-white head. The aroma is extremely sweet with strong notes of banana and wheat. The flavor is very sweet and acidic with notes of banana, wheat, and citrus with a dry sour end. The body is thin.

Oh yes, this is what I look in for when it comes to wheat beer. Big banana and wheat  aroma and a balanced sweetness in the taste. While this is not too complex I love the creaminess a lot. This must be the best companion to strawberries I have ever had.

(bottle) Pours hazy light brown with a voluminous white head.  Aroma of toasted grain, light bubblegum, wheat, and banana.  Some bread appears as well.  This aroma tends to veer more towards weizenbock territory, although it is far less potent but still nice to smell.  Taste is lightly roasted initially, with a nice mid-palate of caramel and plum that yields to a crisp wheat finish that erases all of the sweetness which was originally present.  The mouthfeel is medium.  This is a very solid beer that doesn’t overly impress, yet doesn’t disappoint either.

Cloudy brown pour with a big creamy tan head that sticks around.  Nice aroma of roasted grain and malt, banana and lighter fruit, yeast and spice.  Flavor is nice as well, with the wheat, malt and spice really coming through.  Soft and refreshing on the palate.  A bit of a spicy finish, though nothing overpowering.  Very nice overall.

Exciting to finally review something by Ayinger after reading so much about the brewery.... pours a beautiful bright orange-to-brown blend from bottom to top, an almost shadowy hefe... head is thick, pillowy inches that hold nicely in a Schneider Edel-Weisse glass... yeasts are punchy and arresting; something like citrus fruit plays on the nostril with a touch of malt.... smooth, almost laidback presence, with minimal effervescence and the slightest bit of a flourish at the finish--extremely refreshing...surprisingly straightforward in taste: confiedent wheat couples with a fruity acidity and an underlying malt fortification--a flavor that is both unique and undemanding...begins without fanfare, and I wondered what the awe was about...by midglass, I realized how complete a beer this is, conforming body to mouth, taste to thirst and complexity to the style. A perfect August offering.

500ml bottle. My first Dunkelweizen.  Pours a  cloudy brown color with a good sized tan head.  Sweet banana with spice aroma with a tart clean palate. Delicious flavor with banana, wheat & cloves being the major players. Very good.

Rather enjoyed this. A tarty refreshing little number. Typical wheat effervescence, but not overly foamy. Nice sharp mouthfeel, probably a combination of acid CO2 and wheat "bite". Little bit of banana and cloves, but thankfully not cloying. fairly fruity and very little hop coming through from beginning to end. Excellent for the odd refreshing glass or two.
500ML bottle.  Medium brown color.  Thin white head.  Aroma of honey and toast.  Flavor is earthy.  yummy.  some fruit in the finish.

Yeasty rich aroma of bananas, caramel and nuts. Malty with a soft palate. Lots of fruit notes: dried apples, banana and pomegranate and wheat. Soft velvety mouthfeel. Yummers. God I love a good Dunkel.

500 ml bottle in weizen glass.  Clouldy amber brown with lasting beige head and lace.  Banana clove yeasty aroma with a little toffee.  Mildly roasted toffee sweetness with  mild caramel apple and banana.  Lingering sweet finish.  Medium body and low carbo.  Nice mouthfeel.  Very sweet.  Very soft.  Very good.

.5l bottle, builds a decent head, aroma is rich ripe banana, mild spiciness. Taste is again banana, wheat cracker, sweet maltiness, some drying hop bitterness, slight bit of carnival candy.  Super delicious beer, I really like their yeast, best yeast characteristics of all the german weizens IMHO. They used to close their bottles with  a cap printed with a bucholic country picnic scene, I liked those, it added to the impression of this beer’s origin- luckily what’s inside hasn’t changed at all.  Top shelf brew.
hazy light brown.  typical wiezen banana clove aromas, with a bit of extra maltiness.  a delicious rendition of the style, wiezen mouth with some extra beefy maltiness.

pours a murky brown with minimal head. aroma is very spicy, with some figs and dark fruit intermingled. Nice flavor, spice remains as the dominant aspect, along with heavy yeast notes. mouthfeel is a bit watery, but a very nice beer overall.

Poured cloudy amber with a thick head that was unremarkable. The nose was earthy with a very mild but fizzy mouthfeel. The start was dominated by the fizziness but the finish was smoothe with a slight sour twist. I wouldn’t describe it as citrus but it is not far off and very faint. The very slightest hint of alcohol at the very end.
One of my favorite German wheat beers that is available in Texas.  Dark golden straw in color. Yeasty and malty with fruit aromas.  An excellent summertime brew.
Hazy amber with large white head. Sweet aroma with wheat and banana notes. Sweet yeasty flavor with toasted malt,caramelwheat and banana notes. Ends sweet.

Pours a cloudy caramel with a thick eggshell head. Aroma is sweet and citrusy. Flavor is lucious. Sweet and malty wheat-citrus flavor. Delicious. Light and refreshing, yet full-flavored. Hints of apple, fig, and maybe some pear. Delicious.

Bottle. Pours a nice hazy amber/brown with a big off white head. Smells of bananas and malts. Thick and chewy on the palate. Again the malts dominate the flavor. No heavy aftertaste. An excellent brew.
Absolutely delicious. Think, foamy head. Very hazy dark brown. Immediately malt and banana aroma. Tastes fruity, creamy in the mouth. Highly recommended.

Great beer.  Gigantic creamy off-white head.  Cloudy/hazy medium amber colored body.  Aroma of hay and banana mixed with sweet biscuit.  Medium bodied with a creamy mouth feel.  Average duration with moderately sweet finish.  Extremely well rounded and balanced.
my first dunkel weisse. a murky/cloudy body. sweet smelling with a bit of biscuit. sweet and almost bready tasting. round in the mouth feel.
Hazy orange with a nice head. Aroma  of banana, bread, slightly fruity. Very thin body. Fruity. Not my beer.

500ml bottle.  Beautiful pour--deep bright cloudy amber--with a foamy off-white head.  A treat to look at.  Yeast and malt on the nose, with mild fruit (banana, apricot maybe) and a sense of fresh-baked sourdough bread.  Similar palate... tickling bubbles on the upper lip and tastes of slightly underripe bananas, fresh bread, yeast.  Clean and easy to drink, with a surprisingly crisp finish.  I actually wanted a bit of a lingering aftertaste, but almost none is present. Subtle but solid.  May cause some to think there’s not much too this beer, but I give it props for its understatement.
Pours a color similar to apple cider with a huge off-white pillowy head. Taste is fruity with some malt, but surprisingly light on the palate. Very good for summer.
Very good dunkel weisse with enough added darkness to make it easily a dunkel but also retaining the aspects of a light weizen all with the trademark ayinger greatness.
Cloudy, carbonated, amber, nice short lasting head, strong notes off ripe fruit, banana, melon, yeast. Sweet and little bitter in the short aftertaste. good mouthfeel.

Bottle @ home.Hazy medium amber orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, wheat, moderate yeasty, banana, rubber, toffee. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet with a long to average duration. Body is medium to full, texture is oily - smooth, carbonation is soft. (050508)
Nice rusty orange color with a massive head. On the nose we have wheat, malt, and fruit. Taste is yeasty, doughy, and a lot of malt. Just a touch of fruit on the finish. Not bad.

From bottle.  Pours a beautiful orange with a sizable cream head.  Smells of fruit, wheat and malt.  Palate features medium body and carbonation.  Flavor of mild fruit and wheat.  Finishes sweet, spicy with some banana.  Really nice whispy wheat quality that is crisp and refreshing.  Good, but not as vibrant as I had hoped.
Very nice Dunkel.  Subtle roasted malt flavor with the airy-lightness of a fine wheat beer.  Slightly banana in the finish.

Poured a murky copper color with a nice fluffly, tightly beaded head.
Spicy aroma. Good flavor of clove with a hint of banana. I love German wheat beers and this is another excellent example.
Poured into a weizen. Aromas of roasted malt and yeast apparent. Initial flavor of malts and wheat, followed by a subtle sweetness that is really pleasant to the palate. Very good beer.

It pours a cloudy golden colour, with a very large heat that quickly dissapates. the aroma is sweet with bananna, pear and apples. One of the sweeter dunkels ive had, it does look like the water from a river not too far from where I live. it has a very full mouthfeel.
botella 500 Ml. Buena cerveza tostada.
Pours a cloudy murky orange with an off-white head. Aroma is clove, spice, wheat, and banana. Flavor is good, palate is perfect.
Light brownish color, modest head. Wheat in the nose, along with some tobacco (?). Big mouthfeel - I like this.
Bottle.  Pours orange hazy brown with a thick head when sent aggesively into my glass.  Aroma/flavor is apple, pear, sweet malt, and a german hops, and a nice cinnamon finish.

50cl bottle.   Cloudy brown with a big head.  Chocolate chip banana-bread aroma.   The flavor has the typical banana and spicy citrus, with a pronounced brown-sugar sweetness and a bit of chocolate.   Medium, creamy body with ample carbonation.   When in the mood, this hits the spot quite well.
Pours cloudy orangish brown, thick white head.  Flavor is banana, some spice, yeast.  Finished crisp.

Ur-weisse has a gorgeous hazy copper color with a huge abundant off white head. It has an attractive aroma of banana, sweet malts and spice. The aroma leads you to a full body of caramel malts rapped around fruity yeast and light spices that finishes slowly. This is a very flavorful dunkelweizen and one of my favorite summertime treats.

Pours a very pretty hazy brown with a thick whiteish head...banana aromas come off this beer...the palate is very similar to the standard hefe...banana flavor and some yeast...very tastey, my first of the style that i will have to explore...This would be the most popular beer at my local bar if they had it on tap

Hazy, brown orange beer with big off-white head. Aroma is refreshing and sweet with a lot of banana, a bit yeast and just little bit alcohol can be observed. Banana is dominant in the flavor but not as much as in the aroma. Additionally flavor is a bit spicy. Aftertaste is watery and citric. Light-bodied and smoothly carbonated, a bit foamy palate is a bit watery in the end.

Bottle. Hazy orange brown, thick white head. Aroma is sweet, with plenty of banana and yeast. Taste: sweet and malty,  banana, a little spicy aftertaste. An OK wheat beer, not the best Ive had, but very drinkable.

Bottle. Medium head, forms lace. Liquid is hazy and "dirty" orange to brown in colour. Plenty of banana aromas with hints of other fruits. Light spiciness and lots of yeast. Syrupy sweet malts. Body is medium and carbonation lively. Quite smooth and pleasant mouthfeel. Not very refreshing but pleasant.

0.5 l bottle. Hazy orange brown color with fluffy head. Strong and fresh aromas of banana, clove, tart fruits, smoke and wheat. The flavor is very wheaty and malty with banana, clove and tart fruitiness. Full bodied oily palate with sharp carbonation. Excellent!

Murky orangey brown,  off-white big cloudy head. Nose is banana, strong bubblegum and yeasty wheat. Spicy and wheaty flavor, ripe bananas. Some earthiness and a lot of yeast in the finish. Medium bodied, foamy palate. One of the best weizens Ive had.

A- A cloudy copper brew pours out of this bottle with an amazing white pillowy head. From the looks of it, this beer is vigorously carbonated.

S- Smells of sweet bread, reminecent of walking by a good bakery. I get hints of fruit: orange, slight banana.

T- Tastes slightly sweet but not nearly as much as the nose lets on. Apricot and a minute taste of banana bread are present.

M- Very light and refreshing without being watery. Well carbonated.

D- This beer is extremely drinkable because it is so delicious and light. I could easily have a few on a summer day.
b0ttle, lots of banana, golden brown color, frosted flakes and some hops, crisp finish

Bottle.  Pour is a dingy and light brown color with a massive, fluffy head.  Aromas are heavy on the cloves and spicey yeast notes with some banana mixed in and a little sawdust.  Mouthfeel is kind of grainy/dusty which compliments the flavors of cloves and such.  Still, it is a very light dunkel.  Just a touch of a sourness to it helps to keep things interesting, but Im not sold on this one.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Strong apricot, banana, and subtle clove bouquet. Very dingy gold color, thick off white head. Apricot and banana flavor, with a light lemon grass finish. Delicious, nicely tart, and refreshing. This is an outstanding wheat beer. It isnt terribly dark for a dunkelweizen, but who cares? The taste rocks!

Im a pretty big fan of the dunkel weizen style and although this beer did taste good, I think it lacked some of the characteristics I look for in a good dunkelweizen.  I could pick out no discernible scents of banana, cloves, or chocolate.  Its still worth drinking, it did go down very easily.
[bottle] Pours a cloudy deep gold with a modest off white head. Aroma is quite nutty with some yeast. Flavor is banana from the yeast, and a little nutty. Good.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy, brownish-yellow color, not particularly attractive. Big, expansive head. Aroma of over-ripe bananas. The taste is predominantly sweet banana with undertones of other fruit and wheat. Pretty heavy carbonation. Well-made, but not my personal favorite.

This is almost perfect.  Rich and malty with that beautiful yeastiness, with clove and banana, and a various assortment of other dried fruits.  Nice carbonation, a superior mouthfeel, and still finishes quite refreshing.

One word, delicious. Pours light copper, only slightly cloudy, but mostly see through. Head is huge 3 inches plus, and settles down to an inch or so. Head is very thick and frothy. Aroma of medium wheat malt, and dark banana, and dry lemon/orange peel. Flavor is fizzy, wheat malty, but light, and has notes of apple, banana, vanilla, and clove. Finish is full flavored, body is medium. Aftertaste is clean. Another great beer from Aying.

Bottled.  Beautiful carbonation thought this was Weheinstephan in blind tasting.  Floral yeasts and clove are delicious in this brew.  Was expecting a maltier taste due to the roasted malt appearance.  Was pleasantly surprised how drinkable and delicious.

Pours a cloudy brown with yellow tints (apple cider-ish) with a thick off white head.
Aroma was wheat, banana and yeast.
Flavour was a malty-wheat with a nice fruity backing. Certainly enjoyable.

purchased at 99 bottles in federal way, washington.
pours an orange-brown, with a large egg-shell head.
smell is yeasty, banana, touch of citrus, touch of spice, bread dough.
taste is chewy, banana, dough, some citrus, prune, raisins.

Dark murky brown with an unusually small head for a weisse beer. Banana, estery aroma. Toasted, heavy wheat flavour, Quite fruity with a lot of banana. Sadly lacks the clove/ spicy edge that I like in German wheat beers but otherwise pretty decent.

500ml bottle.
Turbid orange, large thick fairly persistent head, and of course the money shot running down the side of the glass. Rich banana and other esters in the aroma. Big punchy fruity and wheaty taste, with none of the effete spices that sometimes accompany lesser wheat  beers. However, despite its really solid body, its unbelievably refreshing and drinkable. Sod the 5.8% - this has been proven to be a session beer, and a damn good one at that. Few, if any, bottled weizens come close to this, a classic.

On tap at Ayingers Speis und Trank in Munich as Ayinger Ur-Weisse Dunkel.
Pours a murky orange colour with medium sized off-white head that went away very slowly. Wheaty, fruity and slight acidic with soft notes of spices. Very refreshing and easy drinkable beer.
Really didnt know if I would like this.  Very enjoyable.  Had a sweet after taste to it.  Will drink again.
Another excellent Ayinger brew.  I think the bottle I had was a little bit old, it just had something a little funny about it.  Still really good though.
Bottle 50cl. A type of Weizen similar to Schneider Weisse Original or Maisels Original.  Lovely and balanced composing, very fresh and quaffable. I like it.

Pours a lovely hazy amber with an excellent long-lasting head & nice lacing. Aroma is lovely - graham cracker, banana, typical wit but a tad sweeter and richer, notes of alcohol too. Tastes great - gala apple, light spiciness, creamy caramel, even a hint of mandarin orange. Body is creamy and delicious, if a tad under-carbonated. Overall, this is another dangerously drinkable beer. Only downside is the slightly underwhelming aftertaste.

Bottle. Deep banana and wheat aroma. Murky orange with handsome white head. Flavor is strong for a weisse this light-colored and has banana, berry and some yeast. This has a wonderfully surprising spicy hoppy finish. Well-carbonated and soft. Awesome beer from an awesome brewery.

It grew on me. Pours jst as advertised, like a roasted hefe-weizen. A big white ehad quickly dissipates. Aroma is wheat, alcohol, and apples. Flavor is wheat, soft apple, maybe some banana. Finish is clean, and slightly dry with some hop, spice and even a little bubble gum. Good shite.

Aroma is strong and "wheaty" with a bit of an alcohol nip and a hint of citrus. Color is a cloudy, light brownish amber, translucent but not clear. Flavor is strongly wheaty, with just a whisper of citrus, no hoppy or bitter taste. It dances on the tongue as it goes down and leaves a pleasant aftertaste. I recommend it to all weizen fans.

an almost perfect mix, i say almost because there is always something on the horizon that may be better, 500 ml bottle, wish i had a case of this, not the usual fillingness of a wheat, which is good, no bitterness, banana is the most prevalent taste, but not overbearing, a bit of dunkle sweetness

Bottle.  Deep copper in color with the usual cloudiness of a wheat beer. Aroma is fruity (specially banana).  Flavor is fresh with the same bananas coming through and finishes with a slight wheat taste at the back of the throat.

Poured a cloudy golden golden color into the weizen glass.  Fresh fruit, cloves and bananas dominate the nose.  Flavors include, peach, apples, bananas, bread and hops.  Quite clean and refreshing.  A nice beer.

Bottle. My beer dealer forced me to buy this. Thank you Svend (Enjoyit). It was a very pleasant experience. Dark golden with huge off white head. Aroma dominated by banana and some wheat. Taste again banana, wheat sweet and malty. When it warms up, it gets a little cloying, but kept colid it is very nice.

Bottle. Best Dunkleweisse beer I have had. Dark amber color. Smells fruity with just a little touch of spice. Taste is similar to smell. Fruity with the same slight touch of spice with a malt finish. Im not sure but I dont think Ayinger can make a bad beer.

Bottle, bought @ Ølkonsortiet, Aalborg.
Pours a thick hazy dark orange with a small fizzy head that soon disappears. Aroma has banana, apples, dough malts and a citric touch. Wonderful oily mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet, lots of wheat, fruity banana esters, light chocolate and a nice well-balanced spiciness. A very good dunkelweizen - perhaps it should have been a little more dunkel?

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2008 3-1-08 standard weizen glass. Amber, slight haze, chill haze, huge off white head, nice lacing. Huge banana, doughy yeast, toasted cereal grain and clove. Flavor just doesnt do it for me though. Decent banana character, otherwise just a jumbled mess of fruit and phenolic esters. Some toasted grain near the finish. Lively carbonation and spritzy mouthfeel. Maybe I was expecting too much.

A standard pour produces an easily four-finger thick, pale tan colored head.  The beer is a full amber color and shows a deeply hazy, pinkish, light amber color when held up to the light.  The aroma is quite fruity with notes of ripe plums, apples and juicy-fruit gum all quite noticeable. Spice notes of clove and banana traditionally found in the style are also evident.  Dusty grain aromatics, some tart wheat character and a freshly crushed malt character in the finish add the malt component of this beers nose.  As the beer warms a bit the fresh, vibrant fruitiness begins to pick up a slightly green, under-ripe edge.

Lightly sweet tasting up front and through the middle, though the flavor does dry out some towards the finish.  This is a light, easy drinking beer for the most part, but it has a touch of creamy heft (despite an zesty carbonation) and fullness to it.  The carbonation seems to help keep this beer seeming light and quaffable.  Lightly tart notes characteristic of wheat accents flavors of sour / sweet plums, light apple flavors and a touch of tamarind.  A bit of dusty grain towards the end as well as some light grassy grain and at times a stale cracker flavor in the finish.  The more traditional Hefe-flavors of clove and banana are here, but seem to play a supporting role; that is not to say this does not taste quite traditional as even the other flavors that are here are perfectly in line with the style.

Refreshingly tart, yet with a fullness that makes it seem perfectly appropriate for a warm, Tucson winters afternoon.  A tasty beer that is perhaps a touch flawed, but still quite good.

Purchased: <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Tucson AZ

Pours alightly cloudy llighter honey color with a nice active white head. Banana, clove, and bubblegum dominate the nose with a bit of peppery spice as well. Uniquely ripe banana flavor with less sweetness than expected, which is very nice. Reminds me of banana pudding. Vert creamy mouthfeel with some pepper on the finish. There are also some roasty caramel notes, maybe apple and grape as well, very subdued though. I am really enjoying the toned down sweetness.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2008 Malty yeast aroma, sweet banana notes, great white head. Dark golden color,nice lacing. Well balanced sharp carbonation. Flavor similar to aroma. Flavor of sweet malt, wheat, fruit, banana, caramel finish. Such an enjoyable wheat.

Thank you Masn/G2B.dk. Its a dark golden beer with a huge, nice and creamy head. The aroma has notes of clove, wheat and fruit. The flavour has sweetness and notes of banana, wheat, clove, fruit and caramel. The body is full and harmonic, its truly nice!!! 2559
Hazy amber of color with a nice off-white head. An aroma of banana, wheat, yeast, cloves, fruits. A flavor of wheat, fruits, apples, banana, caramel notes.
Dark amber ale with a one inch off-white head.  Huge fruit-wheat aroma.  Flavor is banana, clove, and caramel.  Finish is sweet.  Good stuff.

50 cl. bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with a powerful and stormy beige head. The aroma is quite nice; moslty banana and malt. The taste is pretty unique; malts and grain/wheaty flavors combined with a fruity banana taste. Really a nice easygoing drink.

16.9 oz bottle-An orangish amber with the yeast suspended over the bottom half of the beer. Aroma of caramel, apple, and malt. Taste of this medium bodied brew is the same with a champagne dryness(like their hefe). Not a bad brew but the weizen characteristics are not really pronounced. Still tasty.

Huge nice off white head. Excellent retention. Had to wait a while for the head to die down enough for me to swirl & pour the last inch of the beer. Very cloudy. Orange/brown. Aroma: banana & some strawberry. Taste: More of the same, strawberry is stronger though. Am I the only one seeing strawberry here? Tastes very good, finish is a bit lackluster with an odd bitterness that doesnt fit as well with the rest of the beer. Mouthfeel is perfect for this kind of beer. Carbonation feels light, as I usually like it. Reminds me a lot of a less intense Aventinus Doppelbock, but tastier since I prefer strawberry-banana smoothies, er I mean beers, to straight banana ones.
Cider colored with substantial head. Strong fruit aroma and flavor, mostly banana with some apple.

Smells of sour mash and sweet malted wheat. I didn’t think any one beer could fill my Two Pound (32oz) beer glass to the top with foam......but this did. Sweet and fruity with just enough grain and wine flavors to make it a good wheat beer.

Hazy orange. Cranberry in aroma, lovely. Sweet caramel malt in flavor, the berries still around there somewhere. Tastes even a bit like green apple towards the finish. Very refreshing, an excellent brew, very much recommended.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2009 Nice label, cloudy in the glass.  Good tart aroma.  Robust, fresh, nutty taste - I love this flavor which is unique to hefeweizen - a mixture of wheat and a certain type of yeast, perhaps?  Notes of citrus and clove.  This puts me in the mood for anything between midsummer celebrating to holiday season gatherings,  or just sitting by myself at the end of the day, with a little of this liquid reward in my favorite beer glass.

17 oz bottle:  Aroma is a bready, yeast, roasted caramel malt, light fruits, and spices.  Appearance is a murky brown with a thin off white head that diminishes into a soapy film at the top of the glass.  Taste is rather effervescent with a bubbly apple and and rather mild caramel malt taste with the yeast present in the the taste as well.  Other flavors are clove, some banana, and bread. Overall,  Its a very drinkable Dunkelweizen.  Wheat and with a nice wiezen texture.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2016 Tap. Moderate notes of bread and cereal for the malt, light flowers and herbs for the hops, dough for the yeast, with hints of dried fruit, clove and banana. Head is large, frothy, white, with good lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is muddy light brown. Flavor starts lightly sweet, moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is medium, slick, and has a fizzy carbonation. Super tasting Dunkelweizen with excellent aromas and body.
Translucent in appearance with brownish coloration. Smells okay--wheaty. Tastes rather lightish, with some bananna and yeast taste.
Thanks to Ross for the pour.  Cloudy brown color.  Wheat and malt on the nose.  Same body with a yeasty bite.

Extreme cloudiness.  Bread pudding colored pour with some bubbles.. .totally opaque with a medium white sudsy head.  Smells great, like a hefe but with a little bit of nuttiness to balance out that banana sweetness.    Palate is extremely light... unbelievable for how thick and sticky it looks.  The carbonation sizzles a little bit, really interesting.  Sticky toffee flavor, lots of clove, some yeast,   very strange finish... like fresh squeezed apples.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2008 Beautiful looking.

Apple is prevalent in the aroma with a bit of banana if anything. I could easily mistake this for apple cider if I didnt know better.

Taste is definitely a weisbier with something extra.

This beer is like Ayinger Hefe Weisse with more of a bite.  The longer I drank it the better it tasted.  Was it a case of, "The women all get prettier at closing time"?  Hell No!  This is great weizen beer.  Once again, Ill let others bore with the usual "Banana, cloves, bubble gum" descriptions.
banana aroma with deep roast is reminiscent of banana bread without the spice. deep malt flavor accentuates the softer edges. great.

500ml bottle. White, foamy head. Brown, muddy colour, not clear. Medium carbonate. Sweet typical weisse aroma with yeast, wheat and banana. Flavours of banana, apricot, yeast and wheat. Also little bit chalky-like bitterness. Charismatic weisse!
UPDATED: NOV 1, 2008 color giallo carico opaca torbida schiuma buona non fine media persistentza profumi fruttati un po malto lievito in speziato bocca malto lieviti frutta spezia

500ml brown bottle. Pours hazy orange/amber like the colour of an oktoberfest. Head was huge upon first pour - 3 or 4 fingers high at least. Quite foamy and fluffy, it eventually settled down to a respectable half inch in size and stayed there for msot of the glass. Little lacing. Aroma was on the sweet side. Primiarily clove and some lemon, with fruity banana and apple notes. Flavour was wheat malts, some caramel malt sweetness and banana. Yeasty dry end. Body was light, slightly thin. Crisp, quick carbonation.

17oz. bottle poured in Ayinger weiss beer glass.  Cloudy dark golden color with huge white head.  Aroma is of bananas and apples.  Flavor is also fruity with the bananas and apples.  Clean crisp finish with hint of cloves. Lacks the citrus taste of many hefes, but still quite good.  Wish I had some more.  Drinkability is quite high on this one.  Mouthfeel was very pleasant.

From a 500 ml bottle this poured a nice dark orange with light orange head they lasted seemingly forever.  Big lacing rings. Nose of banana and yeas, with some spices. Clean and rich mouthfeel.  Flavor are bananas and yeast again. Very nice to drink.

Bottle- Sampled @ Siebel during the German style tasting- Cloudy orange head, white foamy head. Beautiful nose interplay of weiss and dunkel notes, alot of chocolate and banana leading the race. Enjoyable to drink, clean, leaning towards acidic.

Orangy-brown in colour with strong carbonation. Huge banana aroma with a bit of yeast and caramel. Very sweet in the mouth, with notes of banana, vanilla, berries, creme caramel, and a hint of clove. Heavy in the mouth. The lack of citrus, roasted grains, or ANY bitterness doesnt really work well for me, although the flavors that are there are fine. It just needs a bit more balance.

From 500mL bottle--Poured a medium brown-golden body with a medium-sized white head. Mild fruity complexity that exhibits a nice balance of yeast, malt, wheat, alcohol and hops. Bready and yeasty. Highly carbonated, but finished proper. Well-balanced, exceptional beer.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2010 Cloudy brown beer with medium white head. Aroma is fruitful and complicated, some bananas and sweet malts. Taste is quite sweet and a little yeasty, balanced and not very fruitful, some roastiness. There is some carbonation but still very smooth and pleasant palate. Interesting and pleasant weizen with hint of roastiness

.5L bottle. pours cloudy orangish brown with dense white head. awful color. nose is bready with hints of cloves and some banana. flavor is bready, bananas, and cloves. a real clean and crisp finish. carbonation is high but smooth. the flavors are very balanced and drinkable.

Hazy-brown with HUGE head. Fades into a pile of cream, nice.

Aroma of wheat and a hint of alcohol, tastes of wheat, vanilla, and a touch of cloves. Very easy to drink beer.

Finishes with a slight bite of alcohol, and subtle hops.

Nice.

Hazy orange-brown with a massive pillowing white head that required 4 pauses during the pour into my big weiss glass. Big aromas of bananas and wheat. Soft mouthfeel, flavours of banana, vanilla, toffee, wheat, and sweet spices. The finish is almost tart. This was delicious!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 500 ml bottle, poured into a german hefe glass.  just a little darker than ayingers hefe, almost looks like apple cider with a nice white head if poured properly.  a little more complex than the hefe, but that taste is not that different. a truly wonderful beer for late summer/early fall drinking.  very drinkable.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2007 bottle at vandalia lounge in charleston, wv.  poured a dark hazy yellow with a thick, dense white head.  great wheat smell laced fairly heavily with banana esters.  taste was more wheat, with even more banana, a hint of some citrus, maybe even a bit of floral hops, with a happy malt base.  medium-bodied with that bit of carbonation that fits a weiss beer.  finished with just a tiny hint of sweetness, drying out as time went on.  a very tasty summer beer.

Bottle from a great trade with Koelschtrinker (thanks!). Cloudy light-brown color with a a stable beige head.  Aroma of wheat, banana, malt, bread and some caramel. Flavor is sweet with wheat, yeast, fruitiness (banana and some citrus), some toasted malt, and some later acidity. Medium-bodied and maybe a bit too much carbonation going on. Nice stuff.

Name: Ur-Weisse
Date: 06/14/2001
Mode: Bottle
Source: Wild Wing Cafe, Marietta

wheat with a touch of chocolate
-------- />
Name: Ur-Weisse
Date: 12/01/2004
Score: i to ii+
Words: Bottle
Words: Tasting

hazy dark yellow, light for a dunkle, scant head, lots of clove and banana aroma, lots of dry banana flavor, hint of dark malt, nice lingering esters, somewhere between a hefe and a dunkle
-------- />
Name: Ur-Weisse
Date: 04/22/2007
Mode: bottle
Source: tasting
Score: 3.2 to 3.4

very creamy body works well with the banana esters

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.4/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: **+/4

Bottle (500ml).  Hazy, slightly amber gold pour with a large fizzy-fluffy white head.  Smells more like a hefe - banana, light apple, sweet malt, yeast and very light floral hops.  The taste follows right on, lighter than I expected, a little more grain, lightly toasted, fruity in the finish.  Light body, nice soft carbonation, very quick finish, no aftertaste.  Refreshing.
a very tasty dunkelweizen for sure, malty wheat flavor, nice carbonation, some banana, nice brown color, delicious. Ayinger is good stuff

A better dunkleweizen than I have had. Tastes very bubblegummy and wheaty. Pours a darkish hefe color that is ligther than most dws. Pretty good and smooth finish and taste. I enjoyed it. This brewery knows whats up.

(bottle): Pous a dark brown yellow color, very cloudy and effervescent. Big white foamy head. Very effervescent, citrusy, lemonry, some wheat. Not very strong. Wheaty, citrusy, effervescent. Watery. A nice light beer.

Poured very cloudy and dark brown.  Aroma started off with a weak caramel scent then changed to milk (in a good way) as it warmed.  Flavor was a sweet wheat (kind of like Wheat Thin Crackers) and creamy on the palate.  Overall Id drink this again...

Bottle at the Oak Barrel, Helsinki Airport. Very pale, almost lime green colour, rather artificial looking; cloudy of course, with a thick white head and fine carbonation; banana aroma, and lots more banana when tasted with soem wheat and vanilla; dry finish with some bitterness.

Pours a hazy root beer brown with a large, frothy, beige head that laces well. Huge banana and clove on the nose with a sweet wheaty backing. Light to medium-bodied and slick with a clean mildly dry finish. Sweet wheat malt, banana, apple and cloves with a clean finish. A very nice dunkelweizen.
A typical light bodied German wheat beer, like almost every wheat beer produced by Ayinger this is a good beer to start novice drinkers up with.

Hazy reddish golden with nice foam.  Citrus, banana wheat aromas, with a yeasty, doughy flavor.  There are touches of clovey spice, and banana as well.  Drank this after being outside on a hot day and it really hit the spot.
Yeasty aroma with slight banana. Cloudy light brown color with a large head that dissipates moderately. Smooth start with a slight amount of hops and spices in the finish. A little watery palate.

That good old Bavarian banane aroma. Along with clove. Hazy dark amber color with a light beige head thats multifingered. Medium bodied, and moderately carbonated; almost creamy. Starts with banana, bread, clove, stone fruit. Lots of flavors here. The finish is dry, and not so much bitter as banana and spice. It is really quite excellent.

A dark golden cloudy beer.  The aroma is a sweet honey, fruity, a bit doughy and a note of floral and bannanas.  A  sweet honey, with bannanas, flowers, vanilla, a hint of apples and wheat.  Has a light to medium light body. A creamy mouthfeel.  A quick finish that doesnt linger. Overall is a very good beer

Pour was  murky light brown with a thin off white ring for a head. Aroma of wheat and some banana. Taste was a delicious mix of yeast, wet bread and some caramel. There is a slight fruitiness in the background. Nice carbonation.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA
