Clear amber body, big frothy off-white head, It collapses in very neat looking pockets that give it a very unique look. Huge ripe banana aroma. The flavor is straight up banana and wheat. The palate is bigger than its lighther cousins. A nice but by no means great beer.

Another one of my favorites. Ayinger is professionally consistent with their beers.  This beer is a dark wheat beer compared to their Brau Weisse.  More head than most Hefes, excellent wheaty yeast smell and flavor with a hint of cloves at the finish.  Add a lemon wedge and Watch it go!

fruity apple banana.  a darker, more robust flavor than the lighter hefe weizens.  light, roasted fruit, slight bitterness.  sweet finish.  nice aftertaste.  a nice complex brew with a killer bottle cap.

This is decent; looked good from the pour, with a bronze murkiness, large head and very wheaty aroma.  There was something however, that didnt taste right to me, perhaps just too sweet, perhaps too much apple.  The Brau-Weisse is far superior.

Nose: LOTS of bubblegum with small hints of banana, no cloves to speak of.  Pour is a cloudy red-brown with disappating off-white fluffy head.  Hints of chocolate, wheat, plummy malt, and banana in the flavor, with a sticky lip-smacking finish.  Somehow manages to be cloying and bland at the same time. Okay, but the helles-weisse is better.

#3 of 3 ayinger for the night.  time to go to red seal :)  on to the rating- pours out a darker color wheat looking unfiltered beer.  fruity smell, and taste, quickly disipating head unlike the brau weiss.  i like this alot, these 3 beers were great tonight.  and this was the best one to finish with.  excellent.  now if only i could buy celebrator dopplebock.......
Very big foamy head, copper coloration.  Apple and white wine in the aroma and taste.  Best Hefe I have had.

Fine appearing brew.  Lightly cloudy copper color with massive off white head that is retained.  Aroma is wonderful and akin to Celebrator, nicely malty and nutty with a bit of toffee.  Flavor is delicious.  Wheat flavor, some light banana, bit of apple juice a dash of spice and a clean dry finish.  Man am I glad spring is here.  I am love the Hefe's.

This is an interesting brew.  It distinctly smells like fried plantain -- banana and char smoke.  Hazy, muddy beer with some green tones.  Very cool cap redeems the appearance rating. Sweet, a bit smoky, like watery brown sugar light body, residual sweetness.  Can't taste the alcohol. Some phenols in the finish.  I fear that I could drink a lot of this in short order.  Has gentle homebrew qualities.

A Hefe done right. Murky, dark golden appearance with a decent sized head and lacing. Aroma of bubble gum and yeast. Crisp muted citrus flavor with some bubble gum notes and a velvety mouthfeel make this a winner. 5.8% alcohol hidden extremely well.

Great big light tan head which lasts for a while.  Decent carbonation.  Grassy/compost aroma with a touch of spices.  Color is a slightly cloudy medium orange.  Flavor is a little vinegary (sp).  Crisp and fruity but with a sour vinegar kick.  Slight bitterness in the finish and pretty clean and smooth.  A decent wheat with a kick.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2006 bottled: these are how wheat beers are suppose to taste! beutiful caramel hazy color with a nice cream colored head. dough and spice up into the nose. nice balance of malt sweet, bananas, cloves, bread. an excellent weisse. PROST!

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2004 Bottled (from weizen class)
Hazy brown/orange color. Big foamy white head. Typical hefeweizen banana aroma mixed with hints of smoke. Banana taste is also there but roasted malt dominates the palate. More crisp than sweet. Fresh but thin. (7/4/6/3/12 3.2)
Re-rated, bottled (BB 12/2004)
Hazy nut brown, rocky brown head. Sweet grilled banana aroma. Refreshing with citron and a hint of apple flavor. Well-done Ayinger. (6/4/6/4/14 3.4)

A real smacker. I mean that in a good way - smack, smack, like it's tasty, you know. It is a fine competitor with the Ayinger Brau-Weisse. It's funny how Ayinger, one of the best breweries in the world, seems to compete with itself. This pours a beautiful orangish-amber colour. The taste is crisp and yeasty, refreshing and complicated, simple and intriguing. Truly a fine brew.

Pours darker than any weisse I've had so far.  Head dissipates quickly, but enough remains to be attractive. Strong malt aroma with some wheat evident.  Interesting taste.  Strong malt/wheat taste up front.  Some bananna, bread, yeast maybe pear come at me the strongest before the finish.  Finish is clean. A surpsingly complex weiss.  Damn near as good as weihenstephaner in my opinion.

Ayinger equals perfection. This beer has the perfect aroma for a dunkel weisse, absolutely perfect. Pours a wonderfully vibrant shade of reddish brown. Good sized head that grows with consecutive pours, very nice. Great mouthfeel as well, which kind of surprised me considering Ayinger's other selections which seem to have a bit of a bite to them. Great beer.

This is just how I expect a German wheat to taste.  This is definitely not one to disappoint on the palate.  Taste is crisp and clean with a lingering sour bite on the tongue.  Just the right flavor of roasted malts with a bit of tangy nuttiness, fresh bread aroma and a solid malt backbone make this very complete.

Good classic HefeWeizen beer. Hazy deep yellow color and a stiff head. The aromas were a little subdued, but these beers don't age well, so I suspect a fresher sample would score higher. The banana/ wheat aroma is there, but very slight from what I would expect. Refreshing and somewhat filling. A good Summer beer.

reddiosh opaque, rusty brown.  Huge, thick white head.  Ester qualities emerge immediately and prevalently.  Citrucy and light for an Ur.  MAlty and rich.  a very lively palate brings on some toasty malt character and subdued fruitiness and hop presence.  somewhat noticeable alcohol on finish brings out the phenolitic quality.  Light and refreshing with a solid alcohol punch, I think its a good summer ur-weisse.

Hazy light amber color, brown hue; fine perlage, giant head. Aroma mixed of spices, wheat, vanilla, paper, banana and light apples. Good mouthfeel, some sweetness, later is spicy and lightly fruity (banana). Not a strong character, but quite drinkable.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2011 I am fond of this beer but tend to gravitate towards their Brau Weiss more. +++ Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle. The beer pours tan color - very opaque. Has a large tan head that slowly dissipates. There is a mild sour-sweet aroma. The taste is sweetish with a heavy wheat flavor. There is a bready, wheat taste that lingers on the palate. A very nice Dunkelweizen.

Hazy dark brown color with a large white head with large bubbles and sticky lacing. The aroma has a wonderfully caramelly sweet malt body with a light hop balance. Notes of fig & pear with the banana/clove german hefe esters. The flavor is creamy with lots of apples and yeast notes. This is a tasty hefe with some solid flavors, just seems a little dumbed down than what was intended though.
Cloudy amber with lots of head.  Too fruity for my taste, and too wheaty, and too malty.  However, I tend to avoid wheat beers, so this may be very good for someone who appriciates wheat beer.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2013 An interesting cloudy brown appearance with an average head.  Sweet spiced lemon aroma, and a spritzy feel with a soft bread and zesty lemon flavor.  Not very full flavored or complex, but still good.
Wheaty.  smells of wheat, taste of wheat looks of wheat.  this is a good beer if you like wheat.  which i do.

bottle.

standard dunkel coloration with a creme colored head.

aromas of yeast, wheat, malt, maybe some hints of chocolate.

Tastes OK, nothing to brag about--maltiness, yeast, a bit of the wheat wang.

All in all, not a very exceptional example of the style.
Orange with a metallic hue and massive head that initially cascades like a waterfall but soon settles into a strong and still top.  This is smooth and sweet with primarily banana tones.  Nice.

Pale white-ish appearance, excellent carbonation and head formation. Malty, yeasty, woody aroma with decent amount of peppery spice. Sweet, soft palate, cloves, apples, light touch of banana bread and some bitterness in the finish.

Most of my hefe experience comes from Widmer, so here goes. This had a bigger body, but more diminished citrus notes. Taste was slightly acidic. Well done but not amazing. Maybe a good session beer, I liked it.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2006 (Re-rate Oct 2, 2004) Very muddy, dark orange color, large, big-bubbled head that diminishes quickly. Quite pleasant and strong, yeasty and malty banana aroma with some slightly roasted rye bread. The flavor is more sour-acidic than sweet, quite fruity, very yeasty and somewhat warming. Slightly sour and tingly apple juice aftertaste. Medium to full-bodied, but still slightly thin palate with slightly fizzy-foamy carbonation. A nice, balanced, dryish dunkelweizen, that suits the winter season better than summer.
Delicious.  Thick, woodsy taste with the dominant tone being that of clove (peculiar, in my experience, but pleasant).  Fizzy and sweet, a good brew.
Somewhat disappointing to me,beautiful head that stuck around for a while,aroma was not that good,flavor was interesting but not really my thing
Pours orange-brown, with a creamy off-white ring of foam.  Sweet banana aroma.  Nice banana, and yes, apple in the flavor in addition to tangy flavors.  A nice change of pace for the new year.

Bottle pours a hazy brown orange with a nice head.  The aroma is yeasty, and not much else.  The flavor is yeasty and bread like in the finish with a bit of lingering fruit.  The palate is somewhat nice for the flavor.  Overall, I prefer the Ayinger Brau Weisse.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2004 On tap.  Orange/brown cloudy with nice large head.  Smells yeasty/malty.  Sweet malt and yeast flavor. Slight hint of sweet fruit and cloves.  Banana really comes out asis warms.  Good stuff.

Cloudy orange out of the bottle with a sweet, burnt caramel nose.  Dark fruit sweetness with raisen, prune and apricot.  Full bodied caramel sweetness with subtle hints of a weizen banana clove spiciness, but mostly sweet.
Huge Head out of bottle. Golden/Orange color. Smells roasty and spicy. Very nice flavor. Very good beer. Not too bitter. Presense there but just right. This is a keeper. I will stock this.

Poured a murky, sort of nasty looking brown, with loads of chunky yeast bits swirling about.  I usually go for this, but it really did appear kind of nasty.  Good head though.  Aroma of cloves and apples.  Nice yeasty flavor, flavor follows the aroma spot on, maybe a touch of faint banana.  Ugly, but nice.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2006 Im not a big fan of the Weisse style, but this was the only one Ive tasted that I would buy again
Dark amber color with a big beige head. Strong yeast and malt aroma. Flavor of yeast, malt and a little fruit. A little acidic and has strong carbonation.

Ok first this is my first Dunkle -Weizen..so here goes.
Comes in the usual attractive Ayinger brown euro-style..500ml bottle..nice simple label and again the beautiful cap.
Well this is certainlly much darker beir than the usual Hefe-Weissen..a sort of dark murky gold..with a nice big white frothy, bubbly head.
mm same wonderful aroma of all the good German hefes( something that very few American versions can get)..the spicy esters..banana, clove..backed by that sour wheat aroma wonderful.
This beer has a good wheat profile in the taste and the banana flavour comes through strong in the after taste..nice.
Very pleasant sensation on the tongue!
A most drinkable dunkle..very very nice will try more of this style.

Light amber (this is the dunkel weizen??) with a huge frothy head.  Nose is estery but also sweeter in malts and some hints of smoked malts.  Medium bodied, banana flavors with tea-leaf hints and long lasting sweet aftertaste.
Banana caramel aroma.Orange cloudy appearance with full head.Sweetish fruity banana,caramel clove flavor with mild hop finish.Another great Ayinger product.
Poured an oranger amber color with a foamy, fluffy white head.  Aroma of caramel, wheat and cloves.  Fairly complex taste including apples, bananas, clove and yeast.  Rather weak mouthfeel.
Pours cloudy with a good thick head. Has a great aroma that screams drink me. Awesome flavor with a hint of bananas. Quite possibly the best Hefe out there.

Looks great! Cloudy and with an amber colour. Huge thick head. Aroma of fresh bananas, wheat, caramel, salmon and lemon. Smooth and fruity flavour of yeast, banana, roasted malt, pears and lemon. Smooth, fruity and yeasty finish with a moderate carbonation.

Aroma is malty-sweet and mildly yeasty, very attractive...The color is a cloudy bronze-tinged brown with a very fine cream-colored head...Flavor was mildly sweet with roasty notes and nice tang from the yeast that tasted lightly of lemon mixed with apples or pears..the subtle spice comments in the finish add nicely...Body is moderate, as is the carbonation, which adds to the smooth countenance of this brew...This is a very enjoyable wheat beer, more substantial than regular hefes, which is why I favor the dunkels, and this one is especially well-balanced and smooth.

A sun-tea like color. A yeasty, malt aroma. Somewhat light flavored, not as heavy as other dunkels. Smooth, fairly well balanced. Beer doesn't overwhelm the senses. The wheat flavors and aromas don't stand out, which is fine. Very drinkable.

Bottle, murky brown orange, nice white head and lace. Big banana yeast, wheat aroma of course, soft and strong together. Nice full body (for a wheat), well balanced and refreshing, not too much of a dunkel but better than the regular ayinger hefeweiss; lively yet soft carbonation.

Color is a cloudy haze of brownish gold with a large loose head of puffed creamy foam that ever so slowly simmers to a light haze on top and has drippy lace in large stringy patches.

The smell of this thing is very lively, wow, its all over the place, funky as hell, smokey banana and smoked salmon or bacon, dull lemon, musty horse blanket, soft rubber, and feet. Yep, its funky and pungent and I love it. I need this in a insense form so I can light one and let the whole place smell like this. People would wonder what the hell I'm I cookin' or smokin'. I'd be great.

Taste is soft and mellow of banana and frothy malts, touch of lemon and clove, sweetness is light, citrus is flighty with a light but favorable carbonation with a mellow, nearly creamy medium body with a little touch of hop and dryness with clove hints in the finish. The yeast is showcased in this beer quite a bit, especailly in the smell, but with that aside its one fine easy drinkin' dunkel.
Medium brown, clody appearance.  Mild flavor and smooth finish.  Nothing to exciting.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2003 Coudy deep amber color with a nice creamy head and good lacing. Citrusy aroma-oranges. It started sweet and soft on the tongue, and was fruity and slightly acidic, kind of thin. The finish was short and unremarkable. No bottling date that I could see.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2010 Complete re-do: The Ayinger is a burnt ornage colored brew - lighter than most other Dunkelweizens. Aroma is nice sweet clove. Flavor is classic banana and clove with a sweet malt finish. Quite refreshing!
Medium brown, cloudy in appearance. Offwhite head, very large.  Flavors of banana, clove, and citrus.  A bit on the sour side.  Watery mouthfeel.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2008 Cloudy dark brown with light brown, fluffy head. Bready nose. Suprisingly thin bodied. Flavor was even keeled throughout with no dips or climaxes. A nice subdued tartness leaves you wanting more.

Great banana clove sweet aroma. Bread. Light hops. Cloudy cider with white foamy lacing head. Medium-high carb in med body. Light sweet start. Light hops & good maltiness. Low bitter. Smooth finish & light tangy after. Nice wheat.

An amber color with a white frothy head. The aroma has some spice to it with clove, anise and bubblegum. A touch of sweetness as well. Theh flavor is of banana, fruity with clove...very full of good flavors. A very nice tickling carbonation. Overall a delicious German Wheat.

Straw-orange color, lively carbonation, and slight haze. Aroma of flowers, grass, lemon, and yeast. Some sourness with an orange/lemon flavor and slightly sweet. Seems to lack the complexity that some German Wheats can bring.
A whole lot going on in the aroma here - think cinamon bread - warm with butter..  Yeasty and tangy but with an added sugary sweetness - a good quality dunkel.  Only needs more palate.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2007 This Ayinger offering spills into my stemmed glass a rich, hazy copper colour and forms a billowy off-white head, tall and creamy.  Strong yeast by-products dominate the aroma in the form of juicy bananas and sweet bubblegum.  Behind that impression can be found woodsy, floral hops and a toasted malt accent.  The flavour offers significantly more depth, bringing slightly tangy pecans and sweet, creamy apple butter together initially.  At the finish is the soft presence of Prince of Whales tea with honey and softly sweet benne wafers.  Pleasantly light notes of caramel appear in the aftertaste.  Whereas the aroma is soft and sweet, the flavour brings in a building tanginess for balance.  The body is suitably full for the style, not so thin as to feel lacking, nor so thick as to prevent refreshment.  The creamy texture and fine, champagne-like carbonation aid in the imminent drinkability of this beer.
Toronto Festival of Beer - the cloves stuck out to me, they usually do, because I don't like them a whole lot. Ok dark wheat beer.

Pours a cloudy orange-brown colour with a thick frothy head. Aromas of yeast, wheat, bananas and malt. Light medium in body. Flavours of lightly roastede malt, wheat, wheat, and a little bit of a spicey taste. Not bad.

(500ml bottle) Poura a medium, frothy almond head and a orange-copper, sediment filled body. Cloudy and high carbonation. Nose of yeast, bananas, slight spice and malt. Thin texture - but not lacking complexity - slightly fizzy. Banana flavour. Light and easy drinking for summer.

I am more of a fan of regular hefeweizen than dunkelweizen, but this one is such a standout example of the latter.  So much going on here--no flavor is out of the ordinary, but there is just so MUCH here.  Wonderful.

6/25/03, draft, Munich.  Tried this dunkel-weiss at the Ayinger brewery restaurant and biergarten on a beautiful warm June evening.  I can see why the Germans love their biergartens so much in the summer months!  A golden brown, unfiltered, hazy dark wheat beer with a large white head.  Good lacing.  Fruity, spicy, citrus aroma with cloves and roasted malts.  Fruity, wheaty, sweet-n-sour hefeweizen flavor with roasted malt depth.  Full bodied, easy carbonation and very drinkable.

A solid german wheat. Flavor is very typical of the style. cloudy orang brown color, yeasty aroma, citrus and wheaty flavor followed by a sugary/candy finish. I did pick out a very distinct banana flavor which was a little diffrent than expected. Very enjoyable. A superb beer for the summertime.
Aroma of bananas, and nothing else. Orange/brown body with a big head. Flavors of wheat,yeast, and banana chips
Banana all over it. Carbonation hits the back of the mouth by the throat. Lacing with small bubbles in the head.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2003 Upon pour, I made the discovery that this beer is exceptionally ugly. Translucent amber my ass, this looks like something that should belong in your toilet. Interesting taste, however, about what you'd expect from a wheat beer plus an extra maltiness I wasn't looking for. Not terrible, not great. Clean finish. I couldn't finish a pint because this was so damn ugly. It looks like what's left at the bottom of the bucket once I'm done scrubbing my bathroom floor. Ugh. I didn't need this taking up valuable space in my stomach.
(bottle) Typical wheat beer. i expect if you like wheats you might like it, but I don't and I didn't really appreciate it.

The second half of the bottle poured an opaque mocha brown, with a small creamy head.  Flavor had a bite of lemon and a somewhat gritty palate due to the sediment in the bottle.  I will be buying this again.

Murky brown with a white head;Smells like cold mashed potatoes with a trace coffee. "Prickly" carbonation mixes with a faint roasty-ness combined with typical german weissbier flavors, all most no finish. OK and just O-K.
Bottled. Good wheat beer. Lost a little flavor in the end. Overall however very enjoyable.

Pours a light yellow hazy brown with a large, pearly white head.  Light yeasty aroma, with wheat and hay.  A bit chewy, flavours have some orange rind, good malt and is very moist on the palatte.  Clean finish if not the most interesting, it is extremely solid, enjoyable and drinkable.
Hazy brown with a big tan head that went away quickly. Lots of spices in the smell and taste along with some wheat and malt. Aftertaste was of slightly sour fruit. Quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2004 Nice amber-brown appearance.  Very smooth. Not a lot of bite to it.  Refreshing taste with a slightly sour-fruit finish.....

  next try was sweeter, and had a little more bite.  A sweet, refreshing caramel taste.

Thick foamy head dissipates quickly. Five minutes later I was left with one of the most unpleasant looking murky brown substances ever put in a beer glass. It looked like dirty dishwater. Luckily the taste is still fine. Highly carbonated, malty, wheat taste with undertones of fruity sweetness.
Big, foamy head.  Beautiful unfiltered deep amber appearance.  Malted, spicy aroma.  Smooth on the palate - wheat, fruit, spices, yeast.  So good!

A slight malty smell. The color of this beer was a light reddish brown and the head pale beige. The head faded quickly and left little lacing. The taste was light and crisp with just a hint of spices. The dominant flavors were that of barely toasted wheat bread and fruit, perhaps apricots or peaches. Not an outstanding beer, but smooth and very drinkable.

This brewed poured a medium-large white head with small-medium bubbles. There was very little lacing on the sides of my glass. Carbonation was observed rising to the top. It had a fruity aroma to it and it was a bit on the watery side. I did not notice any bitterness or aftertaste with this brew; however, I was disappointed with this brew as I expected it to be better since it is brewed by Ayinger.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2003 This brew poured a medium sized head of finely sized white bubbles and a transparent brown body. It had a mild hop aroma if any aroma at all. Its malty fruity flavor finishes slightly fizzy. We paid $7.49 for this brew which was not worth the price IMHO.
All around good brew from my view.  The best hefe-weizen I've had to date.  Lots of carbonation and very yeasty are the things I notice.

Light amber color.medium head small amount of staying power but not much.Malty,yeast aromasome what spicy,and in some small way a little bread like as the description  say's but very mildly.Malty taste,spicy,well hopped,with some over ripe tones of fruit like possibly apple but more like pear IMO with some lite olive tones to it as well.Over all it's a pretty decent brew and well worth thebucks to get more.

This one pours an ambery orange color with fairly active carbonation and a thin but continual frothy head that just wont go away! The aroma is yeasty and bready with a hint of mango, cloves and perhaps other fruits..mainly dark. The taste is predominated by a yeasty front...heavily yeasty for a german wheat to the point that i was surprised! It's followed up by a nectar like fruity/mango finish with a slight bitter floral dry ending. The carbonation level is very active here as is evidenced by that continual head. Some apple and pear acetic qualities in the aftertaste. Very floral and mango-like for my tastes. A nice beer and a good drink, but held back by those floral mango flavors.

some fine roasted malt to give it more color and flavor than golden hefe- weisse. It has an immense crown of lovely foam held proudly above a robe of translucent amber. On the palate, malt and yeast predominate, with a delicious balance of fruit and bread-like yeast. The taste is complex, with suggestions of soft fruit, apple, and, in the finish, perhaps, even cloves.




 Are you paying attention? I just lifted this from the brewers description, but ya know what? They're on the mark.

(Bottle). Very cloudy, rather murky light brown colour. Like most weissbiers it pours with a large head. Plenty of cloves, ripe bananas, oak and hints of smoke in aroma and flavour. A little more hops for the aftertaste would have been nice, but this is none the less a first class hefe-weizen. Recommended! (Thanks, joss!)
Solid dunkelweiss, very good, drier not as fruity.  Always a good break from the norm.

Dark colour, especially for a wheat. Same semi-opaque characteristics, and a similar wheaty smell. A stronger flavour than any other wheat, but definately good. No banana/clove/yeasty characteristics you would expect from a wheat, but definately good nonetheless. Good head and carbonation.

This is a great, original-style Bavarian wheat beer.  The color is light brown, the aroma just what you expect in such a style.  Flavor is rich, fruity and satisfying.  The high carbonation and pleasant hopping level make it a refreshing drink.  One of the best.

Bottle.  An amber color with a foamy off-white head.  The aroma has that delicate german wheat fragrance with spice, clove, and citrus.  The flavor has banana and spice to compliment the smooth malts.
yeasty aroma, sweet roasted maltiness and lots of yeast and wheat flavors on the finish
Banana, clove and a hint of raisins. Cloudy golden-red, head could be better. Roasted bananas on the tounge. Medium body. Refreshing
copper colored with medium sized head, malty aroma and taste. with hints of banana, apple, and cloves.
Good for a dunkel weizen, but nothing special compared to what can be done. Expected fruitiness present, sweet. Not overly carbonated.
UPDATED: MAR 22, 2003 Vigorous head. Bready aroma. Medium brown color. Malt/yeast flavors predominate, but definate fruity notes. I thought it was OK, but then I'm not a big weissbier fan.
This was the best dunkel weizen I have ever had.  Nice and fruity and very malty.  Highly recommended.
A wheat beer drinkers must try.  Bountiful head, aroma of fruit, not citrus, and cloves. Slightly darker than most wheat beers.  Taste slightly of apple dumplings, fruity doughy feel.  Excellent.

Foam spewed from the bottle upon opening.  Pours a cloudy copper with sufficient head. Dark malty aroma with floral noble hops.  Pleasantly mild with a touch of banana clove spice toward the finish.  A good German wheat even though it required some cleaning up.
Not as dark as Schneider weisse.  Slightly more banana.  Not that complex.  Spicy, but lacking something
couldn´t find much going on except for banana fritters
Huge frothy head (of course), and a nice brown color. Some clove and banana in the aroma. The flavor was sweet, tart, and slightly acidic. Great crisp feel...satisfying.

Brown-orange hazy beer with firm beige head.
Sourish aroma with tones of dried fruit.
Almonds and banana in the mouth.
Harsh and round feeling.

Nice change from regular wheat---darkness threw me for a moment, but the taste is very nice.  Not great, but nice blend of fruity/spicy/malty.  If it were alittle more "full bodied" I would rate it higher, but seems watery compared to best wheats.

Nice tight head that lasts. Colour that reminds of an aged tawny port.  Aroma is full, with nice malty notes, clove and a bit of banana.  Medium length on the tongue, with a mid palate finish and a refreshing length at the end.  The flavour is a bit watered down, but hints at greatness if given fuller extraction.  Quite nice.
Huge head that overflowed. Very yeasty and very cloudy I couldnt see through it at all and it was sitting for two weeks. It was watery in its finish and didt have much of an impact on me.
Smells kinda spicy. Large foamy head. Tastes great.
Yeasty, spicy nose. Seems a bit watery at first, but malt thickens in the mouth nicely. Bitter and Sweet struggle amongst one another nicely. Loved the gentle fruit aromas and flavors.
Smelled like the yummy kind of fruitcake. Tons of flavor and beautiful head. Tasty stuff.

Some fruit taste, but foremost was a strong synthetic plasticy/rubbery flavor that I didnt like. Sour aftertaste with an acetic apple taste throughout. I think they would have been better off leaving the malt out.
Pours dark and cloudy with a large head.  Smells of fruit and cloves.  Darker fruit tastes stand out most in this one.

Murky bamboo color with a huge and creamu amber head. Bubbles stream like a jet to the surface and do a magnificent job maintaining the head. Strong aromas of banana taffy. Flavors of banana and toffee are surrounded by a mouthfeel of burnt toast. Quite an enjoyable darkish wheat.

Yow.  So good.  By far the best wheat beer Ive had.  Intense flavor, with lots or fruit, clove, a bit of spice, mild german hops, and a bit of roasted malt.  Lots of flavors to pick out.  Dark color with a beautiful thick head.  Very smooth, very satisfying, I could live with drinking only this for the rest of my life, if I had to.

An intense rocky white head, like the snow capped peaks of the Bavarian Alps, only thicker.  Banana, passion fruit, and peach aroma.  Smooth palate, not too spritzy.  Burnt orange colour, sort of cloudy.  Banana flavour with some light caramel.  I highly reccomend.

i didnt do this justice in my original rating.   powerful banana aroma with a little bit peach. great nose.   head is so thick, an aboslute mountain.   The beer strugles to break through the head.  I could just look and smell this for days.  Smooth carbonation, just perfect.  Lightly toasted, like putting your toaster on the lightest setting when toasting generic white bread and the bread comes out still white.  very sweet and oh so refreshing.  apples.  i cant get over the head on this.  High school sluts should take notes.
Malty, banana, yeasty aroma. Pours a cloudy amber color with a big, rocky head. Very malty and I detect a little bit of clove flavoring in the finish. Nice wheat beer.
Foggy yellow/orange appearance with a thick head, a bit dim for wheat. Citrus/apple aroma.  Pretty average overall.

Light brown color, large head. Aroma is malty with a slight banana nose. Light bodied dunkel. Mild taste, sweet malts, definite banana and clove flavor, slight hop bite.  Fruity taste, apples and raisins. Light and refreshing. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is smooth and clean. Aftertaste is malty and slightly sweet.

Hazy orange color with a thick light beige head. Some carbonation. This is darker in color than any German Wheat I have had so far. Fruity aroma. I was kind of unimpressed with the taste. There was a definite apple cider feel to it, but it really lacked follow-through. Probably the coolest bottle cap I have seen. What is in the trees, matryoshka dolls?

One of the darker wheats Ive had the pleasure of drinking.  Nice big head with aromas of orange and malt.  A good amount of barley and wheat taste.  A little bit of clove taste, as well.Nice soft finish.

Dark cloudy apple cider color with a fruity scent.  The fruit continues into the taste with a crisp wheat flavor which finishes with no bitterness.  Seems like a fairly hardy beer, which I like.  Overall, a very good wheat that I would get again.
Cloudy, banana scents, light acidic taste, a little bitter.  A good wheat beer. And anyone that says otherwise is a crazy nut.

This pours a nice copper tan with just a hint of fog and a carpet of solid white microbubbles. Cloves abound, mingling with just a slight hint of bubblegum. Theres a distinct apple cider type taste to the intro, setting it up for a subtle sour middle, and a peppery clove finish. This has an interesting taste, though the cidery taste is a bit overpowering compared to the other things going on.

Aromas of banana and cotton candy. It is a darker wheatbeer, witht the typical protein and yeast derived cloudiness. Flavours of yeast, cotton candy, cloves and bananas are decernable with cotton candy predominating. It is sweeter then I like them, making it slighly thin on the palate.  I prefer the cleaner, clove predominating weissbiers like schneider weiss.  This one is closer to Hacker Pschorr.
Ever notice how all these German Wheats are freakingly similar.  LIke they have a big pot that they draw them all out of then put different labels on them.
sweet biscuity aroma, orangy-brown hazy colour.  sweet bananaish flavour.  a little thin, but still a good beer.

Strong aroma, lots of nose. Appearance is that of water coming out of rusty pipes. Nice sweetness to the flavor, and a very pleasant finish. Palate is good, but a bit watery. My overall impression: a good beer. There are definately worse, but there are a few things that could use improvement.
It looks really nice!  Hazy orangey/amber with a beautiful foamy head.  Aroma of yeast, wheat and bananas.  Spicy and wheaty flavors leading to ripe apples.

Right behind Schneider in the Ur-Weisse style. Cloudy dark amber color this a lasting foamy head.  Tends to lean to the more spicy aroma (cloves and slight cinnamon).  Some banana phenols as well.  Yeast and spice flavors blend well with the wheat and malt sweetness.  Finishes quite clean and refreshing.
Aroma of yeast and fruit (apples). Cloudy brownish color, nice head, tasted of apples, some banana, and spice. Sweet yet very refreshing and delicious. A very impressive beer.

60% barley 40% wheat. I dont drink alot of wheat beers, so Im not familiar with anything like this. The well-caramelized barley malt dominates up front with an almost Belgian earthy, bready aroma. Strong toffee, caramel, butterscotch flavors though the wheat makes its presence in a clean, tart finish. A great beer for a warm day when your thirst wants a weiss but your mind  says -  give me something chewy.
Just another dark wheat. Very strong aroma, but there are better dark wheats out there.
Too bad i couldnt lay my hands on a Ayinger Celebrator Doppelbock, but this one was probably the best i could get. Dark appearance. Spicy. Beautiful lacing.
Sweet raisins, fruity, scent of plum. More distensible than other weisses which I also liked. This one is one of the best of that style so far I had.
Not as good as I had Hoped  Clove overtones and bannannas too for some reason just couldnt palate it
Slightly darker than pale wheats.  A fairly sweet finish.  Muddyish flavor throughout.  Unimpressive.
Light brown colour, smooth, tasty.  Very refreshing.

To me, this is better than the other dark wheats Ive tried, because it isnt just banana - lots of spice here (RERATE: and then I tried the Aventinus, heh. Still great, just not the best). Rerate 7/13/02: Had another bottle of this; Ive been drinking a lot of different Hefes recently. While I still like this beer very much, my very positive first impression has been tempered by more experience with German wheats.
This beer rocks. Read the commercial description; it describes this beer to a tee.

Quite generous and nice looking head.  It would be cool to do a seven-minute pour with this stuff, you could probably get the head like 6 inches above the glass!  A bit lighter in color than most dunkles.  Dry wheatiness in the aroma, immensely smooth mouthfeel with some well-balanced maltiness.  Hints of complex fruitiness throughout, perhaps apples, pears, slight cloves, and maybe a hint of chocolate.  Quite excellent!
Re-rate: 6-28-02       I love all of the Ayinger beers and this is no exception. Im not a big dunkel weisse fan, but I found this dunkel to be the best tasting dunkel by far.
Brown ice tea-like color, nice head.  Yeasty and very fruity nose, very appetizing.  Yeasty flavors, light citrusy/wheaty notes.  Every beer ive had by this brewery is good, nice work.
Wheat, yeast and citrus aroma. Cloudy peach colour, huge creamy head. Great wheat flavour, good bitterness. Nice mouthfeel, lots of carbonation. Very good.
A nice dunkelweisse.  Typical bananas, cloves, and spice.  Good balance and very smooth.  Ayinger does a good job, and this is one of my favorite dunkels.
Cloudy brown in color, fruity german bannana-clove yeast.

Okay, this beer has a nice light amber color to it and slight aroma. The head is a medium tan, but it didnt hold, but I dont know how long it had been on the shelf. Interesting flavor with a slight tang to it.

I must say that I am surprised that ratings arent higher for this. I thought it was a phenominal wheat, possibly the best Ive had. The bread of the earth taste hits the tongue and subtle hops and cloves gives it a beautiful finish. A better malt character gives this beer a greater roundness that most wheats just dont have. This is not my favorite style but I was very impressed by this beer.

Pours an off-amber with a decent head and some yeast floaties, not quite as dunkel as Id like. Nose is great--bananas and spice cake. Flavor is a bit disappointing though: some of the banana/spiciness comes through, but its overridden by a tart sweetness.

This was my first dark wheat beer.  I was pretty impressed at the flavor it had.  Amber in color.  Signature wheaty aromas (banana fruity).  Large head white head.  I usually like my wheat beers colder than other beers, but this one was very nice as it warmed.  The flavors became more complex.  The beer tasted like a typical wheat beer some caramel/chocolately tones.  Good carbonation.  I was fairly satisfied with this beer.
A dark and solid wheat dunkel from Ayinger.  Id call this beer middle-of-the-pack for a German dark wheat.  I found the entire Ayinger line-up at a beer store in Brooklyn and am a very happy man.

Clear amber color, the head beige, large, frothy, lace in sheets to coat the glass. Nose?, malt, yeast, earthy and aromatic, front? sweet, top?, medium, finish? dry, lightly acidic, touch of hops, moderate to light carbonation, all in all a very drinkable beer.
Thick white head which dissipated quickly.  Aroma of spicy bananas.  Spicy flavor which turns to a fruity, almost candylike, finish.  Not at all what I expected.

Cloudy iced tea appearance with some small yeast chunks. Foamy off white head with some cocoa powder flecks. Light color for a Dunkel Weizen. Heavy carbonation. Doughy aroma with some cloves, cocoa and apples. Nicely malted with a mellow body and light wheat tang and sour fruitiness. Lighter in body but not in flavor. Lingering roasted chocolate aftertaste. Finishes mellow and lightly tart with an apple/chocolate mix. Quite nice, but thinner than Id like, and again a pricey choice.
A fruity, full-bodied dunkel. Sweet malt flavor, smootj finish.

A big bottle of this answered my craving for some Wheat beer.  This brew pours a hazy medium golden. Floaties.  The colossal rocky bone colored head is fully lasting with fair lacing.  The nose is very fruity: banana, bubble-gum, grape, apple, etc.  Some spices like ginger aroma also present along with caramel, cereal, and flowers.  Finishes like it starts very sweet, kinda acidic, and somewhat bitter.  Overall very rich, sweet and fruity.  The medium creamy/dry body has lively carbonation with an alcoholic feel to the finish.  Ahhh!!

The fizzy nature of this beer spoiled it on many levels.  The weak taste of the dark component of this beer was disappointing as well.  Of course this beer is millions of times better than stuff like Becks, Molson, Newcastle and others beers that most people think are great.
Smooth summer style beer with a nice hint of sweetness to it.  Decent color and head tops off this spicy finished beer.  Good stuff.
hops dominated....good beer....my first dunkel wheat

Light amber with med head that dissipated very quickly.  Citrusy and spicy aroma.  Wonderful sweetness with great clove spiciness and a refreshing acidity.  Zesty and refreshing, finishing with some green apples tones.  Great flavor but not the total package.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2012 Bottle.

Head is initially large, creamy/frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is hazy medium amber, bottle conditioned.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted bread, caramel), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with a strong note of banana/gum/marshmallow, hint of pepper.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly to moderately acidic.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.

Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation.

Quite the banana-candy bomb...cant say its unpleasant, but more malt and hop presence would help a lot, as would stronger pepper or clove phenols.  In the mouth its quite sweet...not enough tartness to clean things up.  Its a "rich" example I suppose but its too sweet and banana-heavy to be a winner.

Hazy ot quite copper. Suspended yeast particles throughout with nice head. Nose of bananas, spices and maybe apple. Soft, lively and almost creamy in the mouth. Flavors of cloves,spice,apples, and yeast. Maybe a tad too sweet? Pretty good and quite quaffable.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2003 Nice cloudy copperish brown appearance. Snow white head that stayed around for the duration. Body a little less that medium with high carbonation. A little light on the palate. Fruity, spicy flavor with hint of clove. Very drinkable and enjoyable beer.  Almost as good as Aventinus.
Dark & full of taste.
I wasnt terribly fond of the nose and taste of fermented apple juice, espically not with a wheat beer.  Way too carbonated.
nose of apple, and spices, color is medium brown, cloudy, sweet flavor, sweet finish of spices, I enjoyed this beer, although Im not very familiar with this style.

The first thing I noticed after the pour was the great head that stayed with the beer for a while.  It was very clear for a wheat, which was unexpected.  The aroma was very fruity as was the flavor with a very dry finish.  It had a lot of body in the flavor, but the carbonation overpowered it in my opinion.  It was a good beer, but I have had better.  By the way, I drank this while putting up our family Christmas tree this year, so an early Merry Christmas to you all.  (Yeah, I had some SN Celebration Ale too...mmmmmm)
Sort of like a combination bock-weiss beer, and sort of successful.  Nice balance of malt and hops, but somewhat undermined by a serious carbonation issue.  This aint 7up, guys!  Smooth it out!

A nice darker weiss. 
lot of natural fruit flavors and aromas.
strikes a very good malt/wheat balance.
Decent head and faint barley-wine-like aroma. Layered when poured. Quite dark for this style, almost green. Too much malt but generally respectable; your call.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2003 A great beer.  The flavor was unbelievable. It didn't taste like an average beer, it was really good.  I would feel bad getting drunk to something as good as this. Absolutely great with lasagna.
There is no doubt that this beer is rather highly carbonated, but I really like the banana flavor.
I enjoyed this as an after dinner drink. Goes well with a little lemon slice. I can get them fairly cheap. So I will buy again.
Theres a weird nose on this. Ive had a few great local versions of this style in Germany, more crisp, slightly darker, and perhaps even more effervescent but with less tendency to foam.
A fair beer, looked great, but sadly had a very unipressive taste, which was compounded by loose, foamy bubbles that were not creamy at all. Its not terrible, but not worth my time to drink again.

My 100th Rating! A fair beer.  Foamy (not creamy) head contained coarse bubbles, an indication of artificial carbonation.  The lackluster taste, along with its fizziness, account for my rather unfavorable opinion of this brew.  Looked great; a very dark, cloudy brown, with a lot of sediment.  However, the taste was so muted I was not able to distinguish individual flavors, and half way through the glass I stopped caring.
brown colour, big head, banana aroma, sweet, corn, full-bodied
Not what I was expecting.  It doesnt lack in flavor, but that flavor doesnt appeal to me.
Tasted and smelled a little smokey.  I dont like smokey.  Other than that it was okay.  Fruity.
Pretty tasty dark wheat.  Nice aroma and flavor.  Smooth body, and nicely carbonated.  Good stuff.

Very nice dunkel weisse.  I for one cant seem to detect the banana tones everyone else does, but the aroma is that of a hefe, for sure.  I couldt believe how much yeast was in this - when poured, it looked like thick apple cider (not hard).  Very nice flavor, definite fruity tones.  Mellow aftertaste.
Banana like aroma and taste like so many wheat beers. Maybe not quite enough bang, but still enough confirmation that this is quality.
